speaker: Dimitri
text: This will be your first time at the monastery. I’d be happy to show you around.

speaker: Claude
text: It really is Fódlan in a nutshell. The good and the bad.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Like it or not, we’ll be there soon enough.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There it is. Garreg Mach Monastery.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Rhea's here.

speaker: Rhea
text: I wonder... Did the flow of time bring you here?

speaker: Jeralt
text: It's been years since I've last set eyes on this place. To be forced to see her now...

speaker: Byleth
text: Her?

speaker: Jeralt
text: You saw her in the courtyard earlier, didn't you? The archbishop...Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: You've been here before?

speaker: Jeralt
text: I've never spoken of this to you before, but...many years ago, I was a knight here. I reported to the archbishop...Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: The archbishop?

speaker: Byleth
text: Lady Rhea?

speaker: Jeralt
text: As you know, the majority of folks in Fódlan are devout followers of the teachings of Seiros. The leader of that ridiculously large religious organization is the archbishop, Lady Rhea.

speaker: Seteth
text: Thank you for your patience, Jeralt. My name is Seteth. I am an advisor to the archbishop.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Right. Hello.

speaker: Rhea
text: It has been a long time, Jeralt. I wonder…was it the will of the goddess that we have another chance meeting like this?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Forgive my silence all these years. Much has happened since we last spoke.

speaker: Rhea
text: So I see. The miracle of fatherhood has blessed you. That is your child, is it not?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Yes...born many years after I left this place. I wish I could introduce you to the mother of my child...but I’m afraid we lost her to illness.

speaker: Rhea
text: I see. My condolences. As for you…I heard of your valiant efforts from Alois. What is your name?

speaker: Byleth
text: My name is...

speaker: Rhea
text: A fine name indeed.

speaker: Seteth
text: You must at least show the basic courtesy of telling us your name! Do you not think you are being a bit rude to the archbishop?

speaker: Rhea
text: It is all right, Seteth. My dear, I am called Rhea. I am the archbishop of the Church of Seiros. In truth, I was only being polite. I already know your name. And a fine name it is.

speaker: Rhea
text: From the bottom of my heart, I thank you for saving those students of the Officers Academy.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Hmph.

speaker: Rhea
text: Jeralt. You already know what it is I wish to say, do you not?

speaker: Jeralt
text: You want me to rejoin the Knights of Seiros, don’t you. I won’t say no, but…

speaker: Rhea
text: Your apprehension stings. I had expected that Alois would have already asked this of you. I must step away for now, but I expect they will desire a word with you soon. Please listen carefully to what they have to say. Until tomorrow… Farewell.

speaker: Jeralt
text: I can’t believe it. Forced back into the Knights of Seiros. I’m sorry I dragged you into this. Looks like I’ll be stuck here for a while…and I’m afraid your services are requested as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: As a mercenary?

speaker: Byleth
text: As a servant?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Nothing like that. They want you to teach, by the sound of it. You heard those brats earlier talking about the Officers Academy, right? Well, the academy just happens to be short a professor. And apparently that damned Alois went and recommended you to Lady Rhea.

speaker: Manuela
text: So. You must be the new professor. My, how stern and handsome you are!

speaker: Jeralt
text: Er, no. I’m not the one you’re looking for. You can handle things from here. Good luck.  And…watch out for Lady Rhea. I don’t know what she’s thinking, making you a professor like this. She may be up to something. Stay on your guard.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh. It's you, then? So young...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Competence and age are not necessarily correlated, as you well know. I am Hanneman, a Crest scholar and professor at the Officers Academy. I wonder if you bear a Crest of your own. When next you have a moment to spare, I insist that you pay me a visit so we can delve into the subject further.

speaker: Manuela
text: I’m Manuela. I’m a professor, a physician, a songstress, and available. It’s nice to meet you.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're a physician?

speaker: Manuela
text: I look too pretty for that line of work, do I? But yes, when I’m not teaching, I can be found in the infirmary. If you’re ever lonely, please do come and pay me a visit. I would love to–

speaker: Byleth
text: You're a songstress?

speaker: Manuela
text: Of course. Before I came here, I belonged to a renowned opera company. Perhaps you've heard of me? The Mittelfrank Opera Company's beautiful, peerless–

speaker: Hanneman
text: Spare our colleague the needless chatter, Manuela. Now then, it seems you’ll be taking charge of one of the academy’s three houses. I expect you haven’t yet been briefed on the nature of each, have you?

speaker: Manuela
text: Do you really not know? Fine, I’ll do you a favor and explain. The Officers Academy is comprised of three houses of students, each of which is closely affiliated with its region of origin. The Black Eagle House is for students from the Adrestian Empire. Their house leader this year is Edelgard, the Imperial princess, who is in line to be the next emperor.

speaker: Hanneman
text: The Blue Lion House is for students from the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus. Their house leader this year is Prince Dimitri. He is to be the next king of Faerghus.

speaker: Manuela
text: Lastly, there is the Golden Deer House, which is for students of the Leicester Alliance. Their house leader is Claude, grandson to Duke Riegan, the leader of the Alliance.

speaker: Hanneman
text: To think that the next emperor, king and sovereign duke are all here. It certainly is a promising year for the academy.

speaker: Manuela
text: I’ll say. I just hope none of those little treasures cause any trouble.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Hm, quite. For now, I suggest taking a stroll around the academy to get your bearings. And when you’ve a moment, please stop by my research laboratory.

speaker: Manuela
text: The old man has a point. Oh, and keep in mind that I’ve only notified the house leaders that you’re our new professor. It’s more fun that way. I suggest you try spending time with the students. Some odd ducks in that bunch, but they’re good kids. I’m sure Lady Rhea will have more information for you tomorrow, but that should get you going. Good luck. You’ll need it.

speaker: Seteth
text: Have you no intention of changing your mind, Rhea? Appointing a stranger–a child no less!–as a professor at our esteemed academy is–

speaker: Rhea
text: I have made my decision, Seteth. I know worrying comes naturally to you, but there is truly no need. That “stranger” is Jeralt’s flesh and blood, after all.

speaker: Seteth
text: I can’t say that’s all too comforting. How trustworthy is this Jeralt character? Is he not the man who went missing after the great fire 21 years ago? I would remind you that Flayn is now here with us as well. I beg of you…please consider whether this is an unnecessary risk.

speaker: Rhea
text: Seteth. They have my trust. Let that be enough for you as well. More importantly, I have received a report from Shamir. I am increasingly concerned about a matter regarding our suspicious individual. We cannot ignore those who harbor ill will towards the church, especially if they are frequenting Garreg Mach.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, that matter is of great importance as well. I shall continue my investigation. Rhea… For now, I will have faith that you are placing your trust with the utmost care. I pray that nothing occurs to shake that confidence.

speaker: Rhea
text: I assume you are already aware that you will be teaching here at the Officers Academy. Correct? To start, please speak with the three house leaders. You should also take a look around the academy and acquaint yourself with your new home. That is your first task here at the monastery. Please let me know if you accept it. Once you have finished, come and speak with me.

speaker: Rhea
text: You should speak with every student you can. This might be your only chance to see what they're really like before you become a professor...

speaker: Rhea
text: You are responsible for choosing which house to lead. If there are still students you have yet to speak with, try visiting each house's homeroom.

speaker: Alois
text: Ha! I imagine you were a bit surprised that I recommended you as a professor here. Frankly, we had someone else in mind for the role, but they ran off during our dustup with the bandits. Can't entrust students to someone who's abandoned them once before, huh?

speaker: Seteth
text: You saved the lives of the students you came across. That, at least, was admirable. Now, you should make the rounds. Go around the monastery and see that you greet everyone.

speaker: Edelgard
text: So you've accepted a teaching position here... Pity. I was hoping you would lend your strength to the Empire. I never properly introduced myself, did I? My name is Edelgard von Hresvelg. I am the princess and heir apparent to the Adrestian Empire. I wonder if you'll be tasked with leading the Black Eagles... I hope you've had a chance to meet everyone. Would you like to know more about any of the Black Eagles?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Me? Well...some think I'm a bit distant. Arrogant, even. But there's little to be done. One day, I must rise to become Adrestia's next emperor. What else... Well, it seems to me that we may have similar personalities.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hubert is the heir of Marquis Vestra. He has served me since I was a child. You may think his blood runs a bit cold, but... Heh, actually, that's rather accurate. Still, if you can get past that, you'll see he's quite astute and reasonable.

speaker: Edelgard
text: For some reason, he thinks of me as a bitter rival and is always trying to challenge me. It's terribly irritating. His house is that of Duke Aegir, which produces Adrestia's Prime Ministers. That family is...perhaps too pleased with its own status.

speaker: Edelgard
text: He's remarkably intelligent, but he only wishes to apply himself to tasks that particularly interest him and nothing else. He's also fond of...well, napping. If he had any work ethic or sense of duty to speak of, I suppose he would be destined to become an official of the Empire.

speaker: Edelgard
text: He's the second son of Count Bergliez. He has no inheritance in his future, which is perhaps why he's always so eager to prove himself. He's overly energetic and rushes headfirst into any battle. If he ends up in your care, be sure to keep a close eye on him.

speaker: Edelgard
text: She's Count Varley's only daughter. I suppose you could say she's a bit eccentric, but she seems like a gentle soul. I believe she's shut herself away in her quarters and doesn't care to leave, but...don't worry. I'll make sure she finds her way to class.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Few commoners have joined the Black Eagle House, but Dorothea is an exception. She's a songstress from a famous opera company in the Empire. I'm not entirely sure what brought her to the Officers Academy.

speaker: Edelgard
text: To the west of Fódlan is an archipelago called Brigid. Petra is the granddaughter of their king. Brigid is a vassal state of the Empire, which is how she came to be enrolled here. She's incredibly smart and studious.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Please accept my apologies for the other day. You came to our aid, yet I hadn't even the courtesy to properly introduce myself. I am Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd, crown prince of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus. Of course, at the academy I am simply a student. And I've heard word that you are to become a professor here. Delightful news. I still have much to learn, but I'm confident I could benefit greatly from your guidance. In any case, welcome to the monastery. I hear you're investigating the different houses. Did any of the Blue Lions catch your attention?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Me? Oh. Um. Please forgive me... It's difficult to open up on the spot, don't you think? I'm afraid my story has not been a pleasant one... I do hope that doesn't color your view of me, but I understand if that can't be helped.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue was born in Duscur, and has been loyally working in my service for the past four years. He's rather taciturn, but once you get to know him, you'll see he's a kind and good-natured young man.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Felix is the heir to House Fraldarius. He has a bit of a sharp tongue, but don't let that fool you. Deep down, he's a good guy. He gravitates towards people who are skilled. Perhaps you would enjoy a friendly competition with him sometime.

speaker: Dimitri
text: He's the adoptive son of Lord Lonato of Castle Gaspard, but I hear he was born a commoner. He has an extremely earnest personality, so I'm certain he will approach your lectures with great enthusiasm.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Sylvain is the heir to House Gautier. He is a capable person who highly values his friends. That said... Well, he's always been a bit of a...ahem, skirt chaser, so to speak. Pardon my bluntness. I speak with him about it often, but it doesn't seem to help.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I hear she was born to Imperial nobility, but a twist of fate brought her to the Kingdom. She may seem carefree on the surface, but she's actually a kind soul who pays careful attention to everyone around her.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Annette is Baron Dominic's niece. She is a talented student who scored extremely high marks at the Royal School of Sorcery. She's cheerful and hardworking. Brilliant, really. Though she can be a bit oblivious at times. I hear she caused an explosion in the kitchen last night...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ingrid is Count Galatea's daughter. She is also a childhood friend of Felix, Sylvain and myself. She is diligent, industrious, and principled. In truth, she is more knightly than most knights you will ever meet.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, well. Scored a teaching gig here, did ya? Talk about a great first impression. I guess that means I'd better introduce myself properly. I'm Claude von Riegan. I'm from the ruling house of the Leicester Alliance, but don't worry too much about all that madness. I'm guessing you don't know which class you'll be teaching yet, do you? I bet you'd like ours. We're not as...difficult as the other two. Have you met the folks from the Golden Deer House yet? Care to know more about anyone?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Claude
text: (laughs) Piqued your interest, have I? As luck would have it, I'm pretty curious about you as well. But what's life without a bit of mystery? Let's just spend the next year or so learning about each other, little by little.

speaker: Claude
text: He's the heir of Gloucester territory. If you haven't already picked up on it, he's a bit arrogant and fancies himself a lady's man. That said, deep down he's really devoted and honest... Though I wouldn't mind never hearing him talk about his noble obligations ever again.

speaker: Claude
text: He comes from a merchant family, but his parents died in an accident. Seems like he's had a rough life. Despite all that, he's just about the most cheerful guy you'll ever meet. His passions are training, eating, and... Actually, that's about it.

speaker: Claude
text: He's the second son of a merchant family. Since his brother will inherit the business, he's training to become a knight. If you ask me, doesn't seem like he truly wants to be a knight... He's probably just doing it to please his parents...

speaker: Claude
text: Lysithea is the daughter of Count Ordelia, and is probably the youngest student here. But watch out! She gets angry if you treat her like a child. As for me, I do it on purpose. You have to make your own fun in this place, you know?

speaker: Claude
text: Marianne is Margrave Edmund's daughter...and that's pretty much all I know about her. She doesn't interact much with other students, so I wouldn't be surprised if a lot of folks here have never even heard her speak.

speaker: Claude
text: Hilda is the only daughter of Duke Goneril. It seems her father and brother coddle her quite a bit. If you look up "lazy" in the dictionary...her picture won't be there because she never got around to submitting it. Not too unusual for a noble, I guess.

speaker: Claude
text: Leonie enrolled because she wants to be a mercenary. I think she said that her father is a hunter. She's pretty blunt and as stingy as they come. A habitual saver, too. I think she's hoping to repay her village for helping to send her here.

speaker: Byleth
text: (I suppose I should return to Rhea...)

speaker: Student
text: This is the classroom of the Black Eagle House, which is for students from the Adrestian Empire. Our house leader is Princess Edelgard. There are many other nobles among our ranks as well.

speaker: Hubert
text: I am Hubert. A humble servant of Lady Edelgard. I heard you came to the aid of Her Highness. You have my most sincere thanks. This is Petra. She has come all the way from Brigid to study in the Empire. Back on her archipelago, she is actually a princess. In Fódlan terms, she would be called heir to the throne.

speaker: Petra
text: Hello. I am called Petra. I am pleased to be meeting with-- No, I am pleased to have met you.

speaker: Caspar
text: Is it true that you saved Edelgard? That's incredible! The name's Caspar, by the way. Pleased to meet ya!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Linhardt. Good-bye.

speaker: Caspar
text: Yeesh, Linhardt. How'd you get into the academy with those manners? So, are you a student here too? Maybe we'll be in the same class!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ah! What?! I don't talk to strangers!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Bernadetta, this is no stranger! Our house leader owes this person a great debt. Is that not right? (To Byleth) I am Ferdinand von Aegir, legitimate son of the Aegir family, the Empire's foremost house. Are you going to join our class? I look forward to getting better acquainted with you.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Well, aren't you just lovely. Is this your first time in the monastery? Shall I show you around? Oh, my name is Dorothea. Before I joined the academy, I was a member of an opera company in the Empire. You should hear me sing sometime.

speaker: Student
text: This classroom belongs to the Blue Lion House. Our house leader is Prince Dimitri. All of us here hail from the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Well, well! It must be my lucky day today, being approached by such a beauty. I'm Sylvain Jose Gautier. Feel free to say hi whenever you like.

speaker: Mercedes
text: And who's this? You don't look familiar at all. Do you work here at the monastery?

speaker: Annette
text: Oh, Mercie! Do you think this is that mercenary people have been talking about?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Now that I think about it, that does sound like something Dimitri may have said... I suppose you'll be enrolling at the Officers Academy too, then? Well, it's a pleasure to meet you. My name is Mercedes, and this is my best friend–

speaker: Annette
text: I'm Annette! It's nice to meet you.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I have heard all about what you did from Prince Dimitri. As a citizen of Faerghus, I thank you.

speaker: Felix
text: He also said you're quite skilled. And he doesn't just say things like that. I look forward to sparring with you and beating you.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Felix, must you always speak of fighting right away? Oh! And, uh...you may call me Ingrid. It is a pleasure to make your acquaintance.

speaker: Ashe
text: Hi, there! You must be the one everyone's talking about. I'm Ashe. Great to meet you. This here is Dedue. He serves Prince Dimitri.

speaker: Dedue
text: I have heard that you rescued His Highness. Words cannot express my gratitude. Should you ever require my strength, please know that I will hasten to repay this debt.

speaker: Student
text: The Golden Deer House is for students of the Leicester Alliance. Our house leader is heir to the Alliance's leadership, House Riegan. We have plenty of other prominent nobles as well!

speaker: Raphael
text: Are you someone's guest? The dining hall's that way if that's what you're looking for.

speaker: Leonie
text: No, Raphael. That's Captain Jeralt's kid. Hi, I'm Leonie Pinelli–Captain Jeralt's first and greatest apprentice! I'm sure he's told you about me?

speaker: Raphael
text: Nice to meet you! I'm Raphael Kirsten. Who are you again?

speaker: Hilda
text: Hey, are you that mercenary? Everyone's been talking about you. I'm Hilda Valentine Goneril. And her name is...

speaker: Marianne
text: M-Marianne von Edmund...

speaker: Hilda
text: Are you joining the Knights of Seiros or something? Well, I look forward to seeing more of you!

speaker: Lysithea
text: So you're the skilled mercenary who saved Claude, are you?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Oh, you are? It's such an honor to meet you! Ignatz Victor. My parents are Alliance merchants.

speaker: Lysithea
text: And I am Lysithea von Ordelia. Please do not forget it.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Ah. You must be the renowned mercenary who rescued Claude. Honestly, you should not have troubled yourself over the likes of him. My name is Lorenz Hellman Gloucester. You will want to remember it.

speaker: Jeritza
text: What do you want?  I am Jeritza. I teach here. Weapon instruction. These are the training grounds. Good-bye.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings! You must be the new professor. What a pleasure!  As for me, my job is to stand here at this glorious entrance and leisurely watch over the comings and goings of everyone. Make folks smile, you know?  Er...and by that, I mean...to vigilantly guard this entrance with my very life! No levity whatsoever. As of now, nothing to report.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Here I am again, the office of the captain of the knights. That said, I'm merely here to assist. Apparently the current captain is getting on in years. I hear the captain has a hard time keeping up with the responsibilities of the job.  That's where I come in.

speaker: Hanneman
text: This is my research laboratory. I've worked hard to furnish it with the rare materials and purpose-built equipment required for my work.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh, Professor! Dropping by so soon? I expected we'd take some time. Exchange a few smiles as we passed in the hall, flirt a bit, you know... Well, you're here now, and I do like a man who knows what he wants. Lock the door. Huh. That welcome didn't faze you at all, did it? What's the matter? Don't you like me? Or...are you just so innocent you don't understand me?

speaker: Cyril
text: I'm real busy, so could you please move along now? Thanks. OK now, what else did Lady Rhea need doing today?

speaker: Tomas
text: Welcome to the library. Here you may find literature from the far reaches of Fódlan.  I am Tomas, the librarian. If you have need of me, do not hesitate to ask. I have worked here for...hm. I have lost track of the decades, it seems.

speaker: Rhea
text: How are you enjoying your time at the academy thus far? I hope you have found our halls brimming with the vitality of well-intentioned souls.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hm. I suppose it is time for you to take charge of one of our three houses of students. I must note that I am personally against entrusting someone as lacking in trackable history as yourself with such a task, but it is as the archbishop desires.

speaker: Manuela
text: The Black Eagles, the Blue Lions, and the Golden Deer… All so different. I hope you’ve made it a point to get to know each of them.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Since you are new here, we have decided to allow you first pick. Manuela and I will take charge of the remaining two houses.

speaker: Byleth
text: (Which house will I choose...)

speaker: Rhea
text: Are you having trouble deciding? Please, open your heart to the will of the goddess and choose carefully.

speaker: Rhea
text: So, you have chosen the Black Eagles, led by Edelgard, correct?

speaker: Rhea
text: So, you have chosen the Blue Lions, led by Dimitri, correct?

speaker: Rhea
text: So, you have chosen the Golden Deer, led by Claude, correct?

speaker: Rhea
text: Your heart has made its choice, then. All I ask is that you guide these open minds with virtue, care, and sincerity.

speaker: Seteth
text: They are all promising youths who bear the weight of Fódlan’s future upon their shoulders. I hope you appreciate what an honor it is to lead them.

speaker: Flayn
text: Brother? Oh! I am so sincerely sorry! I did not mean to interrupt.

speaker: Seteth
text: I am in the middle of something, Flayn. Is it urgent?

speaker: Flayn
text: No, no, it’s nothing. More importantly... Who is this?

speaker: Seteth
text: This is our newest professor at the academy.

speaker: Flayn
text: Oh my! A new addition to the Officers Academy! I am so very pleased to meet you, Professor. I am Seteth’s little sister, Flayn. I am so happy to make your acquaintance.

speaker: Seteth
text: Let us focus on the topic at hand. There is something you should be aware of. In a few days’ time, there will be a mock battle between the three houses, intended to gauge the current progress of the students. We will be using this battle as an opportunity to ascertain your own abilities as well. Please do not disappoint the archbishop. That is all.

speaker: Caspar
text: Wait. So our new professor is...you?! I didn't see that one coming.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Easy, Caspar. Aren't you being a bit rude?

speaker: Linhardt
text: You know it's a waste of time to expect politeness from him.  It will be a pleasure learning from you, Professor. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to take a nap.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ah! Don't look at me like that! Oh, and...please don't talk to me too much either.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I'm sorry for the chaos you've walked into...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I hear we are rather close in age, Professor. I hope you do not mind if we treat you like one of us. In our class, we try to treat each other as equals, despite any differences in age or status. Personally, I would love to include you in that inner circle.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't mind at all.

speaker: Petra
text: You have a gut, Professor. I will take great joy from your teachings.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Petra, I believe you mean to say that our professor has guts. That's a bit different from having a gut. You can't go around saying someone so slim and attractive has a gut!

speaker: Petra
text: Oh! Please take my apologies. I have not yet mastered this language.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, I want you to know that it's perfectly acceptable for you to treat me as you do the others. I may be the Imperial Princess, but here at the academy, I'm just another student. That said, know that I have high expectations of you. And high hopes. But I'm certain you can lead the Black Eagle House to greatness.

speaker: Caspar
text: Sure, sure. Now, let's break the ice with a training session! I want to see our new teacher in action.

speaker: Petra
text: Why will the ice be broken? Is this a custom I have missed in my studies?

speaker: Caspar
text: Not real ice, just the ice of...um--- Well, it just means let's get to know each other.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I don't wanna train! Let's stay in the classroom and...learn from a book.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Let's all calm down and have a nice cup of tea, how about? Doesn't that sound lovely, Professor?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I know we all agreed to treat each other as equals, but there is a limit to what I can tolerate. The esteemed Black Eagle House requires order.

speaker: Hubert
text: Looks like your first job will be to quiet down this racket. I don't envy you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ugh, they're not normally this...rowdy. I do hope you can manage, Professor.

speaker: Annette
text: Wait, does this mean our new professor is-- No! I really can't believe it! But I was speaking to you so casually, as though we were companions! Oh, I am so sorry, Professor; you just look the same age as the rest of us, and-- Oh, and I’m sorry I just said that too! I really must watch my tongue…

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't mind if you treat me as a friend.

speaker: Annette
text: You say that, but...I just don't know about all of this.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'll admit, it doesn't sit well with me either. After all, we wish to show you due respect.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Sure, but if the professor says it OK, shouldn’t that be enough? That is, if Your Highness can consent to such a thing. After all, we’re already speaking this way to our future king, so we may as well relax our speech with our professor too, right?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Well, we’re not in the Kingdom, so it only goes to follow that we should all speak companionably.  I concede. If the professor says it’s fine, we ought to accept that kindness gratefully.

speaker: Ingrid
text: As for me, I'm not sure I can manage.

speaker: Mercedes
text: You don’t have to force yourself if it’s too difficult. You’re fine with that too, right, Professor?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Such benevolence is a sight to behold! I don't suppose you would care to join me for tea? We could discuss education...and marriage.

speaker: Felix
text: Control yourself, Sylvain. I have more important matters to discuss with our new professor.

speaker: Felix
text: Having heard of your skills, I'm eager to meet you in battle. Come to the training ground later. There, you will show me what you’re capable of.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You aren't wasting any time, are you, Felix? As it were, count me in for any such battle.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph.

speaker: Ashe
text: Pardon me, but I would also love to observe you in battle, for future reference. If that’s OK with you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ashe, I don’t have you speak of merely watching. You should join us as well.

speaker: Mercedes
text: If you get injured, simply say the word, and I’ll patch you up straight away!

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness, do take care not to go overboard.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You worry too much, Dedue. I'll be fine, I promise.

speaker: Sylvain
text: My companions, is there not something inherently wrong with crossing blades, as a way to bond with each other?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Huh, I never thought of it that way. Well, if that’s how you feel, I suppose you’ll just stay behind while the rest of us are at the training ground?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ingrid, my dearest friend! You really are too hard on me.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Well then, Professor, what do you think? As you can see, the Blue Lion House is a lively bunch, but you’ll fine none who work harder. I’m certain we’ll cause our fair share of trouble, but I’m very much looking forward to the year ahead.

speaker: Hilda
text: Wait, what?! Are you really our new homeroom professor?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Is that true? You aren't quite what I pictured. Oh, sorry, I didn't mean that the way it sounded.

speaker: Hilda
text: I was sure you'd be roped into joining the knights!

speaker: Claude
text: Don't tell me, you chose this class just to get to know me better, right? I'm flattered, really.  Whoops. Now that you're our professor, maybe I should choose my words more carefully.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't mind.

speaker: Claude
text: Oh? Well, then. Since we're pretty close in age and all, I suppose formalities aren't all that necessary.

speaker: Lorenz
text: One must truly marvel at the exceptionality of this appointment. Becoming a teacher to students almost the same age as yourself. How...unusual. I've heard you are a skilled mercenary, but I cannot shake my discomfort at your new position.

speaker: Raphael
text: Are you really as strong as they say? Let's see your biceps! I bet I've packed on more muscle than you!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I doubt that. Apparently our new professor was personally recommended by Alois, one of the knights.

speaker: Claude
text: As far as skill goes, I saw it with my own eyes. What's more, Teach here is the child of the most renowned former captain of the Knights of Seiros.

speaker: Leonie
text: I heard. There's no way a child of the captain isn't worthy. It's simply not possible.

speaker: Lysithea
text: The Captain? Who are you talking about?

speaker: Leonie
text: Captain Jeralt, of course, the most notable captain of the Knights of Seiros and a peerless mercenary.

speaker: Byleth
text: He's not that well known...

speaker: Byleth
text: You're exaggerating a bit.

speaker: Leonie
text: Hmph! It doesn't matter what you think of him. Captain Jeralt deserves nothing but respect.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Hm. Well, after working as a mercenary alongside a father figure such as he, I have high hopes for our professor.

speaker: Hilda
text: Just because someone is special... doesn't mean their children are special too, Lysithea. Assuming that a child is going to be exceptional just because of their lineage is a bad idea.  Don't you agree, Marianne?

speaker: Marianne
text: Huh? Oh, um, yes, I suppose so.

speaker: Leonie
text: Well, we can find out for ourselves in battle. I can't wait to see what tactics you've learned from the captain.

speaker: Raphael
text: A battle? Shouldn't we have a welcome party or something first? I'll get the meat.

speaker: Lorenz
text: How savage. I propose a nice conversation over tea instead. I am more than willing to procure some high-quality leaves.

speaker: Raphael
text: Tea? You can't get to know someone over tea. If there's no meat involved, it's not a party.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Your common sensibilities are grating to my noble ears. Please quiet yourself.

speaker: Claude
text: Sorry for the bickering, Teach. As you can see, the Golden Deer is a rowdy bunch. We're not especially unified. You'll find nobles and commoners alike here-- those who are dedicated to their studies alongside slackers. But hey, that just makes your life more exciting, right? I really hope you're looking forward to the year ahead as much as I am.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Say, while you're here...I'd like to use this device I designed to determine whether the power of a Crest resides within you. Won't hurt a bit. Promise. You don’t know about Crests? Well, allow me to tell you everything–absolutely everything–about them. Is your calendar clear? This will take a while. Crests are a fascinating topic, but before one can dive deeply into said topic, one must first understand what Crests are. They are power incarnate. They are said to have been bestowed upon humans by the goddess countless ages ago. They exist within the flesh, and are passed down through bloodlines. Those who carry crests may excel at magic, display exceptional strength, or any number of boons. Each Crest has its own power, the nature of which is beyond mortal understanding. For now.

speaker: Byleth
text: And you believe I have a Crest?

speaker: Hanneman
text: I suspect as much, yes. But we won’t know for sure unless I look into the matter. As I said, Crests are passed down through the blood. However, just because someone carries a Crest does not necessarily mean their descendants will inherit it as well. Only a scarce few descendants of a Crest’s bloodline end up inheriting that Crest’s power. Perhaps one of your ancestors bore a Crest, and you just happened to inherit it. That is how a Crest usually presents itself, after all.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do what you can to find out.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Yes, of course. I'll get to the bottom of it straight away.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's no need to look into it.

speaker: Hanneman
text: I most strongly disagree! There absolutely is a need. My Crest research is of critical importance to the church, I'll have you know. Since you are now a professor here, I must insist that you aid in my research. Of course...there are those who lack the foresight to aid in my endeavors, such as that stubborn Seteth. But such individuals are the rare exception.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Now then, please go ahead and hold out your arm over this device here.

speaker: Hanneman
text: What is this?! A pattern I’ve never seen before…Is it possible an as-yet undiscovered Crest has been detected? To think there are still Crests out there that even I am unaware of! How thrilling! Ahem… Pardon my unrestrained jubilation. I have much to consider. You may leave now. I have more research to do in regard to this Crest. Yes, so very much more research. But for now, your work here is done.  Hmm… What could this line here be indicating? Perhaps it represents a lack of symmetry… or perhaps… What in the world? Oh, I see… It may be connected to that, but to a greater degree than usual…

speaker: Rhea
text: With each moon, professors of the Officers Academy receive a schedule for the month ahead. It notes the days on which events and missions will take place that month. Pay careful attention to your schedule so that you may thoughtfully plan what you intend to do each month, and when.

speaker: Byleth
text: (So, this is my room... I thought I heard a girl's voice...but I must have been imagining things.)

speaker: Edelgard
text: Some believe the dignity of the Empire rests on the results of the mock battle. That's an overstatement, of course. Still, we must do our best to prevail. You should take the time to learn each student's abilities. Perhaps some extra lessons and training sessions are in order? You look as if you have no idea what's going on here. I know my way around, so I'm happy to help you find your footing.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The monastery has some exceptional facilities that everyone who lives at the Officers Academy is welcome to make use of. For example, you can enjoy a meal with your students at the dining hall or take part in some one-on-one sparring at the training grounds. I suggest visiting the various facilities whenever you have the time to spare. It's a great way to get to know the students, faculty, and various workers here.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Have you noticed the bulletin boards placed around the monastery? Those contain requests people have posted, as well as helpful information from the market. If you prove yourself by helping people with their requests, certain facilities here will become available for your use. The bulletin board is updated frequently, so I suggest checking it at least once a month.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You should take your time when speaking with everyone, but when it comes to using the facilities... Well, you need to be more careful with that. If you use them without planning ahead, your free time will be gone before you know it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: A great deal is expected from professors of the Officers Academy, so it's important to hone your skills. To put it plainly, you'll need to keep expanding your knowledge of all disciplines, not just battle.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I trust you're eager to face the Black Eagles in battle. Enjoy the thrill of anticipation while it lasts. Soon you'll wish you had chosen to lead our house instead.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I hear there will be a mock battle soon. We must not neglect our training. I trust that you will carefully study the strengths and weaknesses of each of your students, that you may provide effective guidance. Regardless of the results, this battle will be a great learning experience. Even so... What is the point of competition if the aim isn't to win? As this is your first time at the monastery, please allow me to show you the ropes.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Both students and teachers of the Officers Academy are free to use the facilities within the monastery. For example, you can dine with others at the dining hall or partake in one-on-one combat in the training grounds. I encourage you to wander around the monastery and lend an ear to the people living here.

speaker: Dimitri
text: There are bulletin boards in various places around the monastery. Have you seen them, Professor? There you can find requests from various sources, as well as information about the market. If you fulfill these requests, you should eventually be able to use even more of the facilities here. The bulletin board gets updated frequently. You would do well to check it once a month.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This probably goes without saying, but no matter which facility you use, it will take up a considerable amount of your time. It's helpful to plan out activities in advance so that you don't mistakenly squander your time here.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professors at the Officers Academy are expected to have exceptional leadership skills. Students and teachers alike must devote themselves to their studies and strive to acquire great wisdom, even outside their respective Fields.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I heard about the upcoming mock battle. I want you to know, Professor, that I do not intend to lose. I hereby declare my intention to prevail at... Goodness, listen to me. The thrill of competition has carried me away. I won't speak so formally of a class assignment in the future.

speaker: Claude
text: Did you hear the news, Teach? Looks like we're gonna have a good ol' mock battle between the houses! The Golden Deer House isn't exactly what you'd call an elite group just yet, so you may want to whip everyone into shape with some extra training. After all, competition is only fun if you win. To that end, I'd better prepare as well. You know, I was researching what it's like to live here long before I even enrolled. Want me to fill you in, Teach?

speaker: Claude
text: Students and teachers of the Officers Academy are all free to use the facilities within the monastery. That means you can chow down with students in the dining hall, or get in some one-on-one sparring at the training grounds. As you explore the monastery, try visiting the various facilities and talking to the people who live here.

speaker: Claude
text: If you haven't noticed, there are bulletin boards in various places around here. You can check them out to see posted requests or to find more information about the market. I hear that fulfilling requests can even earn you the right to use more facilities. The bulletin board gets updated frequently, so it's probably a good idea to check it once a month.

speaker: Claude
text: Far be it from me to tell you how to use the facilities, but it's a good idea to be mindful of how you're using your time. If you don't think about how you're spending your free time, it'll be over before you know it.

speaker: Claude
text: Here at the Officers Academy, even professors are expected to study often to help maintain their strong leadership skills. In other words, students and teachers alike have to strive to grow in every possible field.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, Teach! I hear there's gonna be a mock battle between the houses. I'm not gonna lie, I'm a bit concerned about facing an elite mercenary like you. Maybe take it easy on us, what do you say?

speaker: Hubert
text: Dimitri and Claude are the leaders of the other two houses. Do not underestimate them. When we take the field, it would be best not to engage the both of them at once.

speaker: Hubert
text: If you continue to insist on distracting me, I will have no choice but to get rid of you. Joking, of course.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Let me tell you the provenance of our class name. The eagle, that refers to the twin-headed eagle on the Adrestian Empire's coat of arms. And black is the traditional color of the Empire's armor, hence, "Black Eagles."

speaker: Linhardt
text: The Great Tree Moon is the best time of the year for naps. I could just forget all about my assignment...

speaker: Byleth
text: That's not a good idea.

speaker: Byleth
text: Now I'm feeling sleepy too...

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yeah...

speaker: Caspar
text: Who, Jeritza sure seems strong. I kinda thought he was gonna be the new professor assigned to our class. After that teacher ran away during our outdoor training, I figured Jeritza was a natural replacement. I was surprised when you were suddenly appointed professor instead. I don't think I could hold my own against Jeritza in battle. I could probably take you though.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not a chance.

speaker: Caspar
text: You really think so? With enough training, I'm sure I'll beat you someday!

speaker: Byleth
text: Probably.

speaker: Caspar
text: Hah! Seriously? You should really work on your self-confidence if you're planning on becoming a professor.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Um. I, ah, was just heading back to my room–bye!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I don't like to come out unless I really have to. Hope you're OK with that, Professor!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Hi, Professor. How're you doing? If you're not busy, would you like to join me on a little trip into town? If I'm cooped up in this dusty old monastery for too long, it drives me absolutely crazy.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Yes, it's true that I'm the only commoner in the Black Eagle House. I knew that before the first day of class. Those people are simply exhausting.

speaker: Petra
text: Professor. I hope you know I am having great abilities for reading and writing. With sadness, I still have struggles with speaking. If my ways of speak...of speech are causing a burden, I hope you will have forgiveness.

speaker: Petra
text: Here at the monastery, I have had many great learnings from many great people. I am hopeful to have learnings from you too. As forever, I will do my best trying!

speaker: Dedue
text: His Highness has said that he trusts you, and I have no cause for doubt. But if you mistreat him in any way, I will take action.

speaker: Dedue
text: Let me know when you are hungry. I will make you a quality meal, as thanks for your service to His Highness.

speaker: Felix
text: I'm busy. Do you want something?

speaker: Byleth
text: I was hoping to spar with you.

speaker: Felix
text: I can't right now, but let's fight soon. I look forward to beating you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Nothing in particular.

speaker: Felix
text: Then get out of my way.

speaker: Ashe
text: Oh, did you come to look at the plants too? The greenhouse here is really incredible. There are so many rare flowers I'd never seen back home. And herbs I never even knew existed!

speaker: Byleth
text: I've never had much interest in plants.

speaker: Ashe
text: That's normal. They all looked the same to me before I really studied them.

speaker: Byleth
text: You seem well-informed on the subject.

speaker: Ashe
text: My adoptive father is the real expert. He taught me everything I know about herbs, including how to tell them apart and how to make medicines.

speaker: Ashe
text: You should try looking around the greenhouse sometime, if the mood strikes you. Maybe something will catch your eye!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, Professor. If you've got spare time, want to join me for a trip into town? We could try to pick up beautiful girls... Or not. I'm kidding! Don't look at me like that.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Well, there's Dorothea, Hilda, and Mercedes. Lady Rhea's quite the beauty too. And I must admit, I've even checked out Professor Manuela once or twice. You know, Professor, I think I'm going to like it at the Officer's Academy. There are beautiful girls as far as the eye can see...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Before I came to the Officers Academy, I attended a school of magic in the Kingdom capital. That's where I met Annie! That's what I call Annette. Oh, I guess Lorenz was at the school of magic too? But Annie was always just so nice to me, even though I was older. She's my best friend in the world.

speaker: Annette
text: Hello, Professor! Uh, I have a teeny tiny question for you, if that's all right... You haven't seen a man with hair the same color as mine, a scowling face, and a generally gloomy demeanour...have you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Looking for someone?

speaker: Annette
text: Well, yes. It's a bit difficult to explain... Please just let me know if you do see him, OK?

speaker: Byleth
text: Can't say that I have.

speaker: Annette
text: I suppose it was silly to ask. Sorry for wasting your time!

speaker: Ingrid
text: The Blue Lion House derived its names from the honorary title of the first king of Faerghus. Loog, the King of Lions, wore brilliantly blue garments. His chivalric exploits are recorded in multiple legends. The library holds various historical accounts regarding him and the Blue Lions. If you find time, you should read them. They're filled with insights.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Our house is that of the Golden Deer. Do you know the significance of that name, Professor? Golden Deer are sacred creatures said to have protected Leicester since time immemorial. All three of the houses have a meaning behind their name. You should feel free to ask around, if that sort of knowledge interests you.

speaker: Raphael
text: Ugh. I really need to eat. I can't hold out until the next meal! Why can't the dining hall stay open all the time? I need to keep eating if I want to get stronger!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Have you memorized everyone's names yet? I'm Ignatz, in case you forgot. I'm looking forward to learning from you.

speaker: Ignatz
text: This is the Golden Deer House. You're in charge of a different house, right? Too bad we won't see more of each other. I'm happy to learn from you, if the opportunity comes up!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Hi, Professor. Have you gotten around to visiting the library yet? It's absolutely loaded with valuable information. I only wish I wasn't burdened with the necessity of sleep, so I could spend all my hours there.

speaker: Byleth
text: You like reading?

speaker: Lysithea
text: In a manner, yes. But it's more that I want to learn as much as I possibly can.

speaker: Byleth
text: You ought to get some rest.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Please don't treat me like a child. I may be a bit younger than the others, but that really shouldn't factor in.

speaker: Marianne
text: Goddess, I pray to thee... Please protect us... ...

speaker: Hilda
text: So, about the mock battle that's coming up...you don't mind me sitting it out, do you? As a fragile maiden, I'm useless in battle. I'll just cheer everyone on instead!

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, Professor! Have you adjusted to life at the academy yet? Me, I'm still not used to it. I'm not one for all this studying and training.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm Captain Jeralt's first and best apprentice. I can beat anyone, Professor. Even you, if I have to! It may have been only for a short time, but I learned from the absolute best.

speaker: Rhea
text: Do bear in mind that even as you are appraising your students, they are appraising you as well. I hope that you will do your best to form lasting bonds with your flock. Oh, and I look forward to witnessing your prowess in the mock battle.

speaker: Seteth
text: These are the students' quarters. To better help you supervise them, you also have a room here. Your room is here at the end. Commoner students also reside on the first floor, while the second is primarily for students of noble birth. As a rule, we try to avoid discrimination based on social status here. But the nobility can be quite insistent when it comes to matters of propriety. Speaking of, it would be best for you to avoid improper conduct. I expect you to set a good example for the students.

speaker: Flayn
text: Hello there, Professor. Well, I call you that, but I am afraid that I am not a student here myself...

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a shame.

speaker: Flayn
text: Should the opportunity arise, I would love to become a student and begin my studies in earnest.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where can I visit you, then?

speaker: Flayn
text: My brother would not be pleased if he heard you saying such things.

speaker: Flayn
text: The monastery is kind enough to provide a sanctuary for my brother and I. He's the only family I have.

speaker: Alois
text: Captain Jeralt has hardly changed since 20 years ago. I've aged at least three times as much as he has! Why am I talking about this? Oh, right, it was because I just overheard Tomas remarking on the subject. The leader of a legendary group of knights, returned. People are bound to be talking about the ol' captain!

speaker: Jeritza
text: I care nothing of friendship. If you have no business here, leave.

speaker: Jeralt
text: The church has changed a lot since my time. Seteth, Hanneman, Manuela, Jeritza, and many of the knights... None of them were around 20 years ago. Have you met Leonie yet? Apparently it was my influence that inspired her to leave her village. Sorry to burden you, but could you watch over her for me? She's the only apprentice I've ever had.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Apparently there is to be a mock battle between the houses. Interesting, but I hope you understand that I have far more important things on my mind. My research is proceeding slower than I would like. Your Crest is something of a challenge. Frustrating. Yet, also, quite intriguing. I was wondering if I might get a sample of your flesh. A couple square inches would do. No? Perhaps some blood? A couple of drops on the device are all I need.

speaker: Byleth
text: (It's some kind of experimental apparatus...)

speaker: Byleth
text: I might as well assist by providing a blood sample...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Oh, thank you, Professor. Those few drops of blood are invaluable to my research! Oh, so much more to learn!

speaker: Byleth
text: I had better keep my distance.

speaker: Manuela
text: A mock battle? This early? Wow, Professor. They're not giving you any time to settle in, are they? Don't you worry though! Should you get injured, I will care for you all through your recuperation. I will see to you oh-so very, very, personally.

speaker: Tomas
text: Professor, I hear you are lacking in knowledge of the Church of Seiros. The library contains countless documents about the teaching and history of the church. I encourage you to make good use of them.

speaker: Cyril
text: I'm a little busy.

speaker: Byleth
text: Oh, sorry.

speaker: Cyril
text: If you're looking for the greenhouse, it's right there. See it? Looks like a greenhouse? That's it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Can't we talk just a little?

speaker: Cyril
text: I really can't right now, I got a lot of things to do. Work and stuff like that. Why don't you look at the flowers in the greenhouse instead? They're pretty.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! By the by, have you ever regretted a decision and wished you could go back and undo it? It's too bad there's no lesson for how to turn back the ol' clock, huh? But I suppose a bad decision isn't worth all that fuss anyhow!

speaker: Student
text: I'm not too keen on the professor of my class. I really hoped to focus more on strategy. Hmm, maybe I should talk to my professor about transferring to a different class.

speaker: Monk
text: There are two types of Crests. Major Crests manifest their power most effectively, while Minor Crests are slightly weaker. It is said that the closer a person's blood relation is to various saints and Heroes, the higher their chance of bearing a major Crest. Of course, there are also examples of Major Crests manifesting in children whose parents bear no Crest whatsoever. The exact nature of how and why Crests are inherited is still a mystery.

speaker: Priest
text: I hear a member of House Hresvelg, the ruling family of the Empire, has entered the Officers Academy for the first time in ages. It is said that the Adrestian Empire's very founding was aided by none other than Saint Seiros. That is why the Crest of Seiros is on the Imperial flag. In recent years, a rift has developed between the Empire and the church... Let us hope that this will be a good opportunity for both parties to reforge their close relationship of years past.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: As part of our commitment to the goddess, the knights undertake various missions across all of Fódlan. Assisting with the education of young nobles is also a part of our sacred duty.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: The Imperial princess, the crown prince, and the heir to the Alliance's leading house... This is one exceptional year, that's for sure. If you're a teacher here, you'd better watch your step. If anything were to happen to those kids... Well, suffice to say that it could harm the reputation of the Church of Seiros, which we've spent almost a millennium establishing.

speaker: Monk
text: Tomas has served as the monastery's librarian for decades. Actually, he was away from Garreg Mach for a spell, but he returned to his post last year. There is no one as familiar with the monastery archives as he is.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's finally time for the mock battle. This is my chance to measure your worth as an instructor. Do you think you can rise to the challenge?

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Edelgard
text: So confident. This will be interesting.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm concerned...

speaker: Edelgard
text: That doesn't inspire much confidence, does it?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Each of us has undergone strict training. We're prepared for anything that comes our way. That means there's no need to hold back. Show us what you're capable of.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey there! Did we miss our invite to this strategy meeting? Oh, no worries–we'll just join in now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Simply tell me your weaknesses, and you're welcome to stay. But is there enough time to cover them all?

speaker: Claude
text: Ah, so you can't win unless you know my weakness? Poor princess. You really should believe in yourself more.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I spare no effort when pursuing victory. As a master of schemes, I should think you would understand.

speaker: Claude
text: Schemes? Me? I have no idea what you're talking about! I plan to fight fair and square, as ever.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hearing the words "fair and square" from Claude can only be a bad omen.

speaker: Claude
text: Your Highnesses haven't known me for very long, but you already have me figured out, don't you?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No need to poke fun. I will fight with honor. That said, I will fight to win.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes, and the same is true of us. Right, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't go too hard on us.

speaker: Claude
text: No use trying to hide how you really feel, Teach. I can see it in your eyes–you don't intend to lose.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't intend to lose.

speaker: Dimitri
text: If that is how you feel, then I will not hold back.

speaker: Manuela
text: Aw, how precious. Looks like you and the students have become fast friends.

speaker: Hanneman
text: While I am pleased that you are taking the initiative to acquaint yourself with the students, I'm afraid it's about time for the faculty strategy meeting.

speaker: Claude
text: Ah, how time flies! In that case, I'll see you later.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Edelgard, Professor, be careful out there.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ah, it's finally time for the mock battle. I'm eager to put my skills to use. And you, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm looking forward to it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Excellent. I have high expectations for your command. That said, I've no doubt it will take everything we've got to pull a victory.

speaker: Byleth
text: I hope we can win.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I wouldn't worry too much about it. If you command use as you did back in the village, I have no doubt we'll be fine.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Our opponents are mighty, that much is certain, but I'm positive we can win.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey there! Did we miss our invite to this strategy meeting? Oh, no worries–we'll just join in now.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Nice try, Claude, but I do not intent to let slip our strategies. Especially when we are up against such strong opponents as you two.

speaker: Claude
text: Well now! Kind words from his kingliness. If that's the case, we'd better come up with some clever schemes so as not to disappoint. Right, Princess?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Right. No matter the tactics you devise, we will destroy you. The best you can hope for is to learn a thing or two.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Haha, there's nothing wrong with a friendly rivalry, but let's not get carried away. A rash attitude could be your undoing, after all.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hmm... Perhaps your time would be better spent preparing instead of worrying about the competition's mindset.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, now! If you two are getting this fired up before the battle even starts...it'll make it that much easier for my class to sweep up a win. So please, carry on.

speaker: Dimitri
text: A good point, Claude. I apologize–that wasn't my intention. At any rate, let's vow to make this a productive battle, shall we?

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't go too hard on us.

speaker: Claude
text: No use trying to hide how you really feel, Teach. I can see it in your eyes–you don't intend to lose.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't intend to lose.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Oh? In that case, I won't hold back.

speaker: Manuela
text: Aw, how precious. Looks like you and the students have become fast friends.

speaker: Hanneman
text: While I am pleased that you are taking the initiative to acquaint yourself with the students, I'm afraid it's about time for the faculty strategy meeting.

speaker: Claude
text: Ah, how time flies! In that case, I'll see you later.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I look forward to assessing your abilities. I hope you don't disappoint.

speaker: Claude
text: Time for a mock battle, eh? Hmm, how should we go about this... Well, you'll be our commander, that much is for sure. Just don't screw it up and everything'll be great. Got it, Teach?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not concerned.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Claude
text: Right. I'll do whatever I can to help too. I mean, I'm kind of obligated to. For example! If I add a little something to their food to upset their stomachs...

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't even think about it.

speaker: Claude
text: Yeah, yeah, wink, wink. I read you. You can't officially condone that sort of thing, right? But say, hypothetically speaking, students from the other houses started racing to the infirmary... As far as anyone knows, it could just be a harmless little stomach bug making the rounds.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Well, well. What a fascinating conversation you two are having. May we join?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Claude, I can't believe you would stoop to such crooked schemes to gain the advantage. Have you no honor?

speaker: Claude
text: If that was really my scheme, I wouldn't be talking about it out in the open. I'm afraid you'll have to wait until our battle to see what's really in store.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's irrelevant anyhow. Whatever you have planned won't save you from a crushing defeat.

speaker: Dimitri
text: She has a point. Still, I'm rather eager to see what sort of scheme that mind of yours conjures up.

speaker: Claude
text: You heard 'em, Teach. We can't let these fine folks down.

speaker: Byleth
text: It will be a fair fight.

speaker: Claude
text: Heh, of course. A fair fight, as all fights are. Good one, Teach. Play innocent now so they won't see it coming.

speaker: Byleth
text: If they insist.

speaker: Claude
text: Are you serious, Teach? Well, if a crooked scheme is really what you're after, I've got more than a few of those up my sleeve.

speaker: Manuela
text: Aw, how precious. Looks like you and the students have become fast friends.

speaker: Hanneman
text: While I am pleased that you are taking the initiative to acquaint yourself with the students, I'm afraid it's about time for the faculty strategy meeting.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'm sorry, Professors. It's about time I returned to my training anyhow. Claude, Edelgard, until we meet again on the battlefield, farewell.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I look forward to assessing your abilities. I hope you don't disappoint.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The mock battle is finally here. Will you lead us to victory?

speaker: Jeralt
text: I'm sure you already understand, but the house that defeats the other two is declared the winner. Incidentally, I'll be overseeing this mock battle. So listen well if you want to win.

speaker: Lorenz
text: None of your shallow tactics are required, Claude. Ignatz and I will dismantle the opposition.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Me?! But I'm not ready!

speaker: Claude
text: Are you making light of our new professor? If you drop your guard, you're going to get hurt...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ashe, can you move to the front lines? I want to lure the enemy this way.

speaker: Ashe
text: Got it, Your Highness! Leave it to me!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Once you've finished preparing, make your move. Dedue, Mercedes. Keep our enemy occupied until then.

speaker: Dedue
text: I'm on it.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh my! We'll try our best!

speaker: Claude
text: Well done, Teach! I may have to take this seriously after all!

speaker: Claude
text: Let's use the forest to set up an ambush. I'm counting on your support, everyone!

speaker: Jeralt
text: If they're waiting in the forest, we'd do well to take a detour.

speaker: Claude
text: Welp, we're surrounded. All we can do is fight back with all our might!

speaker: Claude
text: Are you really gonna fight two houses at once? Heh, an impressive display of confidence.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This is a good opportunity for us. Let's forge ahead!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Beautiful work, Professor. But the true challenge starts now!

speaker: Dimitri
text: You're a tough opponent, but I refuse to yield. Do not fool yourself into believing I will hold back!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Dimitri... It's time! We can finally settle the question of who's stronger.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Very well. I accept your challenge. With you as my opponent, I won't hold anything back.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I would expect no less!

speaker: Claude
text: Coming up with brilliant schemes, I can handle. No problem. But I'm not much for fighting. Go easy on me!

speaker: Claude
text: You know that was a joke, right? Jeez, not so much as a smile...

speaker: Claude
text: Look at that, a real life princess! I'll have to be careful not to scar that little face of yours.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Careful, Claude. I'll win no matter what, but you're only making things harder for yourself.

speaker: Claude
text: Losing hasn't even crossed your mind, has it? Ooh, this'll be a bit of a shock, then.

speaker: Edelgard
text: To shock was your intention to begin with, was it not?

speaker: Lorenz
text: I've lost?! Oh! Unthinkable!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I've lost. The new professor is quite a commander.

speaker: Hilda
text: Ouch! Was that really necessary?

speaker: Claude
text: Argh, I hate losing! I guess I'll just have to settle for cheering the others on.

speaker: Claude
text: I must have let my guard down. I guess that's a loss for the Golden Deer House.

speaker: Manuela
text: Well done. I nearly wound up a patient in my own infirmary.

speaker: Ashe
text: Ah–so strong! Have to do better next time...

speaker: Dedue
text: Ngh. Apologies, Your Highness. I can go no further.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh no... This is as far as I can go...

speaker: Dimitri
text: My training was insufficient... I am so sorry, everyone. The rest is up to you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I suppose that does it for the Blue Lion House...

speaker: Hanneman
text: My goodness. The leadership of someone with actual battle experience is... Well! I was as good as useless.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I am the son of House Aegir! How did I fail? I must need to train harder...

speaker: Hubert
text: Hmm. The new professor's rather strong. Suppose I'll have to call it a day.

speaker: Dorothea
text: My, my... The new professor seems very capable.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Forced to retreat... Well, things will only get tougher from here on out.

speaker: Edelgard
text: To think that the Black Eagles could lose so readily...

speaker: Jeralt
text: All right, that's that! The winner of this mock battle is... The Black Eagle House!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Even though it was just a mock battle, we defeated both houses masterfully. Take pride in this victory, everyone!

speaker: Dimitri
text: This victory is the result of everyone's hard work. Thank you, my friends. You did well.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It is about time for the battle to begin. Our victory depends on your leadership. Do not let us down.

speaker: Lorenz
text: None of your shallow tactics are required, Claude. Ignatz and I will dismantle the opposition.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Me?! But I'm not ready!

speaker: Claude
text: Are you making light of our new professor? If you drop your guard, you're going to get hurt...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Dorothea, will you head towards the front lines? I wish to draw the enemy towards us.

speaker: Dorothea
text: You got it, Edie. Leave it to me.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ferdinand. Hubert. If the enemy comes, stop them.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Leave it to us, although I could do this on my own.

speaker: Hubert
text: Heh. Clearly not, or Her Highness would not ask me to watch your back.

speaker: Claude
text: Well done, Teach! I may have to take this seriously after all!

speaker: Claude
text: Let's use the forest to set up an ambush. I'm counting on your support, everyone!

speaker: Jeralt
text: If they're waiting in the forest, we'd do well to take a detour.

speaker: Claude
text: Welp, we're surrounded. All we can do is fight back with all our might!

speaker: Claude
text: Are you really gonna fight two houses at once? Heh, an impressive display of confidence.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Victory is in sight, Black Eagles. Do not let up!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Flawless tactics, Professor. Our only choice in this situation is a head-on attack!

speaker: Claude
text: Psst, Your Princliness. You've got a thing for Edelgard, right? Come on, fess up. You'll feel better.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Claude, please. This is no time for idle banter. Your defenses are wide open.

speaker: Claude
text: That didn't get to him, huh? What a shame. I'll find a better way to ruffle him up next time.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There can be no victory unless I defeat you. So be it!

speaker: Claude
text: So this is the stage for the mock battle... The command's all yours, Teach!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I will fight on the front lines! I can stop the enemy's advance with grace!

speaker: Hubert
text: Do you have Lady Edelgard's permission to--hmph. I suppose I've no choice but to provide cover.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you Hubert. We are off to a terrible start.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ashe, can you move to the front lines? I want to lure the enemy this way.

speaker: Ashe
text: Got it, Your Highness! Leave it to me!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Once you've finished preparing, make your move. Dedue, Mercedes. Keep our enemy occupied until then.

speaker: Dedue
text: I'm on it.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh my! We'll try our best!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hm, you are performing as expected, Professor. We will have to face you with our full might!

speaker: Edelgard
text: We will use the forest to ambush our enemy. Everyone, I am counting on your support!

speaker: Jeralt
text: If they're waiting in the forest, we'd do well to take a detour.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It seems we're surrounded... At a time like this, our only option is to cut a path through!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Are you planning on fighting two houses at once? I will admit, that is favorable for us.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This is a good opportunity for us. Let's forge ahead!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Beautiful work, Professor. But the true challenge starts now!

speaker: Claude
text: Great work, everyone! Even if it's just a mock battle, the taste of victory is sugary sweet!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Excellent work today, Professor. Though our victory should come as no surprise.

speaker: Byleth
text: It was a close call.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Was it? I'm not sure I agree with that.

speaker: Byleth
text: It was easy.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes, it was. Further proof that you're well qualified to guide the Black Eagles.

speaker: Petra
text: That was impressing, Professor! I mean...impressive. We gained a victory because of your great leadership.

speaker: Dorothea
text: We certainly did. We all tried our best, of course, but we couldn't have won without you.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I was curious what it would look like if you did not hold back. And you did not disappoint!

speaker: Hubert
text: Hmph. I daresay we owe our victory to Lady Edelgard.

speaker: Linhardt
text: How so? For that battle, she was only a soldier following our professor's command. Sure, she was an incredibly powerful soldier...

speaker: Caspar
text: Don't worry about it too much, Linhardt. All that matters is that we won!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I'm all done with being on the battlefield, OK? I'd rather stay back than pursue victory out there.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You are all as ridiculous as always. We only managed to win because we worked together.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Was it something I said? Is it so odd, me talking about togetherness? If so, that perception must change. In fact, I'm canceling the festivities so we can discuss this topic further. I'm kidding, of course. Come on, everyone! We've earned this celebration.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor! I've been looking for you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I was hoping we could all share a meal together. It could serve as both a victory celebration and a post-battle analysis. What do you think?

speaker: Byleth
text: A victory celebration?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Of course. After all, we fought hard out there. Such exertion is bound to make anyone hungry for respite, don't you agree?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm invited?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Of course. Why wouldn't you be?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Come now, Professor! We can't very well celebrate without the key to our victory present.

speaker: Annette
text: He's right! He really is! We were only able to win because we had your help, Professor!

speaker: Felix
text: Yes. Compared with that boar who knows nothing save frontal attacks, your tactics were nearly decent.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Felix! You really ought to stop picking fights with His Highness.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Don't worry, Ingrid. I encourage all to speak freely. And I must agree that the professor's tactics were truly extraordinary. I have much to learn.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh, sure, but today was exhausting, I'm so hungry I can barely stand...

speaker: Ashe
text: To be honest, so am I. Let's head to the dining hall. Together.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor. I'm sorry to intrude, but...you don't look too happy for someone who just won.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're mistaken.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You say that, but your eyes tell a different story.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is that so...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hm. Well, I understand how difficult it can be to accept joy sometimes. I'm sorry for prying.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I know we only just met, so this may be difficult for you, but... I'd love nothing more than to share our happiness with you. Joy can be so fleeting, after all. We're all in this together...so I hope you will consent. I'm sure the rest of the class feels the very same. Well...come along, Professor. Let's enjoy the fruits of our labor!

speaker: Claude
text: Great work, Teach! That was a brilliant win.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm glad we won.

speaker: Claude
text: I've been anticipating that magic moment when your tactics and my schemes entwined, and you did not disappoint. That composed expression you always sport like a permanent mask is a perfect complement to my ruthless scheme. That's a joke, of course. Mostly.

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone did well.

speaker: Claude
text: Huh. Playing ignorant as to the quality of you command and deflecting the praise to your students. You really are a model professor, Teach.

speaker: Claude
text: To be honest, I had a bunch of other schemes planned as well, just in case the situation called for it. But I didn't have to resort to any of them. I suppose our opponents lucked out.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Well met, Professor! The breadth of your skill was on full display today. I must admit that your tactics were masterful. I shudder to think what may have transpired had it been Claude leading us into battle.

speaker: Raphael
text: I noticed that too! We just did what you told us, and we won! I love it!

speaker: Lysithea
text: As expected from a child of the former captain of the knights. Thank you for today, Professor. I have much to consider.

speaker: Hilda
text: I never doubted that our professor would be amazing! It was way too obvious. Don't you agree, Marianne?

speaker: Marianne
text: Huh? Me? Oh, um, yes. Of course. Well done, Professor.

speaker: Leonie
text: Captain Jeralt taught his child well. It would have been more of a surprise had our professor proved lacking.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Don't you think it's a bit hard to give Jeralt all of the credit, Leonie? In any case, it's clear that we only won because of our new mentor's guidance.

speaker: Claude
text: A mercenary's wisdom and techniques are forged in battle. Those are the sorts of things you can only learn through experience. Right, Teach? But more importantly, it's time to celebration our victory! Teach here has yet to try my well renowned home cooking.

speaker: Claude
text: I really do hope you'll join us. After all, I swiped some finely aged cheese from the dining hall for just this occasion.

speaker: Rhea
text: Your work with the students was remarkable. I can see Jeralt trained you well. I do hope you were able to use the occasion to bond with the students.

speaker: Byleth
text: I did.

speaker: Rhea
text: I am so happy to hear it. Nothing would please me more than if you would use this coming year to grow closer still.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not really.

speaker: Rhea
text: Oh? Well, you have only just met them, so I suppose that should come as no surprise.

speaker: Seteth
text: Of course, the mock battle was mere practice. The real fight is the Battle of the Eagle and Lion, which will take place during the Wyvern Moon. You are expected to properly train your students so as not to humiliate the academy during the long-held tradition that is the coming battle.

speaker: Rhea
text: As for today, I have called you here to tell you of your mission for the month ahead. Your class is to dispose of some bandits causing trouble nearby.

speaker: Byleth
text: My mission?

speaker: Byleth
text: Bandits?

speaker: Seteth
text: Those affiliated with Garreg Mach Monastery have a moral obligation to help those in need, regardless of social standing. Students are no exception. Each month, before the newly birthed moon departs, each house of students must complete their assigned mission. You shall work to complete the task at hand alongside your students and report back to the archbishop before the deadline. Understood? I will soon provide you with the necessary details for your first mission. If I told you now, I expect you would only forget, and I despise repeating myself.

speaker: Rhea
text: I can sense something special within your heart... I have high hopes for you.
