text: Does that concern you too, Professor? I'm happy to return to the reception hall.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's not terribly concerning, really.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Of course. Nothing to see here! I'm happy to keep walking off this food, in that case. Ah, the stars certainly are beautiful tonight, hm? It's peaceful, looking up at them together, don't you think? Maybe we can do it again sometime.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'd love to come along.

speaker: Ingrid
text: If we return from here together, I worry that people would start unsavory rumors about us. I don't concern myself with gossip, but I'd hate for it to mar your reputation in any way. Are you certain? Fair enough. Let's head back, then.

speaker: Claude
text: Oh. Hey, Teach. What brings you to the Goddess Tower? You know what, never mind. The answer is as clear as day. You couldn't bear the ball anymore and simply had to escape.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wouldn't say that...

speaker: Byleth
text: I just needed a break.

speaker: Claude
text: There's nothing wrong with admitting you're not comfortable in a noisy crowd. Really, I get it. I'm the same way.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't believe it.

speaker: Claude
text: Ha! See right through me, do you? But I really do mean it. Parties aren't for me. Music and fun are all well and good, but those dances the nobles do are...something else. I was never really taught to do that sort of thing. My upbringing was...lacking in certain ways.

speaker: Byleth
text: Even though you're from a noble family?

speaker: Byleth
text: Even though you're heir to the Alliance?

speaker: Claude
text: Even so. I may have secured a fancy new title, but who I am on the inside... Well, status alone can't change that. That's a bit of an aside, though. Say, Teach... have you heard the legends about this tower? They say if a man and a woman pray for the same thing here, on this night, the goddess will grant their wish without fail.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why tonight?

speaker: Claude
text: Who knows? Maybe it has something to do with celebrating the anniversary of the monastery's completion. Maybe the goddess comes down from above on this night and this night alone to celebrate with us. Even goddesses like to party, right? The truth is that it's just a legend the students here like to tell. It's not based on any real facts. But I suppose it would be a waste to pass up a chance of having our wish granted. What do you say, Teach? Care to try?

speaker: Byleth
text: What would we pray for?

speaker: Claude
text: Hm... Let's see... How about we pray for our ambitions to come true? You don't exactly seem like the selfish type, but even you must have an ambition or two.

speaker: Byleth
text: I do.

speaker: Byleth
text: I do not.

speaker: Byleth
text: More of a hope...

speaker: Claude
text: That's what I thought. It's the same for everyone.

speaker: Claude
text: Even if you're not aware of it, I'm sure there's something your heart of hearts wishes for.

speaker: Claude
text: That's what I thought. It's the same for everyone.

speaker: Claude
text: No one is ever completely satisfied. Everyone has something they long for. Otherwise, what's the point of it all? Of course, same goes for me. Without even realizing it, I found myself holding tight to some pretty big ambitions. If you would... I would love for you to share in those ambitions with me, Teach.

speaker: Claude
text: But all that aside, let's get started. Let's pray to the goddess before she tuckers out for the evening. OK... Here goes. Oh, divine Goddess! Hear our prayers! We beseech you and your radiance! Please, grant us that which we seek!

speaker: Claude
text: Huh. I think that should do it. The goddess'll make our dreams come true now, yeah?

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder.

speaker: Claude
text: At any rate, we've done all we can. Whether we actually believe our dreams will come true or not is up to us.

speaker: Claude
text: I suppose we should head back soon. I'm sure everyone is looking for you. Just promise to spare a dance for me. OK, Teach? I swear, so long as it's not one of those goofy noble dances, I am a treasure on the dance floor!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Ah. There you are, Professor. I didn’t see you at the ball. I was wondering where you’d slipped off to. Everyone is waiting for you. Shouldn’t you be heading back?

speaker: Byleth
text: Momentarily.

speaker: Byleth
text: No, I’d like to stay here.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Well, there’s no need to hurry. The ball will continue a while longer. Was the noise becoming too much? It must be difficult, if you are unaccustomed to high society. I say that, but I’m actually the same. After a while of excitement, I yearn for peace and quiet.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did someone turn you down?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Professor! Rude! Just what do you think of me? There are definitely students in there making the most of things. Flirting as if their very lives depended on it. But for a catch such as myself, every day is an opportunity. There’s no need to appear desperate. Still, it’s unexpected that the two of us would be here together, isn’t it?

speaker: Byleth
text: Why is that?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Do you not know the legend of this place? The goddess is said to grant a special kind of blessing, unique to the day of this ball. It is said that on this day she will honor any vow sworn between man and woman here at this tower. It’s a famous legend amongst the students, which may be why I expected to find more of them here.

speaker: Byleth
text: So, you came here to spy on people?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Of course not! I would never stoop to such despicable behavior! Honestly, I forgot all about the legend until now. I’m not interested in that sort of foolishness. Though I suppose it couldn’t hurt to test it. Even if it is only a legend. What do you say, Professor? Shall we swear some sort of vow together? Something that will benefit the both of us. What dream should we promise to make a reality?

speaker: Byleth
text: Peace for all.

speaker: Byleth
text: Happiness for the two of us.

speaker: Lorenz
text: That’s very fitting. I will remember that we made this vow here today. Well, I should head back. Lest, by my absence, the festivities lose their luster.

speaker: Raphael
text: Omm… Mmm… Mmm… Huh? Who’s there?!

speaker: Raphael
text: P-Professor! Is the ball over already? What, uh… What are you doing here?

speaker: Byleth
text: Just taking a break.

speaker: Raphael
text: Ah, a break. Sure, sure. That's uh... That's what I'm doing too.

speaker: Byleth
text: I heard a strange noise.

speaker: Raphael
text: Strange noise? No need to worry! I’ll, uh… I’ll look into it for you!

speaker: Raphael
text: Huh. I suddenly have the energy to dance! Maybe I’ll head back to the ball.

speaker: Byleth
text: What were you eating?

speaker: Raphael
text: Ah! You noticed. It was just some meat. It was a much nicer cut than I’m used to. We all got one helping, but some people didn’t want theirs! Can you believe it? I hate to see good food go to waste. I’m sorry, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should be.

speaker: Byleth
text: You need to follow the rules.

speaker: Raphael
text: You’re right. I know… Oh! By the way! I heard something on my way here. I heard that if two people make a wish together in this tower, on this night, the goddess will grant it!

speaker: Byleth
text: Two people?

speaker: Raphael
text: I don’t know the specifics, just that you can’t do it alone. There has to be two of you. Since we’re both here now, let’s make a wish together! What should we wish for? More delicious cuts of meat?

speaker: Raphael
text: No? Then how about bigger muscles?

speaker: Raphael
text: What else is there to wish for? Hm! Me becoming a proper knight? But that’s just for me, not you…

speaker: Byleth
text: We can wish for that.

speaker: Raphael
text: We can? Professor! That’s so generous of you!

speaker: Raphael
text: Now that we wished for it, I’m sure I’ll become a proper knight!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let’s wish for peace in Fódlan.

speaker: Raphael
text: Peace in Fódlan? That's a good wish too!

speaker: Raphael
text: I really hope our wish comes true.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Gah! Is that you, Goddess?! Professor! Ah. I’m sorry, I thought you were the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: That’s ridiculous.

speaker: Ignatz
text: You’re right, you’re right. Imagine, if she just appeared out of nowhere! Do you know of that old legend, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Old legend?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Yes. It’s said that if a man and a woman make a vow tonight at the Goddess Tower… She will appear before them and bless them, ensuring that vow’s fulfillment.

speaker: Byleth
text: Ridiculous.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I know, but can you imagine if she just appeared out of nowhere? Still… Maybe, even if we can’t see her, we can sense her presence. I envision the goddess as the most beautiful creature in the world… More beautiful than any landscape, any artwork. Utterly beyond compare. That’s what I think anyway. Or perhaps, what I hope. Since I first heard that legend, I’ve wanted to try it and perhaps meet the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: But if the legend’s true…

speaker: Ignatz
text: Yes, I know what you’re getting at. She would never appear before a single person. Frankly, I didn’t know any girls well enough to invite them here. So I was hoping a couple would come along, and I could sneak a peek… Wait! That came out wrong! I take that back. I have absolutely no intention of peeking!

speaker: Byleth
text: Shall we make a vow?

speaker: Ignatz
text: What? You and...me? I suppose we do fit the criteria, but are you certain you would want to do that?

speaker: Ignatz
text: In that case, let’s try it! What should our vow be? Please, pick whatever sounds best to you!

speaker: Byleth
text: Peace for Fódlan.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Of course. Might be a little ambitious, but let’s give it a try!

speaker: Byleth
text: Happiness for all.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Of course. Might be a little ambitious, but let’s give it a try!

speaker: Byleth
text: May you live your life honestly.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Oh? Oh! I see! Yes, that's a wonderful vow.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Now, let us pray.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Did you feel that?! I think the goddess is near!

speaker: Byleth
text: Still ridiculous.

speaker: Ignatz
text: You’re right, of course.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes?

speaker: Lysithea
text: I saw you wandering off to this tower. I thought you might be lost or something, so I followed you inside.

speaker: Byleth
text: Actually, I'm a ghost.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Don't toy with me like that, Professor! I know it's you. I figured you might be lost or something, so I followed you inside.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Everyone seems to be looking for you. You're surprisingly popular.

speaker: Byleth
text: That surprises you, does it?

speaker: Lysithea
text: I do find it surprising, yes. Particularly your popularity with the ladies.

speaker: Byleth
text: Naturally.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Despite your confidence, I'm still surprised by your popularity with the ladies.

speaker: Lysithea
text: It isn't like you're very sociable, after all. Not to be rude, mind you.

speaker: Byleth
text: How do you fare in such matters?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Er, I wouldn't know, to be honest. I have no interest in such things. The academy is for honing one's skills. Not for frivolous romances, despite what the other students may think. I overheard them gossiping about a place where a man and a woman can make a vow, and it is certain it will come to pass. Seems to be some folktale they enjoy. I wonder where this place is...

speaker: Byleth
text: The Goddess Tower?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Oh, of course! I recall now. It's— Wait. That's... That's here, isn't it?! Uh, just to be clear, this is pure coincidence. I didn't follow you for...for that. But we are here alone, so people may wonder what our aim is. Let's get out of here before someone sees us and gets the wrong idea!

speaker: Byleth
text: There's no need for panic.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Are you saying you don't mind if someone sees us and thinks… Oh, I suppose you believe there's no danger of that, since it's just me. You're treating me like a child, aren't you? Well, I don't mind either, then. Obviously there's nothing going on here. If you're going stick to around until we collect dust, then so will I!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Actually, I'm gonna go now. Don't you stay too long either! You'll catch your death of cold out here.

speaker: Marianne
text: Please be patient! I'll be done with my prayer in a moment... Dear Goddess, I beg thee… Oh! Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is someone else here?

speaker: Marianne
text: No... I'm the only one here. Umm… Well, more accurately, I'm the only human present. My bird friend is here as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're talking to a bird?

speaker: Marianne
text: No! Well. It's more like the bird is...doing me a favor. They say if a man and a woman pray here, on this night, their wish will come true. At least, that's how the legend goes.

speaker: Byleth
text: And the bird?

speaker: Marianne
text: It's a pigeon. A...male pigeon. At least, I think so. I thought he might count as a man.

speaker: Marianne
text: Well, I'd better be leaving. It seems my pigeon friend got impatient and flew away.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sorry...

speaker: Marianne
text: No, it's fine. The goddess probably wouldn't accept a male pigeon anyway.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll take his place.

speaker: Marianne
text: Oh? Um. Are you saying you'll pray with me, Professor?

speaker: Marianne
text: Thank you! If you have a wish for the future, let's pray for it, OK?

speaker: Byleth
text: What is your wish?

speaker: Marianne
text: Who, me? Oh, nothing in particular. Let's pray for your wish. There must be something you want. Well?

speaker: Byleth
text: Peace in Fódlan.

speaker: Marianne
text: Very well. Let us pray.

speaker: Byleth
text: Only to see you smile.

speaker: Marianne
text: Hey, no need to tease me...

speaker: Marianne
text: Professor? I must be going now, but...I'm glad I ran into you.

speaker: Hilda
text: Professor! You're not waiting for anyone, right? Thought so! I bet you've never heard the legend about this tower then.

speaker: Byleth
text: I haven't...

speaker: Byleth
text: What legend?

speaker: Hilda
text: Something special happens here during the Ethereal Moon, on the night of the ball. First, an unmarried boy and girl need to meet at the Goddess Tower and make a vow. Then, the goddess will grant them divine protection, and ensure that their vow comes true. Or so they say! It's a well-known story among the students. A couple guys invited me up here, but...

speaker: Byleth
text: You turned them down?

speaker: Hilda
text: Yes, I did.

speaker: Byleth
text: They stood you up?

speaker: Hilda
text: No! How rude. I turned them down.

speaker: Hilda
text: If I accepted their invitations, then our vow would come true. It's just a legend, sure...but I prefer to be cautious about such things. One of the guys was pretty handsome, and he came from a good family... But that doesn't really tell you what a person's like on the inside. I want a life partner who's good-hearted and good-looking. Anyway, I went for a walk and happened upon you, and I thought... The professor's perfect. Why don't I just make a vow with him? Hah! I'm just kidding, Professor. To be honest, I wanted to spy on you. See if you had someone else up here. Although, if you did want to make a vow with me, I wouldn't object. Need some time to consider?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes. Let's revisit this tomorrow morning.

speaker: Hilda
text: Hang on! It won't mean anything tomorrow! Oh, I get it! Everyone's looking for you down there, girls included. You don't want to keep them waiting. You're pretty smooth, you know that? Well, I'm off, then. I'll see you at the ball. Ah... Did the goddess hear that conversation?

speaker: Leonie
text: Hey, Professor. You all alone here? I mean, you're not waiting for anyone or anything, are you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Actually, I'm meeting the archbishop.

speaker: Leonie
text: Liar. I saw Lady Rhea just moments ago. She was in the reception hall.

speaker: Byleth
text: Manuela should be here any moment.

speaker: Leonie
text: Yeah, right! I just passed her flirting with some guy on my way up.

speaker: Leonie
text: Anyway, I saw you heading to the tower, so I thought I'd drop by. I figured you might be lonely.

speaker: Byleth
text: You figured that, did you?

speaker: Leonie
text: Hey, don't make it weird! By the way... Have you heard the legend about this place? They say if a guy and a girl make a promise here together, the goddess will make sure it's kept.

speaker: Byleth
text: I've heard.

speaker: Leonie
text: It's a pretty well-known legend.

speaker: Byleth
text: I had not heard that.

speaker: Leonie
text: Really? It's a pretty well-known legend.

speaker: Leonie
text: Thing is, the way the story goes, it doesn't work all the time. It has to be the night of the ball. Tonight. So, since it's just you and me here, what do you say we give it a go? I mean, I don't know if the goddess will really take the time for a pair like us, but it's worth a try.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you suggesting?

speaker: Leonie
text: Well—you know! Let's make some kind of promise! We've got the chance, it'd be a shame to waste it. I mean, not something romantic or anything. That'd be weird. We could promise I'll become a top-tier mercenary! Though I guess that's more of a wish… Let's see... OK, I've got it. I solemnly swear to meet you once more, on this very ground, as a mercenary beyond compare! Oh, but that was all about me. No fair. You probably have something you want to promise too.

speaker: Byleth
text: No, I think that covers it.

speaker: Leonie
text: Hah. You really do take after Captain Jeralt—always putting others first. All right, then, Goddess. You heard the promise. It's a done deal. Say, Professor...why did you come out here, anyway?

speaker: Byleth
text: I just wanted some time alone.

speaker: Leonie
text: Ah. Well, it is pretty crowded down there. I guess I shouldn't have interrupted. I'll leave you to it. But don't stay out here too long, all right? You'll catch a cold!

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor? Is that you over there? It seems both of us were curious about this place.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Flayn
text: Oh, perhaps I was mistaken. I figured you had come to this tower after having heard the legend.

speaker: Byleth
text: What legend?

speaker: Flayn
text: You've not heard of it, then? I suppose I only recently learned of it myself, from a friend. Legend tells that on the night of a ball, when a man and woman pledge vows at this very tower… The goddess will bestow her blessing, ensuring those vows come to pass. Of course, such things do not really come to pass. But there are many who place stock in this legend. I wondered what sort of vows youths tend to pledge... So here I am, hoping to gain deeper understanding. Only to bump into you! Are you meeting someone here, perchance?

speaker: Byleth
text: No, I'm not.

speaker: Flayn
text: That's unfortunate. I wonder if anyone else will be coming… Professor? If the legend were true, what type of vow might you pledge?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's hard to say…

speaker: Flayn
text: No ideas? Perhaps your imagination is lacking due to the lack of a partner. What say you to being my partner? How about sharing a vow with me? I'll give you until the count of three to come up with something heartfelt and honorable. One...two...three! Go ahead!

speaker: Byleth
text: May we always be together.

speaker: Byleth
text: May we both find joy.

speaker: Flayn
text: Oh! You made my heart flutter! I see. This is the type of vow one would make to another. You've taught me well, as a professor should. I'm most certainly wiser and more mature than I was, even just moments ago. Oh dear. What if the goddess really did hear your vow? Although...I suppose I would not mind if that turned out to be the case. I bid you good evening.

speaker: Sothis
text: Running away? I understand. You hardly had the time to breathe in there. It must be hard to be the favourite teacher at the ball! Poor, poor Professor!

speaker: Byleth
text: I am not everyone's favorite...

speaker: Sothis
text: Was that a joke? I find it hard to tell with you. Just think of all the students begging you to dance!

speaker: Byleth
text: It is difficult.

speaker: Sothis
text: So you do think you're the favorite! I might have known.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor? What are you doing here?

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't you going to dance with Edelgard?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No, I should think not.

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't you going to dance with Claude?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Haha, good one, Professor. I could see saving a dance for Edelgard, but Claude is another story. In any case, I have no intention of dancing with anyone.

speaker: Dimitri
text: As a child, Edelgard taught me how to dance. It was...a bit awkward, honestly.

speaker: Byleth
text: Edelgard?

speaker: Byleth
text: As a child?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I've told you before we're siblings by marriage, haven't I? Her birth mother was my stepmother, although I didn't know that at the time. My stepmother treated me with such kindness...just as though I were her own flesh and blood. And yet she never so much as hinted that she had her own child...Edelgard. We were born and raised in different territories, without ever knowing the other even existed. Yet, against all odds, for just over a year, we became childhood friends.

speaker: Byleth
text: Friends?

speaker: Byleth
text: Not siblings?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Indeed. Unaware of each other's stations or backgrounds, we met and became incredibly close. This was when she and Lord Arundel were living in the Kingdom.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why were they in the Kingdom?

speaker: Dimitri
text: They were in exile... This was a time of great turmoil within the Empire. I ran into her when visiting Lord Arundel's residence with my father. She seemed...quite bored. With everything. At first I found her to be difficult and stubborn, but that facade quickly fell away, revealing her true self beneath... That's around the time when she taught me how to dance. Her instruction was... Oh, let's call it strict. To put it nicely.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Wrong foot, Dimitri! You're supposed to lead with your right!

speaker: Dimitri
text: El, the sun's going down! I really oughta be heading home...

speaker: Dimitri
text: That one year before she had to return to the Empire was...so much fun. The time of my life, in many ways.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's kind of pathetic to think about it all these years later, but can you guess what I gave her as a parting gift?

speaker: Byleth
text: Flowers?

speaker: Byleth
text: A book?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No, that makes too much sense. Actually, I gave her a dagger! You should have seen the look on her face!

speaker: Byleth
text: A dagger?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Huh. Good guess, Professor. But I swear, it came from the heart.

speaker: Dimitri
text: In Faerghus, we've long considered blades as tools of destiny. As a way to cut a path to a better future. She was being dragged all over, unable to live the life she wanted. I thought the dagger could help her cut out a path to the future she dreamed of. However...that was many years ago. I'm sure she's forgotten all about the boy I was back then.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'm afraid it's far too late for that. Things are different now. She's different. I'm different.  Anyway... I'm feeling a bit out of place here. Festivities like this don't suit me.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor... Will you join me for a bit? You must be getting a bit tired of the ball by now.

speaker: Sothis
text: But where is there to run? This place is filled with joyful students looking for a dance.

speaker: Sothis
text: It seems that everyone is having a delightful time. Will you not dance some more?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm tired.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'd rather not.

speaker: Sothis
text: How dull of you! Had I a body of my own... Oh, I would sing and dance until I fell upon the ground! But you... Hmph. Do as you will.

speaker: Sothis
text: Ah, you're not the only one who feels that way. Look over there.

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmph. I'm bored beyond compare. Will you not follow her?

speaker: Byleth
text: Why would I?

speaker: Byleth
text: I have no reason to.

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh, come on! Hurry up! I know that you are curious to see what she is up to... I hear...someone singing. From other there...

speaker: Rhea
text: ♪ In time's flow...see the glow of flames ever burning bright... On the swift river's drift, broken memories alight... ♪

speaker: Sothis
text: That song... I feel I have heard it in the past... Actually... It is not that I have heard it. I... Did I once sing that song to someone? No. There's more. I wrote this song... Oh, but how could that be so? If that were true, then how could she be singing it? Unless... No, no. I am suddenly so exhausted... As are you, no doubt? Quickly then. To bed with you.

speaker: Alois
text: Captain? Captain! Where are you? Hey, Professor. Have you seen your old man?

speaker: Alois
text: Too bad. I guess it will have to be you, then...

speaker: Jeralt
text: I'm back. Sorry for the delay, my last mission took longer than expected.

speaker: Alois
text: Captain! Thank goodness you're here. There are reports of Demonic Beasts near the chapel!

speaker: Jeralt
text: Nonsense. I haven't heard anything about the monastery's walls being breached.

speaker: Alois
text: That's why I'm heading there now, to see what's really going on. You'll join as well, won't you?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Of course. We're both sworn to protect this place.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where did they come from?

speaker: Byleth
text: Demonic Beasts?

speaker: Alois
text: It's odd. Just before they appeared, someone saw a number of students heading toward the chapel. They were apparently acting strange, as though they weren't in their right minds. Shortly after, Demonic Beasts started to appear, one after the other.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are the students safe?

speaker: Byleth
text: Were the students killed?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Hm... The students... There's no way those Demonic Beasts got in from the outside... But none of that matters right now. We need to act. Go summon your students.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Damn it... I wanted to talk to you about something important, but there's no time. There's never any damn time. But this is much more urgent, so it can hold for now. I'll meet you there.

speaker: Jeralt
text: There really are Demonic Beasts here... They're emerging from the chapel! I'll head that way. The rest of you, protect the students who weren't able to get away.

speaker: Student
text: Help me! These beasts... They're...

speaker: Student
text: Argh! Somebody help me!

speaker: Jeralt
text: That beast... There's a stone or something on its forehead...

speaker: Jeralt
text: Do you really think you can keep going? Don't push yourself too hard. Thinking about what happened in Remire village, it's clear you've gotten the hang of being a leader. Maybe you should have taken command of me too!

speaker: Jeralt
text: The Demonic Beasts were actually students? How can this be...

speaker: Student
text: Thank you! But my friends who couldn't get away... Are they OK?

speaker: Student
text: I was so scared... I'll find a way to repay you, I promise!

speaker: Student
text: Sorry. That was a close one...

speaker: Student
text: Phew... You saved me. Thank you!

speaker: Jeralt
text: There isn't a trace of evidence to be found in the chapel. This must have been something to do with Remire. Perhaps...

speaker: Monica
text: Wait!

speaker: Jeralt
text: Huh? Another student?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Run along now.

speaker: Monica
text: Thanks for all your help, sir.

speaker: Monica
text: You're just a pathetic old man. How dare you get in the way of my brilliant plan...you dog.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Run along now.

speaker: Monica
text: Thanks for all your help, sir.

speaker: Monica
text: Huh? What are you doing here?

speaker: Thales
text: You must survive. Merely because there is a role that I require you to fulfill.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Sorry. It looks like...I'm going to have to leave you now.

speaker: Jeralt
text: To think that the first time I saw you cry...your tears would be for me. It's sad, and yet...I'm happy for it. Thank you...kid.

speaker: Sothis
text: So this is where your father lived... Hm? Are you still crying? If turning back the hands of time was not enough to save his life, you must accept what came to pass was fate.

speaker: Byleth
text: It wasn't fate.

speaker: Sothis
text: Control yourself. Though Jeralt's death was at the hands of wicked ones, a fate is still a fate.

speaker: Byleth
text: Our enemies will pay.

speaker: Sothis
text: Agreed. We cannot let the wicked ones run free.

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh! Your father said to look for something here. He must be referring to whatever is behind that bookcase there...

speaker: Sothis
text: Your father's diary... Huh, his handwriting is prettier than his face would suggest. Well, well! These entries here are from before your birth. He seems to have been writing this for quite some time. Hm? Ah... Read that part there. Horsebow Moon, Year 1159...

speaker: Jeralt
text: Day 20 of the Horsebow Moon. All is cloudy. I can't believe she's dead. Lady Rhea said she died during childbirth. But is that the truth? And still, the child she traded her life for doesn't make a sound. Didn't even cry at birth.

speaker: Sothis
text: Well now! That baby must be you! That means... Hm? Someone is approaching us.

speaker: Dimitri
text: There you are. Lady Rhea is looking for you, Professor. And after your audience, why don't you join me at the dining hall? You haven't eaten since...since it happened. Have you?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Forgive me... I suppose it's too soon to try and coax you back into the normal swing of things. As for what happened to Jeralt... I'm so sorry. I'm sorry I couldn't do anything to stop it. Stay here until you've found some peace. I'll cover for you with Lady Rhea and everyone else.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We'll be waiting for you whenever you're ready to return to us.

speaker: Byleth
text: If only.

speaker: Dimitri
text: No need to put on a brave face. No one would blame you for taking time for yourself.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I don't believe it's a sign of strength to just keep going forward no matter what. Taking the time to grieve for those we've lost...there's strength in that too. That's what I think, anyway. That said... It's also important to remember that no matter how sad you are, eventually your tears will dry up. That's when you have to figure out what it is you're living for. Then you can cling to that, with all your might, and start moving forward again.

speaker: Byleth
text: What I'm living for?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Four years ago, in Duscur, I experienced the same pain you're feeling now. My father...was the strongest man I knew. Someone I loved and admired deeply. That day, he was killed before my eyes. His head severed clean off. My stepmother, the kindest person I had ever known, left me behind and disappeared into the infernal flames.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Everyone who I considered precious...my family and my closest friends...I couldn't save any of them. Not a single one. Now, the burden of the work they left behind falls on me. I must ensure they have no regrets. That's my duty, as the sole survivor of the tragedy. It's a heavy burden, but accepting it gave me the strength to pick myself up off the ground and start moving again. Start living again.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Jeralt is gone... So, what will you do now, Professor? What must you do? Look deep in your heart and I'm certain you'll find the answer there...indelible and inescapable.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I've probably bothered you enough for today, but I have just one more thought to leave you with. Even now, Seteth is gathering the knights to begin a full scale search for the enemy. It may not be right away, but before long they will find their trail.

speaker: Dimitri
text: No matter what happens or what anyone may say, know that I plan to stand by you, Professor. Through anything. Until the bitter end.

speaker: Sothis
text: Well? Did you search deep within yourself as he suggested? And did you find yourself some answers? This book is filled with secrets yet unknown. We must return another time to read the rest. Oh, but I have at least figured one thing out. I know now why our fates are intertwined...

speaker: Alois
text: Ah... Here you are. To think that Captain... that Jeralt would meet his end like that. I hope you know that you were the most important thing in the world to him.

speaker: Byleth
text: I was?

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you want?

speaker: Alois
text: He wasn't the most emotional guy. I'm sure expressing his affection wouldn't have come naturally to him. After what's happened, it's up to me now. I, Alois, swear to protect you in the captain's stead.  Sorry. This isn't the time for my blathering. Lady Rhea is looking for you. I came to tell you that. I'll take my leave now.

speaker: Sothis
text: This book is filled with secrets yet unknown. We must return another time to read the rest. Oh, but I have at least figured one thing out. I know now why our fates are intertwined...

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor. I have been waiting for you. I am filled with grief at the loss of our most celebrated knight. Jeralt was an ally of many years...and also a dear friend.

speaker: Byleth
text: Many years?

speaker: Byleth
text: When did you meet?

speaker: Rhea
text: It was a long while back. At the time, Jeralt was a soldier of the Kingdom. He was injured in battle, and I saved him just as he was about to perish. That was our first meeting. After that, he became a Knight of Seiros. He gave his all to the service of the church.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why did he leave the knights?

speaker: Byleth
text: But it had been so long since you last saw him...

speaker: Rhea
text: He...fell in love with one of the nuns here at Garreg Mach. Their love produced a child...whom she died giving birth to. It was her decision. She weighed her own life against that of her child's and, in the end, implored me to save the child. Your father...never truly accepted that decision. He took the child–took you–and disappeared without warning.

speaker: Byleth
text: Who was my mother?

speaker: Byleth
text: Did I inherit my Crest from my mother?

speaker: Rhea
text: Your mother...she was my...

speaker: Alois
text: Sorry for the interruption, Lady Rhea. There's something you must hear immediately. A report from the knights patrolling the area...

speaker: Rhea
text: Very well. Professor, you are dismissed for the day. Please rest and focus only on mending your heart. Understood?

speaker: Mounted Knight
text: Huh?

speaker: Soldier
text: Lady Seiros!

speaker: Seiros
text: Tell me, Nemesis, do you recall the Red Canyon?

speaker: Seiros
text: You'll die for that! Die, die! You took...everything... that I loved!

speaker: Seiros
text: He's gone now, Mother...

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh my. What could have brought you here?

speaker: Sothis
text: I wonder how you got in here… It is most rude to interrupt a moment of repose. Very rude indeed. Now come to me. I wish to have a look at you.

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmm... I have not seen the likes of you before. Who are you, anyway?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm a ghost.

speaker: Sothis
text: Do not deceive. You would do well to keep your wit in line.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm a demon.

speaker: Sothis
text: Do not deceive. You would do well to keep your wit in line.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm a mortal.

speaker: Sothis
text: I see. Then you must have a name of sorts. Go on.

speaker: Sothis
text: Huh. I shall not ever grow accustomed to the sound of human names. You must possess a day of birth as well. Beneath which moon and on what day were you born to this world?

speaker: Sothis
text: Well, wonders never cease! It seems we share our day of birth. How strange! Hmm. It all feels so...familiar. I think it may be time for yet another nap... It is almost...time to...begin...

speaker: Jeralt
text: Hey. Time to wake up.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Were you having that dream again?

speaker: Byleth
text: I was dreaming about a war...

speaker: Jeralt
text: Massive armies clashing on a vast field, right? There hasn’t been a battle like that in over three centuries…

speaker: Byleth
text: I was dreaming about a young girl...

speaker: Jeralt
text: You’ve described her to me before. I don’t think I’ve ever met anyone like that.

speaker: Jeralt
text: In any case, just put that out of your mind for now. The battlefield is no place for idle thoughts. Risking your life is part of the job for mercenaries like us. Letting your mind wander is a sure way to get yourself killed.

speaker: Jeralt
text: OK, time to get moving. Our next job is in the Kingdom. I told you before. It’s far from here, so we’ll need to leave at dawn.

speaker: Byleth
text: Oh, right...

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Hm? Good grief. Everyone is already waiting for us outside.

speaker: Mercenary
text: Jeralt! Sir! Sorry to barge in, but your presence is needed.

speaker: Jeralt
text: What's happened?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Please forgive our intrusion. We wouldn’t bother you were the situation not dire.

speaker: Jeralt
text: What do a bunch of kids like you want at this hour?

speaker: Dimitri
text: We’re being pursued by a group of bandits. I can only hope that you will be so kind as to lend your support.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Bandits? Here?

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's true. They attacked us while we were at rest in our camp.

speaker: Claude
text: We’ve been separated from our companions and we’re outnumbered. They’re after our lives…not to mention our gold.

speaker: Jeralt
text: I’m impressed you’re staying so calm considering the situation. I… Wait. That uniform…

speaker: Mercenary
text: Bandits spotted just outside the village! Damn… There are a lot of them.

speaker: Jeralt
text: I guess they followed you all the way here. We can’t abandon this village now. Come on, let’s move. Hope you’re ready.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Let’s take care of those thieves before they overrun the village. Take down the enemies in front first. That should take the wind out of their sails.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You have a strange aura about you… You say you’re a mercenary, so show me what you can do.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Thank you. We are in your debt. It wouldn’t do for us to fall in a place like this. Please, lend us your strength. Let’s work together to drive out these thieves!

speaker: Claude
text: It’s because of you guys that I’m not dead right now. Thanks for that! I didn’t expect to run into mercenaries like you in some remote village. The gods of fortune must be smiling on me!

speaker: Jeralt
text: We’ll advance while protecting ourselves from the enemy. Take up position inside the forest.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Yes, good. If we’re in the forest, we can sustain their attacks without losing the advantage.

speaker: Jeralt
text: This is a fine opportunity. Use the combat arts I taught you!

speaker: Jeralt
text: Attack when an ally is nearby, and the enemy will be intimidated, making them easier to hit.

speaker: Kostas
text: Damn. Why are there mercenaries in the village? Guess we'll have to deal with them too.

speaker: Kostas
text: I'm gonna kill you where you stand...

speaker: Kostas
text: What the?! Aren't you Jeralt the Blade Breaker? What's a renowned mercenary like you doing here?

speaker: Jeralt
text: I'm the one who should be complaining. I'm caught up in the mess you started!

speaker: Kostas
text: Hey, you with the blank stare! Outta my way!

speaker: Kostas
text: You'll die!

speaker: Sothis
text: Honestly! What are you accomplishing with that little stunt?! It’s like you’re trying to get me killed, you fool!

speaker: Sothis
text: Well, it’s fine. After all, if you don’t know the value of your own life, you’re not going to protect it very well, are you? Course not.  Well then, I guess it’s up to me to guide you from now on, right? You can call me Sothis…but I’m also known as “The Beginning”.

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmm… Sothis… Yes, that is it. My name is Sothis. And I am also called…The Beginning. But who once called me that?

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sothis?

speaker: Sothis
text: I was not able to recall my name…until just now. And just like that, it came to me. How odd. That look upon your face… Did you think me a child? A mere child who forgot her own name?! Phooey! That “child” just saved your life! And what does that make you?

speaker: Byleth
text: I am no child.

speaker: Sothis
text: Ha! Such arrogance. You look the part but are you truly an adult?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm less than a child?

speaker: Sothis
text: Correct! You understand.

speaker: Sothis
text: You threw yourself before an axe to save just one young girl. Yet all is well, as I have stalled the flow of time for now. You would have died had I not intervened.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you.

speaker: Sothis
text: There now. Is gratitude so much to ask? I did deem you worth saving, after all.

speaker: Byleth
text: You stopped time?

speaker: Sothis
text: Hm. I do not hear your gratitude. Perhaps I should force you to leave?  There now. Is gratitude so much to ask? I did deem you worth saving, after all.

speaker: Sothis
text: Though it is only momentary, time has stopped. However did I manage that...

speaker: Byleth
text: What will happen when time resumes?

speaker: Byleth
text: What now?

speaker: Sothis
text: When time begins again, the axe will tear into your flesh, and you will surely meet your end. How rude of you to drag me into this! Now what to do…

speaker: Byleth
text: Turn back the hands of time.

speaker: Sothis
text: Of course! I must turn back the hands of time!

speaker: Byleth
text: Keep time frozen until I'm safe.

speaker: Sothis
text: That is ridiculous! Oh, but perhaps... Of course! I must turn back the hands of time!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll just stay here and wait to die.

speaker: Sothis
text: As though I could stand idly by and watch that come to pass! Oh, but perhaps... Of course! I must turn back the hands of time!

speaker: Sothis
text: Yes... I do believe it can be done. You really are quite troublesome. I cannot wind back time too far, but all is well. You are aware of what’s to come, which means you can protect yourself this time. Now, go… Yes, you who bears the flames within. Drift through the flow of time to find the answers that you seek…

speaker: Edelgard
text: Huh?

speaker: Kostas
text: You'll die!

speaker: Claude
text: Hey–over here!

speaker: Jeralt
text: Hey... Did you just...

speaker: Alois
text: The Knights of Seiros are here! We'll cut you down for terrorizing our students. Hey, the thieves are running away! Go after them! The students seem to be unharmed. And...who's this?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Ugh... Why him?

speaker: Event
text: An Unexpected Reunion

speaker: Alois
text: Captain Jeralt?! It is you! Goodness, it’s been ages. Don’t you recognize me? It’s Alois! Your old right-hand man! Well, that’s how I always thought of myself anyway. It must have been 20 years ago that you went missing without a trace. I always knew you were still alive!

speaker: Jeralt
text: You haven’t changed a bit, Alois. Just as loud as ever. And drop that “captain” nonsense. I’m not your captain anymore. These days I’m just a wandering mercenary. One who has work to do. Good-bye, old friend.

speaker: Alois
text: Right... Good-bye, Captain. Wait! That isn't how this ends. I insist that you return to the monastery with me!

speaker: Jeralt
text: Garreg Mach Monastery... I suppose this was inevitable.

speaker: Alois
text: And how about you, kid? Are you the captain's child?

speaker: Byleth
text: He is a stranger to me.

speaker: Alois
text: Great sense of humor, this one. Clearly cut from the same cloth as the captain.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm a bandit.

speaker: Alois
text: Great sense of humor, this one. Clearly cut from the same cloth as the captain.

speaker: Byleth
text: That is correct.

speaker: Alois
text: Is that so? Well, physical differences aside, your mannerisms do remind me of the captain.

speaker: Alois
text: I'd love for you to see the monastery too. You will join me, won't you?

speaker: Alois
text: What's troubling you, Captain? You aren't about to run off again, are you?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Even I wouldn't dare run from the Knights of Seiros.

speaker: Sothis
text: The Knights of Seiros... They do seem rather skilled.

speaker: Sothis
text: Ah. It seems your presence is required. Get going!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I appreciate your help back there. Your skill is beyond question. You’re clearly an experienced mercenary. And your father...that would be Jeralt, the Blade Breaker? Former captain of the Knights of Seiros. Oft praised as the strongest knight to ever live. Have I missed anything?

speaker: Byleth
text: The Knights of Seiros?

speaker: Edelgard
text: You haven’t heard of the Knights of Seiros? The most famous order of knights in all of Fódlan?

speaker: Byleth
text: I didn't know he was a captain.

speaker: Edelgard
text: How curious. I’d wager the explanation for that is fascinating indeed.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey! You are coming with us to the monastery, right? Of course you are. I’d love to bend your ear as we travel. Oh, I should mention that the three of us are students of the Officers Academy at Garreg Mach Monastery. We were doing some training exercises when those bandits attacked. I definitely got the worst of it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That would be because you ran off.

speaker: Claude
text: Too true! I was the first to make a strategic retreat. Everything would have worked out if these two hadn’t followed me and ruined everything. Because of them, every single one of those bandits chased after us. Utterly ridiculous.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ah, so that’s what you were thinking, Claude. And here I thought you were acting as a decoy for the sake of us all.

speaker: Edelgard
text: His intentions were as clear as day. You will prove a lacking ruler if you cannot see the truth behind a person's words.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hm. You will prove a lacking ruler if you look for deceit behind every word and fail to trust those whom you rely on.

speaker: Claude
text: Oh, joy. A royal debate between Their Highnesses. I wonder how being completely predictable affects one’s ability to wield power. Personally, as the embodiment of distrust, I’d say your little exchange smacks of naiveté.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Me? Naïve? Tell me, are you actually incapable of keeping quiet, or is your lack of self-awareness a condition of some sort?

speaker: Dimitri
text: In any case, forgive our digression. I must speak with you, if you can spare a moment. The way you held your ground against the bandits’ leader was captivating! You never lost control of the situation. It showed me I still have much to learn.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Your skill is precisely why I must ask you to consider lending your services to the Empire. I might as well tell you now. I am no mere student. I am also the Adrestian Empire’s–

speaker: Dimitri
text: Halt, Edelgard. Please allow me to finish my own proposition. The Holy Kingdom of Faerghus is in dire need of exceptional individuals such as yourself. Please, do consider returning to the Kingdom with me.

speaker: Claude
text: Whoa, there! You two sure are hasty. Trying to recruit someone you just met. Tactless, really. I was personally planning to develop a deep and lasting friendship on our journey back to the monastery before begging for favors. But it seems there’s no time for niceties in this world. So, capable stranger, let’s get right to it. Where does your allegiance lie?

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmm. It seems one's place of birth is quite significant to them. Yet they are so impressed by you, that you may take your pick. Well?

speaker: Byleth
text: Adrestian Empire: Land of Ancient History

speaker: Edelgard
text: A wise choice. Though the Empire has fallen from its former glory, the other regions are merely offshoots that pale in comparison.

speaker: Byleth
text: Holy Kingdom of Faerghus: Land of Noble Knights

speaker: Dimitri
text: Understood. Faerghus is a noble and distinguished kingdom that has always valued chivalry.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leicester Alliance: Burgeoning League of Nobles

speaker: Claude
text: Is that right? Well, that’s a win for the Alliance, so I suppose I’m obligated to be happy.

speaker: Alois
text: All right, that's enough with the small talk. It's time to head back to the monastery.

speaker: Claude
text: Looks like we'll have to pick this up another time.

speaker: Sothis
text: My, my. They are in such a hurry. You know... Each of the three is most unique.

speaker: Byleth
text: Edelgard…

speaker: Byleth
text: Dimitri…

speaker: Byleth
text: Claude…

speaker: Sothis
text: Yes, I thought the same. I am so sleepy once again... I may be sleeping...but I...

speaker: Rhea
text: As I believe you are already aware, Seteth's younger sister, Flayn, has gone missing. At present, all we know for certain is that she has not left Garreg Mach.

speaker: Seteth
text: Flayn is not the type of person to just wander off on her own without telling me where she is going! We have searched the monastery thoroughly, but have found nothing. I am now mobilizing the knights to begin searching the town. Troubling rumors have been running rampant lately. I do not wish to consider the worst, but...

speaker: Byleth
text: Troubling rumors?

speaker: Byleth
text: What is it you're afraid of?

speaker: Rhea
text: There are rumors of someone prowling the streets and attacking innocents, night after night. The knights have investigated the matter. They have not discovered any remains, nor have they found any concrete evidence.

speaker: Seteth
text: The people are panicked! They all insist someone called the Death Knight is coming to claim their souls with his blade. There is no way she could have escaped unscathed if she were captured by such a fiend! Where is she?!

speaker: Rhea
text: Seteth, recall that impatience begets error. Please do your best to calm yourself. I think of your...sister as family as well. You know that. You have my support. We will devote ourselves fully–mind, body, and soul–to recovering her.  Professor. Your mission for this month is to help find Flayn. The knights have the town covered, so I ask that you focus your efforts on searching the monastery again. We do not have time to waste. You have your orders.

speaker: Hubert
text: Flayn has gone missing? Most unsettling.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It doesn't seem likely that she's simply gotten lost. I'll help in any way that I can.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: So, our mission this month is to find her? Well then, let us hurry and locate her before anyone else!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I hope Flayn is OK! What would happen if... Just what would we do if...

speaker: Dorothea
text: You can't think like that, Bern. Seteth would have a heart attack if he heard you.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I've heard that she has a Crest, but I suppose, for this moment, that is irrelevant.

speaker: Hubert
text: We'll start by gathering information. Someone must have seen Flayn recently.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Right. If we work together, I'm certain we'll find her.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Flayn has disappeared? Seteth must be beside himself.

speaker: Sylvain
text: So finding little Flayn is our mission for this moon? Leave it to me, Professor. Chasing after girls is my specialty.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Sylvain... Even you must agree that now isn't the time for jokes.

speaker: Annette
text: I hope Flayn is OK. I've heard rumors about some Death Knight running around town...

speaker: Felix
text: Sounds intriguing. I had been hoping to cross blades with him.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Felix! Please consider how Seteth must be feeling right now.

speaker: Dimitri
text: In any case, we must start our search at once. Every moment matters. On your order, Professor, let's try to collect as much information as we can.

speaker: Hilda
text: What? Flayn is missing?!

speaker: Claude
text: So, finding Flayn is our mission for the month, I take it?

speaker: Raphael
text: Wait. Who's Flayn?

speaker: Leonie
text: Seteth's little sister. Surely you've seen her flitting about the monastery.

speaker: Lysithea
text: She is the girl who looks about the same age as me, but seems well beyond her years.

speaker: Hilda
text: Seteth is much older than Flayn. He's always looking out for her. He must be worried sick. If I were to go missing, I can't imagine what that would do to my brother.

speaker: Claude
text: When searching for someone, it's best to start by gathering information. Hopefully someone has seen Flayn.

speaker: Dedue
text: I'm on the lookout for suspicious individuals. The only place I've yet to check is the library.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll go together.

speaker: Dedue
text: As you wish.

speaker: Byleth
text: Get some rest.

speaker: Dedue
text: As you wish. After I check the library.

speaker: Dedue
text: Candlelight... And who is that?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it Flayn?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it the Death Knight?

speaker: Dedue
text: No, it isn't. Impossible...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor. Dedue. What are you up to at this hour?

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness! My apologies.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Oh, none necessary. I'm sorry for startling you. I was just doing some research. But I'm just about finished. I didn't realize how late it had gotten. We'd better head back to our quarters, Dedue. Until tomorrow, Professor.

speaker: Sothis
text: A most unusual man! Whatever could he have been looking for so late at night? Hm? That book is quite askew... He must have rushed to put it back upon the shelf.

speaker: Sothis
text: It seems to be a record of donations from nobility. Arundel... That's not a name I know. But look at that! This Arundel gave quite a sum each year... That is, until the year 1174. He must have died or fallen to financial woe. Hmm... I can't imagine what this has to do with Flayn.

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh my... Just one small girl who's gone astray has caused all this. We cannot let this stand. You must do all you can to find out where's she's gone. Now ask around to see what information you can find. Come now! No time to waste!

speaker: Edelgard
text: We must begin our search for Flayn, Professor. If she ran off on her own free will, that's her business. But that may not be the case. For her sake, I suggest we assume that she was abducted and begin an investigation. Who benefits from kidnapping her? Let's gather all the information we can on anyone who's been acting strangely.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Manuela ran off with Jeritza's mask? Hmm... We'll have to speak with both of them. But where could Manuela be? Jertiza is likely at the training grounds or in his quarters on the eastern side of the knights' hall.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Flayn is missing... We should split up and search for her. There isn't a moment to waste. We must find her before it's too late.

speaker: Dimitri
text: When I consider how Seteth must be feeling, my heart breaks. We must find Flayn as soon as possible. There are no signs of her having left the monastery, but we cannot safely rule out any possibility just yet. I'm wasting precious time standing about trying to think of a solution. I'll survey the monastery and see what information I can gather. There must be someone who has a clue as to Flayn's whereabouts.

speaker: Dimitri
text: What? Professor Manuela ran off with Professor Jeritza's mask? I have a bad feeling about this... We must find them both at once! Professor Jeritza will be at the training grounds or his quarters. I believe the latter can be found on the eastern side of the knights' hall.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I have thoroughly surveyed the entire monastery, and yet I have not found a single trace of evidence that suggests Flayn was abducted. Perhaps we must seek out personal recounts rather than physical evidence... In any case, we must hurry before something terrible happens.

speaker: Claude
text: No sign of her leaving the monastery, eh? That is, assuming we can actually trust that information...

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, but I'm sure this space has no shortage of secret passages and hiding spots!

speaker: Claude
text: True. For now, there's not much we can do aside from making a thorough search of the monastery.

speaker: Hilda
text: Let's ask around and see what we turn up. You never know who might have seen something.

speaker: Claude
text: Professor Manuela ran off with Professor Jeritza's mask? What could that possibly mean?

speaker: Hilda
text: Well, that's suspicious! Sounds like we should try talking to them.

speaker: Claude
text: Professor Jeritza is almost certainly in the training grounds or his quarters. Where was that again? Oh, over on the eastern side of the knights' hall.

speaker: Claude
text: Flayn's gone missing? Where could she be? If it were an ordinary kidnapping, you'd think there'd be a demand for ransom or something by now. I don't like the sound of this...

speaker: Hubert
text: If Flayn has been taken hostage, then we know she is alive. At least for now. There would be no point to abducting her if simple murder was the objective. That's only logical, Professor.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: A beautiful, delicate maiden vanishing into thin air... It is like something out of a book. If it were a book, we would have no need to worry! She would be rescued presently by a dashing nobleman. Do you have any idea as to where she might be? Where she might have wandered off to?

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps she went looking for treats?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: That is what I thought! Why I am here, in fact. But she is nowhere to be seen.

speaker: Byleth
text: To the greenhouse, for some flowers?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Hmm, the greenhouse. I did not think of that. I will take a look around there later.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Flayn? No, I haven't seen her. She's been abducted. Oh, you're looking for her. Sorry, my mind was somewhere else. I just recently learned she has a Crest. Did you know that, Professor? If it was a particularly rare Crest, I could imagine Professor Hanneman would have quite an intense interest in her. Oh, no, I'm not accusing Professor Hanneman of abducting Flayn.

speaker: Caspar
text: I don't know if she ran off or got kidnapped or what! I just know that Flayn's in trouble. That's it! I can't keep sitting around. I gotta go find her! Now where do I start?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Uh, Flayn's not in here! Ugh, I guess I have to let you in to prove it, don't I?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: There. See? No one's in Bernie's room but Bernie. Maybe Flayn just wanted to be alone for a while. Have you considered that? Come to think of it, where is her room, anyway?

speaker: Dorothea
text: Hey, Professor, have you seen Manuela? I saw her running off somewhere in a terrible hurry. I wonder if it has anything to do with Flayn's disappearance. Do you know, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: You're on first-name terms with Professor Manuela?

speaker: Dorothea
text: Oh, yes. Didn't you know? She was the senior diva in our Opera Company.

speaker: Petra
text: Flayn was childnapped. That is what you are thinking? And the villain is inside our monastery? Hmm. I must have admittance. One person...has been catching my eye. Shamir is a knight not like other knights. Her movements are being reminders of...no, they remind me of warriors of Brigid. Before she was here, what was she getting up to...

speaker: Dedue
text: I've heard the monastery is full of secret passages. If there is no sign of Flayn's departure, it's possible that she used one of those. Whatever has happened, I hope she is all right.

speaker: Felix
text: Ah, you're looking for Flayn's kidnapper. I can't say anything for sure, but I do have suspicions about Jeritza. There's something about how he's handling his blade lately. It seems more...impulsive than usual. It couldn't hurt to try speaking with him, at least. At this hour, I think you'll find him sparring with Catherine at the training grounds.

speaker: Ashe
text: I heard something like this happened last year too. Neither the culprit nor the missing student were ever found last time. Some people say it was the work of evil spirits.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe it was.

speaker: Ashe
text: D-don't say things like that, Professor! I'm sure the culprit is, you know, corporeal. We'll catch whoever it is!

speaker: Byleth
text: Then it could be the same culprit.

speaker: Ashe
text: I thought the same. Could there be a connection?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ow! Ingrid just about slapped the teeth out of my head. All I did was suggest that Flayn had eloped...

speaker: Byleth
text: Quite an insensitive joke.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Insensitive? I was just exploring possibilities!

speaker: Byleth
text: Is that a possibility?

speaker: Sylvain
text: I don't know. I was just suggesting things, then suddenly I was seeing stars and Ingrid was yelling at me.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Do you really think Flayn was kidnapped?

speaker: Byleth
text: She must have been.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I have a feeling you're right. We really need to find her, and quickly!

speaker: Byleth
text: There must be another explanation.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Do you think she ran off on her own? That doesn't put me any more at ease.

speaker: Annette
text: There have been a lot of rumors swirling around lately about a Death Knight who kidnaps people from the nearby town... You don't think Flayn was...you know. Do you?

speaker: Byleth
text: We can't rule it out.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't believe so.

speaker: Annette
text: Whether the rumors are true or not, I just hope our Flayn is safe...

speaker: Ingrid
text: To think that Flayn would disappear like this... Seteth must be worried sick. I haven't got much to go off of, and perhaps it's out of line for me to feel so uncomfortable... But something has been bothering me for a while about Gilbert. I feel as though I've met him somewhere before... I also noticed him staring intently at Annette once. Hmm...

speaker: Lorenz
text: If Flayn were taken hostage, I expect we would have received demands from the culprit by now. Perhaps this is not a kidnapping at all. Do you suppose she could have simply run away?

speaker: Byleth
text: That's possible.

speaker: Lorenz
text: If that is the case, it is unlikely that we will find her anywhere in the monastery.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Lorenz
text: What could it be, then? What possible motive could there be to abduct her?

speaker: Raphael
text: I hope Flayn isn't going hungry. If someone really kidnapped her, I'll never forgive them! Now that I think about it, I saw Alois hanging out by the pond not too long ago. He was always getting into trouble for trying to talk to Flayn, you know. It's probably a crazy thought, but I'm starting to worry.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I've only ever spoken to Flayn a handful of times. She always seemed so naive about the ways of the world. I'm worried about her.

speaker: Byleth
text: You think she'd be easily deceived?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Yes, I'm afraid so. I just hope she comes home safe.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you have feelings for Flayn?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Wh-what makes you say that?! This is hardly the time for teasing, you know!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Reflecting on it now, Flayn has always seemed a rather odd person. She appears young, yet there's something about her that seems much older than her years suggest. And she's quite wise, but also surprisingly naive...

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe she's lived a very sheltered life.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Hmm, you might be right. Whatever the case, Seteth seems to care for her more than anything.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe she's actually a ghost.

speaker: Lysithea
text: A ghost?! Don't be absurd!

speaker: Marianne
text: Dear Goddess, hear my prayer... Please watch over Flayn... Please protect her...

speaker: Hilda
text: I bet Flayn ran away. She couldn't stand being held back by Seteth any longer. I can emphasize. I know what it's like to have an overbearing big brother.

speaker: Leonie
text: Where could Flayn have gone? Do you think she's really been kidnapped? I hear Tomas has been going around asking about her... But he's probably just worried like the rest of us. Though it wasn't just Flayn. He was asking about you and Captain Jeralt too.

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor, have you still not found any leads regarding Flayn's whereabouts? I have looked everywhere. Not even the knights on guard have seen anything of note.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're searching too?

speaker: Rhea
text: I, too, care for Flayn. She is like family to me.

speaker: Byleth
text: We will find her, together.

speaker: Rhea
text: Yes, let us work together. It reassures me to have you by my side.

speaker: Rhea
text: May the goddess protect dear Flayn until she returns to us...

speaker: Byleth
text: I will find her. I swear it.

speaker: Seteth
text: That is all I ask. Please, lend me your aid!

speaker: Byleth
text: Try not to worry.

speaker: Seteth
text: You ask the impossible. Oh, Flayn...

speaker: Seteth
text: She would have never left the monastery of her own volition. Why is there not a trace of her to be found?!

speaker: Alois
text: Hey there, Professor. Did you want to talk?  What?! Me, abduct Flayn?! You can't really believe I did that!

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you find anything in the pond?

speaker: Alois
text: Well, this may sound silly, but... I was too scared to even look. I couldn't bear the thought of finding her in its depths.

speaker: Byleth
text: I hear she was always yelling at you...

speaker: Alois
text: Oh, that's just because of my dumb jokes. She says that they're not very good. But if I went around kidnapping everyone who said that, the whole monastery would be empty!

speaker: Catherine
text: Did you hear about Flayn? It's just one thing after another this year, I swear. Some of the lower-ranked knights are searching for her in the town. If they find anything, I'll know.  What? Jeritza? Hm, come to think of it, I haven't seen him today. What would make you suspect him?

speaker: Byleth
text: That mask he wears is suspicious.

speaker: Byleth
text: I heard that he goes out every night.

speaker: Catherine
text: I see. Well, I'll let the knights know.

speaker: Shamir
text: What brings you here? I'm taking a break.  Is this about Flayn? You find me suspicious? Hah.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're not from Fódlan.

speaker: Shamir
text: True. Your point being?

speaker: Byleth
text: What did you do before coming to the monastery?

speaker: Shamir
text: I was somewhere else. Fighting. Is that a problem?

speaker: Shamir
text: I understand that I don't fit in among the Knights of Seiros... But that hardly links me to Flayn's disappearance.

speaker: Shamir
text: Working hard, aren't you? I'll admit, I'm impressed. I can assist with any tasks, or help with your students

speaker: Shamir
text: On it. I'm available anytime I'm not on a mission with the knights.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Miss Flayn's whereabouts are unknown? I pray she is safe... We do not seem to have any leads at present.  I am one of the suspects, am I? Well, hopefully I can lay your suspicions to rest. Do you know of my, let's call it...unique situation?

speaker: Byleth
text: Your true identity?

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you mean Annette?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I was once a knight in service to the Faerghus royal family. If Ingrid believes she saw me before, it was likely in Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital. Annette is... She is my... But no, I would appreciate it, Professor, if you would ask no more.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Because of Flayn's disappearance, all of the knights are searching nonstop. But we haven't found a single lead. Seteth's face is getting paler by the minute. It's hard to watch.  What's that? You're looking for Manuela? Well, I did pass by her earlier. She was carrying something. A mask of some sort...

speaker: Byleth
text: Jeritza's mask?

speaker: Jeralt
text: I'm not close to the guy, so I can't say for sure. But come to think of it, you could be right.

speaker: Byleth
text: Flayn's mask?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Are you feeling all right? When have you ever seen Flayn wearing a mask?

speaker: Hanneman
text: Young Flayn's disappearance is most troubling.  What? Who would suspect me? You know what? I'll tell you who. A fool. That's who.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is her Crest rare enough to justify kidnapping her?

speaker: Hanneman
text: Flayn's Crest, the Major Crest of Cethleann, is rare, but there are others who possess it.

speaker: Byleth
text: You have already investigated her thoroughly?

speaker: Hanneman
text: Alas, Seteth would never allow that. However, while Flayn's Major Crest of Cethleann is rare, there are other who possess it.

speaker: Tomas
text: Is something the matter? I see. So, Flayn has gone missing. I will do what I can to support the search.  Hm? It seems that you are a bit suspicious of me. Might I ask your reasons?

speaker: Byleth
text: Why were you asking about Flayn?

speaker: Tomas
text: I was away from the monastery for a few years, but do not forget... I have spent more than four decades in total working here at Garreg Mach Monastery. Yet it was not until recently that I learned that Seteth has a sister.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why were you asking about my father?

speaker: Tomas
text: It has been two decades since I last knew Jeralt, yet he looks nearly identical to my memory of him.

speaker: Tomas
text: It is only natural to be curious, don't you think? I assure you, there is nothing more to it than that.

speaker: Cyril
text: I can't believe Flayn just disappeared. I don't like it one little bit. Oh, are you here to see someone? Alois and Shamir and all the knights are gonna head into town soon.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Today...there is quite a bit to report! There is a masked individual who has been going into town every evening and not returning until the following morning. You see? Nothing gets past this guard! I doubt it has anything to do with Flayn's disappearance, but... Well, better safe than sorry, I always say.

speaker: Student
text: Professor! I saw him! A knight wielding a gigantic scythe! He was just like the rumors say! All covered in jet-black armor! It was the Death Knight, I just know it! You don't think he has something to do with Flayn's disappearance...do you?

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: I can only imagine how worried Seteth must be, but isn't mobilizing the entire order of knights a bit...excessive? I was originally assigned to investigate those reports of the Death Knight in the town near Garreg Mach. When I think how many more victims that dastard might claim while we're all busy searching for Flayn... I'm sorry... That was insensitive. We're all under a lot of stress right now. It's important that we find her quickly.

speaker: Monk
text: I've served here at Garreg Mach in some capacity or another for several decades now. But after all that time, even I can't claim to know everything about the layout. Searching the entire interior of the monastery is a more difficult task than you may think. It makes you wonder who designed such a titanic compound. There are fragments of records remaining from its original construction, but none of them name an actual architect...

speaker: Monk
text: This might be the first time I've ever seen Seteth look so worn down. If poor Flayn was lured away by anyone... I personally think the clear suspect is that miscreant from Duscur. Those people are deceptive by nature...

speaker: Student
text: The whole monastery has been turned upside down! I wonder if we're still going to have the Battle of the Eagle and Lion next month. It's a yearly tradition, but with things the way they are right now...it's hard to imagine. At any rate, I hope they find Flayn soon.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It seems Flayn is still missing. What could have happened to her?

speaker: Caspar
text: Everyone, hurry! I heard a scream from Professor Jeritza's room!

speaker: Sothis
text: Jeritza... Ah! The combat professor with the mask. He has always been rather suspicious. We must hurry!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor Jeritza? Are you there?

speaker: Hubert
text: He does not seem to be here... Hm? On the ground! Professor Manuela!

speaker: Byleth
text: Is she injured?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is she...dead?

speaker: Edelgard
text: No, She's unconscious. Someone clearly attacked her.

speaker: Hubert
text: Look at her hand. It looks as though she is pointing at something... There.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's an opening behind that shelf. Perhaps a secret passageway...

speaker: Hanneman
text: What is the meaning of... Wait, is that Manuela? What happened here?

speaker: Edelgard
text: We know as much as you do. She needs to be taken to the infirmary.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Yes, of course–and quickly. Give me a hand, child.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Understood. I'll support her head. Professor, I'll be back shortly. Please be careful.

speaker: Caspar
text: Does this mean Professor Jeritza did it? Could he also have kidnapped Flayn?!

speaker: Hubert
text: We should start by investigating this passageway. Do you agree, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's investigate.

speaker: Hubert
text: Agreed. The culprit could be hiding inside.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should call for the knights.

speaker: Hubert
text: We don't have time for that. It would be on us if the culprit escaped.

speaker: Caspar
text: That settles it! We'll take the offensive. Here we come, you monsters!

speaker: Hubert
text: Shall we, Professor?

speaker: Dimitri
text: We still don't know where Flayn is... But we can't give up. Not until she's found.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Professor! Your Highness! I just heard a scream! In Professor Jeritza's quarters!

speaker: Sothis
text: Jeritza... Ah! The combat professor with the mask. He has always been rather suspicious. We must hurry!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Isn't that... Professor Manuela!

speaker: Annette
text: Professor Manuela! Please wake up! Professor Manuela!

speaker: Byleth
text: Is she injured?

speaker: Dimitri
text: She's still breathing...but she needs medical attention immediately!

speaker: Byleth
text: Is she...dead?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No, I believe she's just unconscious. But this wound requires immediate attention!

speaker: Annette
text: Look! Do you see Professor Manuela's hand? It's like she's pointing at something...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I see it! Behind that shelf! Could it be a secret passage?

speaker: Hanneman
text: What is the meaning of... Wait, is that Manuela? What happened here? We must take her to the infirmary immediately. You! Don't just stand there! Help me carry her.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Of course. I'll return shortly, Professor.

speaker: Annette
text: Do you think this is related to Flayn's disappearance?

speaker: Dedue
text: What should we do, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's investigate.

speaker: Annette
text: It looks dark...uh...dark in there.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Aw, you've always been scared of dark places, haven't you, Annie? But don't worry! The professor and I will protect you.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should call for the knights.

speaker: Annette
text: You're right. We should call for help.

speaker: Ashe
text: But the culprit could flee while we wait! Sh-shouldn't we take a look?

speaker: Dedue
text: There are sounds coming from within. If we're going to investigate, now is the time.

speaker: Mercedes
text: We'll be OK, I'm sure of it. Are you ready, Professor?

speaker: Claude
text: There's still no sign of Flayn... What should we do, Teach? I'll admit, I'm out of schemes here.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Professor! Claude! Something's very wrong. Please hurry to Professor Jeritza's room!

speaker: Claude
text: Knock, knock. Is anybody...whoa! Professor Manuela!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I heard a scream coming from here just moments ago. It must have been Professor Manuela!

speaker: Byleth
text: Is she injured?

speaker: Claude
text: She's unconscious. She was clearly attacked by someone.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is she...dead?

speaker: Claude
text: No, I believe she's just unconscious. It looks like she was attacked by someone.

speaker: Hilda
text: Hey! It kind of looks like Professor Manuela is...pointing at something.

speaker: Claude
text: So we follow where she's pointing and... Oh? What do we have here? There's a rather suspicious hole behind that shelf.

speaker: Hanneman
text: What is the meaning of... Wait, is that Manuela? What happened here? We must take her to the infirmary immediately. You! Don't just stand there! Help me carry her.

speaker: Claude
text: Right, right. Hold down the fort for me, Teach. I'll be back once we get Professor Manuela taken care of.

speaker: Ignatz
text: What could have happened here? And where is Professor Jeritza?

speaker: Hilda
text: This must be related to that girl's disappearance. What if she's being held captive down there? No, no, that's crazy... Right?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's investigate.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Right... It's scary, but... OK.

speaker: Hilda
text: Don't be a coward, Ignatz. We'll be fine as long as we stick close to the professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should call for the knights.

speaker: Ignatz
text: But...what if something bad happens while we're searching for the knights?

speaker: Hilda
text: You mean, like, a captured girl being strangled or something?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Ah...you're right. What should we do?

speaker: Hilda
text: We've got to investigate. Lead the way, Professor.

speaker: Ignatz
text: The culprit may be hiding inside, so let's be extra cautious!

speaker: Hubert
text: I never would have imagined... Hm? I see someone. They're unconscious.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it Flayn?

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes, and there is someone else too. It appears to be another student.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it Jeritza?

speaker: Hubert
text: No, Professor. It's two young girls.

speaker: Caspar
text: Someone's coming! I recognize that scythe and mask... It's that jerk we fought at the Holy Mausoleum!

speaker: Annette
text: What is this place? It's so...BAH! I see someone! I think...they're unconscious.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it Flayn?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Yes, I see Flayn! But...who is this other person?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it Jeritza?

speaker: Felix
text: Are you blind? They're obviously female. And there are two of them.

speaker: Annette
text: Professor! Someone's coming from farther in! That scythe... Is that the knight who attacked the Holy Mausoleum?

speaker: Hilda
