text: It's way too creepy down here. And it smells funny. And...BAH! A person! They're...unconscious.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it Flayn?

speaker: Hilda
text: Yes! It's Flayn! Oh, but there's someone else too...

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it Jeritza?

speaker: Hilda
text: Look closer, Professor. There are two girls.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Someone is coming! That scythe... Could it be the knight we fought at the Holy Mausoleum?

speaker: Death Knight
text: That sword. You must be... One of us will die, the other will live. I will enjoy this dance of damnation.

speaker: Hubert
text: Our objective is to recover Flayn. Let us hope we are not too late.

speaker: Hubert
text: Hmm. Something odd about the floor over there. What will happen if we step on it?

speaker: Hubert
text: Contraptions in the floor. Stay alert.

speaker: Hubert
text: Interesting apparatus. I wonder if we can operate it.

speaker: Flame Emperor Soldier
text: So, you have come! I'll make sure you never leave!

speaker: Dedue
text: That knight looks like death itself. We must rescue Flayn immediately.

speaker: Dedue
text: There's something strange about the flooring at the end of the corridor. Something might happen if you step there.

speaker: Dedue
text: Some kind of contraption has been activated.

speaker: Dedue
text: What is this device? It appears operational.

speaker: Hilda
text: Professor, we need to defeat the Death Knight, and then rescue Flayn!

speaker: Hilda
text: Hm. Look at that strange tile over there. I bet something will happen if you step on it.

speaker: Hilda
text: Whoa. Look at those weird contraptions on the floor.

speaker: Hilda
text: I wonder what that is? Looks like you can use it, but who knows what'll happen.

speaker: Death Knight
text: I have no need of you...

speaker: Death Knight
text: Now, you will die together... How joyous...

speaker: Hubert
text: You should withdraw from here.

speaker: Death Knight
text: I don't take orders from you...

speaker: Death Knight
text: Kill them.
Halt. You're having a bit too much fun.

speaker: Death Knight
text: You are getting in the way of my game.
Hmph. You'll have more opportunities to play soon. Your work here is done.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Understood. I will go...
We will cross paths again. I am the Flame Emperor... It is I who will reforge the world.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Flame Emperor? Rather worrisome that he sounds intent on showing up again.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Are they both OK? We should get them out of here.

speaker: Hubert
text: The enemy's withdrawn. Let's carry them up.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Flame Emperor and the Death Knight? I have to say, they both looked very dangerous.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Where did they go? It doesn't matter. We need to get these two out of here.

speaker: Dedue
text: Bring them up.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Flame Emperor, eh? Seemed quite frightened of us if you ask me! Haha!

speaker: Leonie
text: He's gone. We should get these two out of here.

speaker: Hilda
text: Let's get out of this horrible place! C'mon, we can carry them up.

speaker: Linhardt
text: They're pale, and their pulse are slow... Still, I don't believe their lives are in danger.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You found Flayn? Where?!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: You missed the most important part of the mission! We found her within that secret passage. The culprits were the Death Knight and...what was his name? Ah, the Flame Emperor. Sadly, they got away.

speaker: Edelgard
text: All that matters is Flayn's safety. Right, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Right.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wanted to catch them.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It is unfortunate. If only you could have waited for me to return...

speaker: Hubert
text: We will take these two to the infirmary. Professor, please inform Seteth.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Whatever the circumstance, I'm glad Flayn is safe. Though I'm curious to find out who that other girl is... Huh, Professor? Is that...a smile?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Heh, you look...happy. I don't think I've ever seen you like this before. Anyhow, we should hurry to Seteth. He must be beside himself by now.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Thank goodness. Those girls are pale as ghosts, but at least they're alive. But that Death Knight person...feels so familiar.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You found Flayn?! Thank goodness!

speaker: Annette
text: She was unconscious at the end of that secret passage. We found the culprit too...but he got away.

speaker: Byleth
text: No use dwelling on it.

speaker: Byleth
text: We almost had him.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'm just grateful that everyone is safe. That's what matters most. I'd like to hear what transpired, but first we need to get these ladies to the infirmary.

speaker: Dedue
text: Understood. We'll go at once.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'm...I'm sorry, Professor. I'm so relieved, I suddenly felt weak. I couldn't be happier with how things turned out. And I imagine no one will be more overjoyed than Seteth. Hm. Hey, Professor. Can you make that expression one more time?

speaker: Byleth
text: Like this?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I don't think I've ever seen your face like that.

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think I can...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Heh, I apologize. I've forgotten myself and come dangerously close to teasing you. It's just...I've never seen you look so happy before. It's downright mesmerizing. Ah, but this isn't the time for idle chitchat. We must hurry and share the good news with Seteth!

speaker: Marianne
text: They're both alive... Thank goodness.

speaker: Claude
text: You actually found Flayn?! Nice work!

speaker: Lorenz
text: It is a shame you could not be there, Claude. I would have liked for you to witness our mortal struggle against the Death Knight.

speaker: Byleth
text: He got away.

speaker: Byleth
text: We could not defeat him.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, at least we managed to rescue Flayn and complete our mission. That's what counts, right? Right! Excellent work, everyone! Now then, let's get these limp ladies to the infirmary, shall we?

speaker: Raphael
text: No problem. I can carry them both at once.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Be gentle with them, Raphael! Let us carry each one individually. And slowly.

speaker: Claude
text: You know, Teach, seeing you smile sure makes me feel better. You look happy for a change. Hm? Do you really not know? Well, truth is, I've never seen you smile before now. At times, it made me wonder whether you were even human. But I suppose that was just my imagination running wild. Anyhow, we've probably kept Seteth waiting about as long as he can stand. Let's hurry up and tell him the great news.

speaker: Seteth
text: Professor... Please, allow me to express my eternal gratitude once more. Flayn is safe and sound, and I have you to thank for that. Mere words could never express how thankful I am. I...I am indebted to you.

speaker: Byleth
text: I couldn't have done it without the students.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, of course. I shall express my gratitude to the students as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm just happy she's safe.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, indeed. I...I, too, am overjoyed.

speaker: Byleth
text: But why was Flayn taken to begin with?

speaker: Seteth
text: Her kidnapper was the masked knight who vanished during the Rite of Rebirth. The one known as the Death Knight. Considering the circumstances, it seems plausible to assume that his true identity is Jeritza. And we cannot forget about the mysterious Flame Emperor... His true motives are yet unclear. However, I have an idea. I believe the enemy may have been after Flayn's blood. The blood that flows through her veins is special. It is extremely rare...and extremely dangerous. If enemies who know the secret of Flayn's blood have appeared, our only option is to leave the monastery and go into hiding.

speaker: Flayn
text: Brother, wait.

speaker: Seteth
text: Flayn?! What are you doing here? You should be resting!

speaker: Flayn
text: I do not like the path of your thoughts. I do not wish to live in some lonely, remote location where I never get to see anyone. Not ever again.

speaker: Seteth
text: If we stay here, you may be targeted again! Wouldn't it be better for the two of us to live in peace?

speaker: Flayn
text: Even if we ran off to some new, secret location, there is no guarantee that they would not find us. That is why I believe it would be safest to stay in the monastery, where we are surrounded by capable knights and professors.

speaker: Seteth
text: I see your point, I do. However...

speaker: Flayn
text: You know it is the only reasonable option. What if I were to join the professor's class?

speaker: Byleth
text: That is a great idea.

speaker: Flayn
text: You think so too? I am so very pleased to hear that! With a professor like you nearby, I shall be safe no matter what foe should appear!

speaker: Byleth
text: Why would you do that?

speaker: Flayn
text: Because, with a professor like you nearby, I shall be safe no matter what foe should appear!

speaker: Seteth
text: I see. I am afraid you have a good point. Professor... Due to my position, I have closely scrutinized everything about you. After all that has happened, I must admit that you are indeed...a trusted ally. So, what say you? Can I entrust you with Flayn's safety?

speaker: Byleth
text: It would be my pleasure.

speaker: Byleth
text: I suppose I have no choice.

speaker: Sothis
text: I am so glad that Flayn is safe. Yet I can't help but wonder what the story is about the other girl. She wore the uniform of the academy. But who is she?

speaker: Rhea
text: Well done, Professor. I see that I was right to ask your class for assistance. I have been told that Manuela and Flayn are recovering nicely, as is Monica.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is Monica a student here?

speaker: Byleth
text: Who is Monica?

speaker: Rhea
text: Monica, the girl you rescued along with Flayn, is also a student at the Officers Academy. However...

speaker: Hanneman
text: She is a student from last year's class. She went missing just before she would have graduated. It never occurred to us that something might have happened to her at the monastery. We assumed she had run away. I never dreamed that we would find her. Not like this.

speaker: Rhea
text: Monica has asked to rejoin the Black Eagle House once she has fully recovered. Our enemies are still out there, so we must remain cautious and continue our investigation. However, we must also help the students to move on from this incident.

speaker: Hanneman
text: After all, the Battle of the Eagle and Lion will be held in Gronder Field next month.

speaker: Rhea
text: Yes. The students will remember it for the rest of their lives. Please guide them so they may show us their best at the coming battle.

speaker: Jeralt
text: So, you'll be going to Gronder Field next month. You've never been there before, have you? There is unease in the western side of the Empire, but everything east of the capital, Enbarr, is stable. Well, there was a noble rebellion a short while ago, but it didn't amount to much.

speaker: Byleth
text: What will you do next month?

speaker: Jeralt
text: I have my own mission. The church has always been quick to make use of those who work for them.

speaker: Byleth
text: Will you come to the Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

speaker: Jeralt
text: Sorry, but I've got my own mission, and it's far from Gronder Field. The church has always been quick to make use of those who work for them.

speaker: Jeralt
text: What I'm more concerned about is finding out who among us is pulling the strings. Ever since the Rite of Rebirth, strange groups have been seen around Garreg Mach, and elsewhere too. There was also an incident where some knights investigating these suspicious strangers...turned up dead. Not that it's likely, but if something like that ever happens to me... Search this room. Every corner. Behind every shelf. I'm going to leave something for you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't say things like that.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Don't get me wrong. I have no intention of dying. I know it would be too much to ask you to cheer up, but can you at least drop the serious...  Well, I'll be. Was that a smile just now?

speaker: Byleth
text: I promise.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Don't just nod solemnly. There's nothing to worry about. I'm just being cautious. Then again, I guess you're always solemn.

speaker: Rhea
text: Unforgivable! I cannot believe that the Adrestian Empire would embark on such a violent course of action.

speaker: Seteth
text: The fault is my own. I failed to see the wickedness within Edelgard's heart.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is she wicked?

speaker: Seteth
text: She plotted with ill-meaning strangers to achieve her own ambitions and defiled the Holy Tomb. If that is not wicked, what is?

speaker: Byleth
text: What is her objective?

speaker: Seteth
text: There is no question on that front. She clearly wishes to conquer all of Fódlan. And in order to achieve her own selfish ambitions, she plotted with ill-meaning strangers and defiled the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Seteth
text: Or perhaps her ambitions are even grander than we know. Perhaps she is planning to make herself a false deity by demonizing the Church of Seiros...

speaker: Rhea
text: Adrestia received its very name through a divine oracle. To injure the goddess is a sin most foul that shall not be forgiven nor forgotten. We must stop the Empire...and quickly.

speaker: Shamir
text: I have returned, Rhea.

speaker: Rhea
text: Welcome back, Shamir. Were you able to discern the Empire's movements?

speaker: Shamir
text: Their main troops are marching towards Garreg Mach. It is said that they will join forces with Edelgard's army and arrive within two weeks.

speaker: Seteth
text: Two weeks? That is not enough time! It will require all of our efforts just to prepare our defenses before then. We must send notice to all surrounding villages at once. We must order the residents of Garreg Mach to flee for their lives.

speaker: Shamir
text: It will be done.

speaker: Rhea
text: ...Professor...listen closely. If our enemy invades the monastery, I will have no choice but to stand upon the battlefield. If something happens to me...I am entrusting my sacred duties to you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why me?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sacred duties?

speaker: Rhea
text: You must have guessed it by now. The truth of who you are. Or perhaps I should say, your lost memories are surely beginning to return. I have acted all these long years as a mere proxy for you. But the duty is yours and yours alone. Only you can lead the people of Fódlan.

speaker: Seteth
text: ...Rhea, please. You must tell me all that you know. I beg of you.

speaker: Seteth
text: That one...is the progenitor god. Am I correct?

speaker: Rhea
text: In a sense. Our dear professor is...a vessel. One who carries the power of the progenitor god within. In time, the vessel will become one with the power contained within, and the progenitor god shall return to this world.

speaker: Seteth
text: I see. I trust that you are aware of the questionable nature of this experiment? But I suppose there is no turning back...

speaker: Rhea
text: I ask that you help our friend...and in doing so, help her. I am waiting and hoping for the moment when our creator rules this wayward land once more.

speaker: Seteth
text: I am sorry, but I cannot do this. I am not certain it is just...

speaker: Rhea
text: I see. That is a shame.

speaker: Seteth
text: I understand. As ever, I will take you at your word.

speaker: Flayn
text: Lady Rhea! Brother! I will do my part as well!

speaker: Seteth
text: Flayn! Were you eavesdropping? Regardless, I am glad to hear it. You owe your life to the professor, after all. And in the end, they may prove to be our brethren.

speaker: Rhea
text: You have my gratitude, Seteth. And you as well, Flayn. As followers of the progenitor god, it is up to us to see our mission through.

speaker: Dimitri
text: ... I'll have that girl's head. Just you wait...

speaker: Claude
text: The Empire is moving quickly. Edelgard must have been preparing for this for a while now. If you really think about it, she must have been planning for this even before you got the Sword of the Creator... Of course she was always a step ahead of us. We were blinded by the ball and the Battle of the Eagle and Lion, and everything else...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Half of the Empire's six great noble families have declared their support for Edelgard. Of the other three, Lord Vestra was assassinated. Hubert, his son, will succeed him. Bernadetta's father, Count Varley, is under house arrest. His wife is now supporting Edelgard. And my father...he was stripped of his role as prime minister. As as result, House Aegir has lost all of its power, all of its land. We have lost everything. I...I... What do I do?

speaker: Linhardt
text: The most important nobles in the Empire are known for taking power from the previous emperor, my father included. I didn't think it possible that the Imperial princess could ascend the throne so easily. However, it seems that both my father and Caspar's are supporting Edelgard... Having both the Minister of Domestic Affairs and Minister of Military Affairs on your side gives you total control over the Empire's military and finances. They must have been making preparations for quite some time without anyone noticing...

speaker: Caspar
text: I don't normally have a problem jumping into a fight, but it feels strange going up against my father. We aren't especially close, but he's not an opponent I'd want to face. I'd almost rather fight a monster! I hope he's not part of the group coming to attack Garreg Mach...

speaker: Bernadetta
text: What does war with Edelgard mean for us, Professor? And why does she even want that?

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Yeah, I guess we'd have to ask her.

speaker: Byleth
text: She seems to think force is the only way.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I wonder why she'd think that...

speaker: Bernadetta
text: That's how it always goes, I guess. You never realize something can't be undone until you've done it.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Edelgard became emperor and raised an army, huh? Who knew the kid had it in her? I mean, yeah, of course, I knew she'd be emperor eventually, but... The more I think about it, the more surprised I am. I wonder who's going to win...

speaker: Byleth
text: Us or her, you mean?

speaker: Dorothea
text: But would it really be OK for Edelgard to win?

speaker: Byleth
text: We will not lose.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Thinking about it makes me scared. We're up against the entire Imperial army! Still, I know someone as smart as you will figure something out...

speaker: Petra
text: I am owing big debts to Duke Gerth of the Empire. He is the Minister of Affairs that are Foreign. He is a friend of Edelgard. He is to her side. What should I be doing?

speaker: Petra
text: I have had the arrival of a letter from Edelgard. She is asking...that I join her side. She is making the decision...no, she is deciding if Brigid is a friend or an enemy of the Empire. But my choice is not to be friends. My choice is to fight with you. Brigid is not a friend of the Empire. We will not be following again. We will be ready to fight with you instead.

speaker: Dedue
text: His Highness calls for the head of Edelgard. For me, that is cause enough to fight.

speaker: Byleth
text: That is against the teachings of the goddess.

speaker: Dedue
text: Perhaps. But it is too late to stop him now.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're truly all right with that?

speaker: Dedue
text: The hatred of His Highness is also my hatred. Any other feelings I may have are irrelevant.

speaker: Dedue
text: And if Edelgard was responsible in any way for the Tragedy of Duscur, that is something I cannot ignore. If that is the case, then she is my enemy.

speaker: Felix
text: You saw it too, didn't you? The boar's true nature. He's hidden his desire for revenge pretty well. But now it's stirred up. Well, regardless. That girl's starting an all-out war, isn't she? But an enemy is an enemy, no matter who they are. Don't let compassion for her get in your way.

speaker: Annette
text: Once the Imperial army reaches the monastery, we'll have no choice but to fight...

speaker: Ashe
text: What's going to happen to us?

speaker: Byleth
text: Everything will be all right.

speaker: Ashe
text: I believe you. With the knights on our side, and especially with you, Professor, I know we can do this!

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't say for sure.

speaker: Annette
text: Oh. Well, we'll just have to try our best.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Things must be pretty crazy in Faerghus about now. My father must be beside himself. I don't get it. Why did Edelgard make enemies with the nobles?

speaker: Byleth
text: I have no idea.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Me either... Of course, even if we did get it, what do we do about it?

speaker: Byleth
text: For the sake of her ideals?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ideals she believes in so much she was willing to start a war over them? Those must be some lofty ideals, to say the least.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I hope this all gets sorted out quickly and safely. I'm worried about my father.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I guess we have no choice but to fight, have we? Oh, but why would Edelgard do something like this? I'm sure we'll be all right though, Professor. The goddess will keep us safe.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I've known His Highness since I was a child, but I've never seen that side of him before. He seemed like a completely different person than the one I know...

speaker: Lorenz
text: The Empire's aggression cannot stand. But if we are going to attack them now, we must be honest with ourselves about our chances of success. It goes without saying that I will fight the Imperial army with everything I have, for as long as I am able. But House Gloucester's territory is adjacent to Imperial lands. Let us proceed with caution.

speaker: Raphael
text: I hear the Alliance's territory will be in danger if we don't get rid of these Empire guys! If the Alliance is in danger, that means my sister's in danger too! There's no way I'm gonna allow that. It doesn't matter how many guys they throw at us, I'll beat 'em all! These muscles aren't just for show! But first, I gotta get some food.

speaker: Ignatz
text: You know, Professor, I'm glad that I came to the Officers Academy. I feel accepted here. I've learned so much. Honestly, I'm surprised at how much I've grown. So, I will not let the academy be destroyed. It's important to me, and I will protect it!

speaker: Byleth
text: I feel the same.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I feel braver just hearing you say that, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't do anything rash.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I'll try to keep a clear head, but there won't be any turning back for me. I don't want to have regrets.

speaker: Ignatz
text: We're gonna win this, Professor!

speaker: Lysithea
text: So Edelgard, the one who calls herself the Flame Emperor, was connected to those strange beings. The Imperial army might be using even more terrifying methods than we know. You had better be cautious, Professor. Any amount of carelessness might prove to be our undoing.

speaker: Marianne
text: Can we really defeat someone who is willing to turn their back on the world just to uphold their own beliefs? I've spent my whole life running in fear, and now...I...

speaker: Byleth
text: We can win this together.

speaker: Marianne
text: Surely we can win if we rely on each other. Right, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: We can't win if you run.

speaker: Marianne
text: You're right. It's time to stop running. I'll fight with everything I've got!

speaker: Hilda
text: You'll battle Edelgard, right? Good luck! Me? Oh, I'm going to run away. I have zero interest in dying here, thank you very much.

speaker: Hilda
text: At times like this, I just feel so anxious, you know? But you'll watch out for me there. Right, Professor?

speaker: Leonie
text: What is Edelgard even trying to achieve? She wants to destroy the church so badly that she'll take on anyone who doesn't fall in line? I don't get it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Her ideals are in conflict with yours.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a hard thing to accept.

speaker: Leonie
text: I just can't believe she'd start a war over it. Not to mention using such nasty tactics to get her way. Could Captain Jeralt's death have also been a part of her plan? Don't you go and die on me, Professor. Captain Jeralt would never forgive you.

speaker: Rhea
text: How are you, Professor? Any new changes to report? With the Imperial army drawing near, it is most vexing that we cannot relax and converse as we once did... Thankfully, you have the divine protection of the goddess on your side. Please try to listen carefully for her voice...

speaker: Byleth
text: I will try.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't hear a thing.

speaker: Rhea
text: Please do not say such sad things. I am certain you will hear her in time.

speaker: Rhea
text: May the goddess's voice reach you...

speaker: Seteth
text: We must protect Garreg Mach. Defiling the Holy Tomb was a sacrilege. I will not allow such a thing to happen again. The archbishop has already given you a new responsibility. I want you to rise to that honor.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor... War is breaking out again, is it not?

speaker: Byleth
text: Again?

speaker: Flayn
text: There was a truly terrible war, once upon a time.

speaker: Byleth
text: I want to stop it if I can.

speaker: Flayn
text: An honorable notion. Do you think there is something to be done? Whatever shall we do?

speaker: Flayn
text: I never wanted another war... All we can do is steel ourselves for the fight ahead.

speaker: Alois
text: Well, perhaps it's pointless to get upset about the past. My duty now is to prepare for battle. We're depending on your strength, Professor. Crush our enemies!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll try

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm depending on you.

speaker: Alois
text: Captain, I hope you're watching! We will protect Garreg Mach!

speaker: Catherine
text: Ugh. If I could go back to last month and throttle my carefree self! Now it turns out Edelgard is the Flame Emperor, and the new Adrestian emperor! And she's striking out against the monastery, with the full force of the Imperial army behind her. We gotta beat her at her own game! For our sake as well as Lady Rhea's...

speaker: Shamir
text: We're falling behind. I don't know that we can keep up with the new emperor. To think that she was able to raise an army of that size right under our noses... However hard we fight, I give us a 50 percent chance of winning. The enemy has too many advantages. We must make careful preparations.

speaker: Gilbert
text: There are always small power struggles, still... It has been hundreds of years since all of Fódlan was consumed by war. I didn't actually think it would come to this... I feel as though I'm not in my rightful place. I cannot protect the things I should... Professor. If I survive this war, I wish to return to my homeland... To the land of my king.

speaker: Hanneman
text: The Holy Tomb held many Crest Stones. This is the first time I've heard of Crest Stones being hidden away in such a place... But more importantly, I'm interested to know the Empire's aim. Why would their army desire Crest Stones? There is power there, yes. And yet... I must think on this. The Crest Stones lie at the heart of the events surrounding Conand Tower and the chapel as well... And of course, the Crest Stones somehow transformed those traitors and their captives into Demonic Beasts... Could that possibly be their aim?! The Empire's army may well plan to use Crest Stones to create Demonic Beasts!

speaker: Manuela
text: The mastermind behind the attacks on the monastery was Edelgard? Wow. Doesn't make much sense though, does it? There would need to be all sorts of territories and groups tangled up in this sort of mess... Eh, I'm gonna stop. I don't really have the head for this political stuff. Mostly I'm worried about my old opera company. I wonder what's happening in the capital right now. I hope they're safe...

speaker: Cyril
text: It's my job to protect Lady Rhea. I've gotta do it. and I gotta do it as best I can. And if that means I gotta die for her, then I will. Ugh, how could Edelgard treat Lady Rhea like she's the bad guy? She's never been anything but nice to everybody! I just don't get it at all...

speaker: Anna
text: I can't believe the Empire raised an army... Even I couldn't have guessed it. War is profitable...but dangerous. I really don't like seeing people I care about out there mixed up in all this.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings Professor! Something to report! Unexpected, isn't it? Apparently, this is the first time Garreg Mach has been invaded in its whole 995-year history! It's my job to protect this gate, so even if enemies come in droves, I will never let them through! I hope we both survive... Let's battle with all our might and pray we win this thing!

speaker: Alois
text: Listen up, everyone! The Imperial army is upon us. If you can fight, pick up a weapon! Everyone else, hurry up and evacuate! We have the goddess's protection on our side. We have nothing to fear. Victory will be ours!

speaker: Catherine
text: Professor. Are you ready?

speaker: Byleth
text: Almost.

speaker: Catherine
text: Well, hurry up. I don't need to tell you that the situation is dire. We have some support troops from the local nobles, but the army we're facing is immense. No matter how you look at it, we're at a disadvantage. To make matters worse, the enemy is being led by Edelgard. Do not underestimate how extraordinary her abilities are.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Of course we know, but we can't let her get away. Also, please cease your unwarranted glaring. We don't deserve your judgement.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: My father was removed from his role as prime minister and is still under house arrest in the Imperial capital. As his successor...it is my duty to stop her!

speaker: Caspar
text: The way she's going about all of this is wrong. It's up to us to help her realize that!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I won't be following her, but...l won't run away either!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Edie's going to come at us with all she's got. And that's a lot. That means we need to fight her with all of our might too.

speaker: Petra
text: She is one who has strength, that has certainty. But we have strength also. We will not be losing!

speaker: Flayn
text: I shall fight with all that I have. It is an honor to fight alongside each of you!

speaker: Catherine
text: You students really have guts, don't you? Though, I suppose I can't call you students anymore. You're now part of our order. You have our support and our gratitude. Professor, I'm counting on you. Go ahead and take the lead.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll protect the students.

speaker: Catherine
text: These kids...they look up to you. I guess that goes without saying. Just look in their eyes and you can see it. If we all make it through this, let's meet again. Good luck out there!

speaker: Dimitri
text: They're here. At long last.

speaker: Felix
text: It seems this will be a battle to remember. About time.

speaker: Ashe
text: I'll never give up, no matter how outnumbered we are. I'll fight to the very end!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hm, I should have made a move on the Imperial princess before things got this far. It could have changed everything.

speaker: Mercedes
text: We have the goddess's divine protection on our side. All that's left to do is to try our best.

speaker: Annette
text: All we can do is fight as best as we can. Though...if I'm being honest, I'm really scared right now...

speaker: Ingrid
text: We can't just hand over the Kingdom and the monastery. We'll stop her, no matter what it takes!

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness, you do not seem...well.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Unwell, you say? What's gotten into you? Nothing could be further from the truth. I'm so happy I can hardly contain myself. My father, my stepmother, my dear friends? They want her head. They want her life! They've whispered as much to me. And the chance to answer their pleas has arrived, at long last!

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't lose control out there.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'm always in control, Professor! And I'll stay in control until I have the pleasure of killing that woman!

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't act rashly. We're all in this together.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Of course, of course! But don't mistake my intentions. Edelgard will die by my hand, and mine alone.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Let's move, Professor. Even if it costs me my life, I won't rest until I've crushed her skull in my bare hands!

speaker: Hilda
text: She's back already? Talk about impatient!

speaker: Claude
text: If we don't stop them, the academy will be destroyed. Prepare for battle, everyone!

speaker: Lysithea
text: We will stop Edelgard's rampage!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Our opponent is formidable, but if we work together, we will not fail.

speaker: Raphael
text: Enough talking! Let's go!

speaker: Marianne
text: Dear Goddess… Please, protect us all…

speaker: Flayn
text: I shall fight with all that I have. It is an honor to fight alongside each of you!

speaker: Hilda
text: Professor, Claude… You'll lead the way, won't you? You won't let any of us fall, right?

speaker: Claude
text: I wanted to talk to Rhea first, but as expected, that won't be possible. What did she hope to accomplish at the Holy Tomb? What happened to you as a baby? There are still so many things I need to know. The same goes for the real origin of the Crest Stones and the Heroes' Relics. As for Seiros and Nemesis…just how much of their mythology is true?

speaker: Claude
text: It's true. But lucky for me, I refuse to die with so much still unknown. Hey, Teach… All joking aside. Can we possibly survive this battle?

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll find a way.

speaker: Claude
text: That's all we can do, right? If we gave up, the god of fate wouldn't be happy.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, now! I wasn't really looking for an honest answer. Honesty is bad for morale, Teach. You'd better cut that out.

speaker: Claude
text: I'm a lot of things, but I'm not the kind of man to just roll over and die in a place like this. I have my own ambitions to see to. There are things…dreams…that I must see come to fruition. And I've been thinking. I want you to see those dreams realized as well. On top of all that, there are still so many secrets out there, just waiting to be uncovered. We can't let that stand, can we?

speaker: Claude
text: So, Teach… No, scratch that. You're so much more. You're my ally and my friend. Teach… Friend… None of those words quite capture what you've come to mean to me. We may not be connected by blood, but I believe our bond goes deeper than that. Now that we know each other, our hearts are connected. Even if our paths diverge and we're forced to say good-bye… I know that we'll meet again.

speaker: Claude
text: And so, for lack of a better word, I gratefully call you my friend, and I hold fast to the belief that this isn't it for us. No matter who or what you really are, I'll always be on your side. You can't count on much in this world, but you can count on that.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: I have a report! The enemy is within the walls. They're about to break the defensive line!

speaker: Dedue
text: The archbishop and the defensive line both require our assistance. We must protect them until reinforcements get here.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Report! The enemy has taken the entrances there the reinforcements were heading!

speaker: Dedue
text: We must retake the strongholds to the east and west so our reinforcements can get through.

speaker: Dedue
text: One stronghold secured.

speaker: Dedue
text: Both strongholds secured, with time to spare.

speaker: Seteth
text: Alright, that's one stronghold recaptured. Now, the other!

speaker: Seteth
text: That's both strongholds! It appears we were right on time.

speaker: Seteth
text: No–the monestary has fallen! We've been defeated...

speaker: Catherine
text: I'm here, and I've brought reinforcements! Don't worry--we'll protect the monastery!

speaker: Shamir
text: I brought reinforcements. I'll send them to the front line.

speaker: Dedue
text: They have taken the monastery. We have lost...

speaker: Claude
text: We took back one of the strongholds. On to the next…

speaker: Claude
text: All right, we took back both of the strongholds. Let's keep up the momentum!

speaker: Claude
text: Damn it... The monastery has fallen into the hands of our enemy. We failed.

speaker: Rhea
text: The goddess protects us... what is there to fear rebel swords... This is blasphemy against the goddess! Stop this now!

speaker: Rhea
text: N-no... I cannot fall here...

speaker: Randolph
text: A wonderful chance to earn some recognition! I'll be the one to take down the monastery!

speaker: Randolph
text: I have no choice but to distinguish myself in this fight!

speaker: Randolph
text: Argh! I'm finished. I'm loathe to say it, but I must retreat...

speaker: Hubert
text: Such a shame. There are people in the Empire you truly care about, too, aren't there? I wonder what will become of them.

speaker: Hubert
text: What you fail to appreciate is that we have, at our backs, a force you cannot hope to defeat.

speaker: Hubert
text: I can afford to fall back. We still have the advantage.

speaker: Death Knight
text: This fight is but a sideshow... to the ravaging of the sacred place that is Garreg Mach...

speaker: Death Knight
text: The time is not right... I will wait for the next opportunity...

speaker: Ladislava
text: I will not allow you to get any closer to Her Majesty!

speaker: Ladislava
text: My life was changed forever by Her Majesty... Now, I lay it on the line. For the Empire!

speaker: Ladislava
text: Lady Edelgard, I'm so sorry! I can't keep going! I must retreat!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Think very carefully about whether you wish to raise your sword against the Empire... or if you will offer it to us in fealty. And after you've thought it through, if you still wish to fight, I won't stop you. I will simply use the full extent of my power... and crush you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You will come to regret raising your blade against the emperor of the Adrestian Empire!

speaker: Caspar
text: Huh. This guy seems real familiar...

speaker: Randolph
text: Y-you dastard! Aren't you... No...

speaker: Caspar
text: Eh, that doesn't matter right now. Let's go!

speaker: Hubert
text: Lady Edelgard held you in such high esteem. In the end, however, it seems like you are nothing more than a slave to your goddess.

speaker: Death Knight
text: This battlefield is too chaotic... for us to kill each other upon...

speaker: Edelgard
text: I wish you were someone whose heart could be swayed by my words and deeds. If it were so, I would have done anything to make you my ally...

speaker: Dimitri
text: You're late. I... We are all tired of waiting. Now, let's separate that sick head from your neck, shall we?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Heh. You never were one for patience.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You fought well. But now, your fight is over. Send in our reserve troops! And give my uncle the signal!

speaker: Rhea
text: What... is this?!

speaker: Rhea
text: Everyone here, young and old, is in your hands.

speaker: Rhea
text: No. I will not allow another Red Canyon tragedy to happen here.

speaker: Claude
text: What is going on?

speaker: Empire Soldier
text: What now?

speaker: Rhea
text: Why did you come?!

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea, please talk to me. What are you hiding? What is the meaning of how that one looks? It is almost as though...

speaker: Rhea
text: As I said, there is nothing of which to speak. For now. At the end of this month...

speaker: Seteth
text: I read Jeralt's diary. I happened upon it in his room.

speaker: Rhea
text: What?

speaker: Seteth
text: In it, he stated the reason for his departure. The baby thought to have died in the fire...has returned to us. Jeralt realized that you had done something to the child and decided to flee. What did you do to that baby, Rhea? Nothing...questionable, I should hope?

speaker: Rhea
text: Seteth, enough. They will be here shortly. No more, I beg of you. I will take our dear professor to the Holy Tomb. There...I should be able to see our dearest wishes to fruition. When I was young, I heard her voice there... I'm sure of it.

speaker: Rhea
text: You may enter.

speaker: Rhea
text: I have been awaiting your arrival, Professor. Now that you have received sacred power from the goddess, there is somewhere you must pay a visit to at once. You must go to the Holy Tomb so that you may receive a divine revelation from the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Holy Tomb?

speaker: Byleth
text: A revelation?

speaker: Seteth
text: The Holy Tomb is where the goddess sleeps. This monastery was originally built for the purpose of protecting that hallowed temple.

speaker: Rhea
text: Only a select few know of it, but there is a legend about Seiros and the Holy Tomb. Saint Seiros, the first soul to be gifted power from the goddess, received her revelation there. She was told it was her sacred duty to save the people of Fódlan, and that she must use her power wisely in order to lead them. The words that were handed down to Seiros from the goddess will likely fall upon your ears as well.

speaker: Seteth
text: Prepare yourself to go at once. There, may you find out why you were blessed with such power.

speaker: Rhea
text: There will be a ceremony at the Holy Tomb. It is then that you will receive the goddess's revelation. You may share this mission with your students.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you think it wise to bring them into this?

speaker: Byleth
text: A mission? Now?

speaker: Rhea
text: It is said that when Seiros received the revelation, she had holy warriors by her side, protecting her. Your students, who have followed you and fought alongside you through the darkest of times, are well suited to stand by you for the ceremony. Of course, as the leader of the Church of Seiros, I will be by your side as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: Strange...

speaker: Rhea
text: The occasion is too significant to be missed.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't that too dangerous?

speaker: Rhea
text: The Holy Tomb is a sacred temple that is sealed off from the rest of the world. There is nothing to fear.

speaker: Rhea
text: Even if something were to happen, I am more than capable of protecting myself.

speaker: Seteth
text: Much has changed, but your duty has not wavered. Steel your mind for the ceremony, and prepare your students well.

speaker: Claude
text: Rhea and Seteth were not their usual selves. What happened to Teach that's questionable, and what really awaits at the Holy Tomb? The way they were acting, I don't think they have any plans of sharing that information.

speaker: Byleth
text: (I can't hear Sothis's voice anymore...)

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, you should know that I'll be away from the monastery for a few days.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's meant to be a secret, but...I'm going to Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. Don't worry, I'll be back in time for the ceremony at the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Dedue
text: Professor. Please. If he hears it from you that he needs to rest, perhaps His Highness will listen.

speaker: Dimitri
text: He's exaggerating. He thinks my color is off and that rest will cure all. I have a headache, but that's just from lack of sleep. It's not going to stop me from completing this month's mission.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should rest.

speaker: Dedue
text: The professor agrees. Please rest. At least until the task is at hand.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I won't. Even if I tried, it's not like I would get any decent sleep. It would only be a waste of time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't overexert yourself.

speaker: Dedue
text: I must insist—

speaker: Dimitri
text: Who do you think you are? I can take care of myself, Dedue.

speaker: Dimitri
text: In any case, we won't let you down this month, Professor. You can rely on us.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, Teach. Is it OK for you to be out on your own right now? Just…please be careful not to topple over again. You scared us nearly to death. Anyway… Doesn't Rhea want something from you? Sounds important. I'm glad I'll be there to witness the ritual at the Holy Tomb. I want to see whether or not something happens with my own eyes.

speaker: Claude
text: I always knew there was something special about you, but you've only gotten more and more extraordinary the longer I've know you. That transformation was just the beginning, wasn't it? I have a feeling that things will only grow more dire from here on out.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Edelgard and Hubert have been busier than usual. Constantly coming and going, in and out of Garreg Mach. Perhaps they are doing something in the Empire? As the legitimate heir of the Aegir family, I have not heard anything about it. But if it were significant, I am sure my father would have told me.

speaker: Linhardt
text: How are you, Professor? Did Hanneman make his, I will do no harm speech or promise this won't hurt a bit when he asked to study you? Both? I've a bit of research I'd like to perform. Nothing so crass as Hanneman's poking, prodding, and drawing of blood. No, I wish to investigate Crest power itself. Crest power must have some kind of limit, right? Lady Rhea says any limits must be the protection of the goddess, but that doesn't quite answer it for me. Hmm...

speaker: Caspar
text: You're so strong now! I'm starting to understand why you were appointed professor.

speaker: Caspar
text: I thought I was stronger, but I still have such a long way to go.

speaker: Byleth
text: Try to catch up to me.

speaker: Caspar
text: Oh, I will. I still plan on beating you some day!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll help you get there.

speaker: Caspar
text: You'd better not go easy on me. I need your training to be strict if I'm gonna get any better!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: So hungry... Oh, is that you, Professor? Sorry. I'm really not feeling well this month. Even leaving my room for dinner is just too much. It's got nothing to do with your, um...changes. So, um, don't open the door, please!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Recently, Professor, I feel as though you've been a bit distant. It's like you're sort of floating above the clouds, separate from other people... And like you've got no interest at all in ever coming back down. How can I help?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not being distant, so don't worry.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know what to say to that.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Hey, don't worry. I thought maybe I'd ask and see what you'd say.

speaker: Petra
text: In Brigid, we have legends. Stories containing people who have a spirit living inside of them. Those spirit people have much strength. They are maybe able to fly in the air or race across the ocean. Hair that shines and eyes that glow... They have qualities that are not unlike what you are looking like, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't fly.

speaker: Petra
text: Are you knowing that for certain? Maybe you will have wings that grow and soar through the sky...

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps.

speaker: Petra
text: Do not have doubt, Professor. The powers you have are like the powers of the legends.

speaker: Felix
text: Hurry up and cage the wild boar. Look, he's losing his grip. Even in his swordplay, he's getting sloppy. If he keeps progressing like this, he's going to get himself killed. Kronya, Solon... They're dead, but we still have a glut of enemies. We still have to take down the Death Knight and the Flame Emperor. Our next battle is fast approaching. I'm ready for it.

speaker: Ashe
text: I can't even imagine what it must be like inside the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know either.

speaker: Ashe
text: Well, it's probably a grave, that much is for sure. And it's likely underground. Beyond that, who knows?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's just a place to bury people.

speaker: Ashe
text: I guess you're right. Holy or not, all graves are kind of the same, aren't they?

speaker: Ashe
text: I can't help but wonder though... Just what kind of ritual is this?

speaker: Sylvain
text: I swear, it's like you're an entirely different person.

speaker: Byleth
text: I haven't changed on the inside.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Heh, I guess you're right. If I look hard, I can still tell it's you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't it weird?

speaker: Sylvain
text: No, not at all! I'm just not used to it. It really suits you though.

speaker: Sylvain
text: It's not weird at all. It's... You're somehow even more beautiful than before. I'm joking! I'm joking! Don't get mad.

speaker: Ingrid
text: You've been granted this power by the goddess herself. Truly, you must be a very special individual. Maybe Seiros transformed before receiving her revelation too!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm. I haven't heard anything about that before... Maybe that part never found its way into the legend?

speaker: Ingrid
text: It is told that Seiros had a revelation instructing her to use her power for good, and to lead the people of Fódlan to salvation... I wonder what sort of revelation you might have, Professor.

speaker: Annette
text: Bah! Professor! Sorry, this will take some getting used to... Your hair and eye color are completely different! You just don't look like yourself anymore.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's only my appearance that has changed.

speaker: Annette
text: Of course. You're right. I'm just being silly, as usual.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe I am a different person...

speaker: Annette
text: Don't scare me like that! You are still you...right? You are, right?

speaker: Lorenz
text: To be honest, I cannot keep up with all that's been happening recently. Monica was actually Kronya. Tomas was actually Solon. Who were these people? What about you, Professor? You are a true ally, yes?

speaker: Byleth
text: That's my intention.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Not the most convincing answer you could have given. Still, I simply must take you at your word.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Pull yourself together! It is still your duty to lead us, is it not?

speaker: Raphael
text: You look so...different. You're still our professor in there, right? Did anything else change besides your hair and eyes? Are your arms bigger? How do your abs look?

speaker: Byleth
text: I've changed quite a bit.

speaker: Raphael
text: Really?! You gotta teach me how to do that!

speaker: Byleth
text: I haven't changed that much.

speaker: Raphael
text: That's disappointing. What's even the point?

speaker: Ignatz
text: So, this month's mission is to take part in a ritual at the Holy Tomb, where you will receive a revelation from the goddess herself. What if she really appears? What if I finally get to gaze upon her radiance? I've always imagined the goddess--how beautiful she must be!

speaker: Ignatz
text: You're going to the ritual at the Holy Tomb, right? I hear that a revelation from the goddess is expected. What if she shows herself? I'll be so jealous!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Your hair! And your eyes! What happened to you?! You didn't lose something as a result of gaining those powers, did you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't worry—I'm fine.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I see. Well, that makes me feel better. But still, be careful.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know yet.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Sometimes our frail bodies don’t do well with excess power… So don’t push yourself too hard.

speaker: Marianne
text: Long ago, Saint Seiros was gifted with a divine revelation from the goddess, as well as incredible power. Is that what happened to you too, Professor?

speaker: Hilda
text: No way! The professor transformed before receiving any kind of divine revelation, right? Still, I wonder. Does the fact that you've changed really mean you've been granted some kind of power?

speaker: Marianne
text: If that's the case, then what sort of revelation can be gained from the ritual?

speaker: Hilda
text: I'm guessing the revelation will just be a gentle reminder to use this new power to save the people of Fódlan. What else is there to say? You don't actually believe we're going to hear the voice of the goddess, do you?

speaker: Leonie
text: When you changed, even the other professors were taken completely by surprise. There's a ritual at the Holy Tomb this month, isn't there? I wonder what will happen with that. I'm sure you'll be all right. But don't lose sight of who you really are, OK? However you may change, and whatever new power goes along with those changes--you'll still be the same person, deep down. Remember that.

speaker: Rhea
text: You haven't a thing to worry about. You have been gifted the power of the goddess. Furthermore, you have overcome the death of your father, Jeralt...and you have destroyed countless of our wicked foes. I am proud...so very proud of who you have become.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you.

speaker: Rhea
text: Once we finish the ritual at the Holy Mausoleum, all will be well.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm uneasy.

speaker: Rhea
text: That is understandable. Just know that your unease should disappear the moment we conclude the ritual at the Holy Mausoleum.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hmm... Ah. It is you. I am sorry, but I have a lot on my mind. I would prefer to be alone right now.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, I am so happy. Your new hair and eye color suit you well. We make quite the pair! But...recently I sense that things are a bit strained between Lady Rhea and my brother. She wants to do something at the Holy Tomb. I do not know what, but... Hm. Whenever it has concluded, I hope they will return to their friendship, as it has always been...

speaker: Alois
text: Captain... Oh, Professor! How long have you been standing there? I didn't see you. I was just sorting through Captain Jeralt's belongings. I... Haven't made much progress. I keep finding things that bring back memories. Clearing out this room of his belongings again, it's... It's not easy.

speaker: Catherine
text: In our battle last month, we really cut the enemy down to size. But there are other enemies we have yet to hunt down, not the least the Flame Emperor. Once we've crushed them all, we can return to our peaceful lives at the monastery. It will happen soon. I have a feeling something big is coming.

speaker: Shamir
text: People who live an inordinately long time, people whose hair changes color, and those odd Heroes' Relics... Is Fódlan some mystical land full of inhuman creatures?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's not like that.

speaker: Shamir
text: You still look human. For now, at least.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is the world different outside Fódlan?

speaker: Shamir
text: You should see for yourself. I'd recommend exploring west of the Empire.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Sometimes, I find myself thinking I should leave Garreg Mach and return to my home... Where I should have been all along.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where you should have been?

speaker: Gilbert
text: Ignore me. I'm sorry...it's a silly thing. An old man's ramblings, and nothing more.

speaker: Byleth
text: I won't stop you...

speaker: Gilbert
text: I hear that Lady Rhea will accompany you for this month's task. She's the pillar that supports the hearts of Fódlan's people. Her safety is paramount. I hope there are no complications...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Are you positive? Really? Your appearance is due to the influence of the Crest of Flames? Intriguing. Unfortunately, I have found no record of Nemesis's hair and eye color ever changing. However... If that transformation was brought on, in part, by the power of the Crest, that would be most... Well, I suppose interesting is too small a word. Still, it would be an absolutely exceptional discovery. To know for certain, we must investigate further. So, clothes off!

speaker: Hanneman
text: What? A full physical is in order, yes? We need to know if this transformation affected you adversely. Don't worry, it won't hurt a bit.

speaker: Manuela
text: The Holy Tomb, huh? I've worked here for years, and this is the first I've heard of it. I mean, it does make some sense. Sort of. Something about it is still weird. I understand now why they'd build the monastery in the mountainous center of Fódlan. Although... When the monastery was built, the Kingdom and the Alliance weren't even around yet. But look how cleverly it was placed right in the middle of the Empire, Kingdom, and Alliance. That's weird, right?

speaker: Cyril
text: When I first saw you, Professor, with that hair color and that eye color? I thought you looked kind of like Lady Rhea. Like maybe you could be related. I like the way it looks! I wonder if I could change my hair color too... Maybe if I tried hard enough. If I thought real hard about it, I mean.

speaker: Byleth
text: That would be exciting, wouldn't it?

speaker: Cyril
text: All I need to do is get trapped up in a strange place and then escape, right? Just like you did.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't need to do that, Cyril.

speaker: Cyril
text: I might not need to, but I still wanna.

speaker: Anna
text: Hey, Professor. You seem...different. Lots of things seem...different around here lately. I've noticed it. Have you?

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Although I suppose...you are something to report! For a moment, I thought you were someone suspicious! Lucky for you, I am quite perceptive. It took only that single moment for me to recognize you.  The professor went out and got some new power!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, will you join me? There's something I must do. It will take a few days, but I promise we'll be back in time for the ceremony at the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where are we going?

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's meant to be a secret, but...I'm going to Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. There is something I must do there.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll go with you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you, my teacher.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Father, forgive me for asking this of you. I know how much pain you're in--how the burden of the throne weighs heavily on you--and so--

speaker: Emperor Ionius Ix
text: There is no need to apologize, Edelgard. You must know...  that I do not have much time left in this world. The time has come.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you, Father. Now, to complete the Imperial succession, you must relinquish your crown here in the throne room. The archbishop of the Church of Seiros would normally act as witness, but my professor will fill that role instead.

speaker: Emperor Ionius Ix
text: Edelgard...

speaker: Edelgard
text: From this day forward, the weight of the Empire's future shall rest upon my shoulders. All that I do will be for the benefit of the people of Fódlan.

speaker: Emperor Ionius Ix
text: Edelgard von Hresvelg, the crown is yours. By the covenant between the red blood and the white sword, and by the double-headed eagle upon your head, I hereby pronounce you the new emperor. Are you prepared to take those responsibilities as your own?

speaker: Edelgard
text: In accordance with the ancient covenant, and in keeping with the Hresvelg legacy... I swear that upon this throne, I shall use my reign to lead Fódlan to a new dawn and achieve peace for all.

speaker: Emperor Ionius Ix
text: The Imperial succession is complete.  My daughter, I regret that I could not do more for you. When you were stolen away to the Kingdom, when the prime minister did those horrible things, I could only watch in horror.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I-- I understand, Father. In those dark times, your eyes and your fists were my salvation. Within your eyes, I saw true care. And upon your fists clenched tight with indignity, I saw the blood that dripped and fell. Even as I bled, I felt that you, too, must also be bleeding.

speaker: Duke Aegir
text: Your Majesty! You must not leave your sleeping chambers in your condition.  Ah, Edelgard. I did not expect to find Your Highness here.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Prime Minister, you have misspoken. I am no longer Your Highness but rather...Your Majesty.

speaker: Duke Aegir
text: I-Impossible!

speaker: Emperor Ionius Ix
text: It is true. Edelgard is the new emperor of the Adrestian Empire. We will summon the officials,  and prepare an ordinance at once. And you, Prime Minister--

speaker: Edelgard
text: --are dismissed. It will be some time before you are allowed to make contact with the outside world again.

speaker: Duke Aegir
text: No! How can this be?! I- Understood, Your Majesty.

speaker: Emperor Ionius Ix
text: Edelgard... My dear El, I leave the fate of Fódlan...  in your capable hands.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Father...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you for staying by my side, Professor. Now that I'm the emperor, it's time to grasp my destiny. After the ceremony at the Holy Tomb, I must return to Enbarr. This may be the last we see of each other. We are out of time, my teacher. Everyone is waiting for us. We must go.

speaker: Dimitri
text: A revelation from the goddess... To think we'll have the honor of attending such a historical event.

speaker: Dedue
text: I hear the archbishop will accompany us to the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Ingrid
text: If something happens to her, all of Fódlan will suffer. We must protect her at all costs.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This may sound mad, but perhaps we don't have to worry so much about that. Lady Rhea has said before that she is capable of protecting herself. I have a felling that is true. I thought it was a strange thing for her to say. and beyond that, her movements bring to mind a great warrior with an extensive military background.

speaker: Byleth
text: Who is Rhea, really?

speaker: Byleth
text: If so, we have nothing to fear.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I wonder. Mind it's also possible that I'm way off track. Regardless, perhaps we should brace ourselves for anything.

speaker: Ashe
text: I never imagined attending a ceremony for real revelation.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I wonder what the ceremony will be like. I'm so nervous. I'm not ready for this.

speaker: Felix
text: There's no chance for battle unless something goes terribly wrong, right? How boring.

speaker: Sylvain
text: If you keep saying things like that, something bad is bound to happen.

speaker: Annette
text: What's wrong, Flayn? You look like you have something on your mind.

speaker: Flayn
text: Who, me? No, it is nothing. May we all see this through to the end.

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness, I will protect you no matter what.  Your Highness?

speaker: Byleth
text: Lost in thought?

speaker: Byleth
text: You haven't seemed like yourself lately...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hm? Ah, I suppose you could say that. Nothing to worry about. It's about time for Lady Rhea to arrive. Let's all steel ourselves for whatever may occur at this ceremony.

speaker: Claude
text: You're going to receive the goddess's revelation at the Holy Tomb? That's news to me. I did not see that coming.

speaker: Hilda
text: Lady Rhea's going too, right? I hear it will be well-guarded, but it is that really okay?

speaker: Ignatz
text: If Solon's allies are still around, it's certainly true that we don't know when or where they may appear.

speaker: Leonie
text: I don't know what type of place this Holy Tomb is, but we should be cautious.

speaker: Raphael
text: If something happens, we'll have to take matters into our own hands.

speaker: Hilda
text: What do you think, Professor? Is it really okay for Lady Rhea to attend?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm worried.

speaker: Claude
text: It seems to be tightly sealed, I'll give you that. We should be fine as long as nothing goes terribly wrong. Yep… Just as long as nothing goes wrong.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's encouraging.

speaker: Claude
text: Leave it to our fearless leader to shrewdly factor in Rhea's fighting ability. You're bold, Teach. I love it.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, the truth is, we won't know what's going on until it happens. All we can do is stay on our guard and play it by ear.

speaker: Lorenz
text: That's quite enough babbling, Claude. There is nobody more unfit for a holy ceremony than you.

speaker: Marianne
text: Um, divine punishment won't strike us for setting foot in the Holy Tomb, right?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Good grief. Why are you always so negative?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Hm? Flayn, is something on your mind?

speaker: Flayn
text: Who, me? No, it is nothing. May we all see this through to the end.

speaker: Claude
text: It still doesn't make sense to me. A goddess was living inside Teach, right? But now there's a ceremony to receive a revelation or whatever. How could that be necessary anymore? There must be another objective.  It's pointless to speculate about it now. We'll know the answer soon enough. There isn't any danger for us students, but… be careful, Teach.

speaker: Rhea
text: Are you surprised, Professor? This is the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Edelgard
text: To think there was such a vast space beneath the monastery all this time. It's hard imagine that any of these enormous contraptions are of this world.

speaker: Rhea
text: This is where the goddess who created this world was laid to rest, along with her children.

speaker: Rhea
text: It is said that our creator, the goddess Sothis, sat upon this very throne. Professor, do you recognize this throne?

speaker: Byleth
text: I do.

speaker: Rhea
text: So long... I have waited so very long for this day. Sit upon the throne. I have no doubt you will be gifted a revelation from the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: I do not.

speaker: Rhea
text: There is no need to hide anything from me. You have seen it, haven’t you? In a dream...

speaker: Rhea
text: Well?  It was supposed to be but a step away. What could possibly be missing?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Stop right there.

speaker: Metodey
text: Don't move, any of you. If you move, your lives will be forfeit. Thank you ever so much for guiding us this far. The Imperial army will now take possession of everything in the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Dorothea
text: What's the Imperial army doing here?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Wait! Does he work for the Flame Emperor?

speaker: Linhardt
text: So the Flame Emperor's connected to the Empire. I never thought that possible.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Edelgard, did you know about this?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. In fact, I gave the order. I am the Flame Emperor.

speaker: Hubert
text: I guess that's the end of play-at-school, Lady Edelgard. I mean, Your Majesty.

speaker: Metody
text: Get to work, everyone! The Crest Stones belong to us now! And take those filthy bones, too.

speaker: Rhea
text: Insolence! You will atone for the sin of tramping on this holy resting place.  Professor, destroy these villainous traitors who dare dishonor our creator!

speaker: Caspar
text: Wait! What's the meaning of this, Edelgard?

speaker: Petra
text: You... made use of us? Why?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm sorry, my teacher. I cut this path, and now I must follow it. My friends, I ask that all of you stay back. It is not my intention to fight you.  By order of the Adrestian emperor, Edelgard von Hresvelg, I command you to collect the Crest Stones! If anyone attempts to stop us, kill them!

speaker: Rhea
text: Are you surprised, Professor? This is the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Incredible. To think such a vast space has been hiding beneath the monastery all this time. I wonder what powers that giant mechanism that descends beneath the ground.

speaker: Rhea
text: This is where the goddess who created this world was laid to rest, along with her children.

speaker: Rhea
text: It is said that our creator, the goddess Sothis, sat upon this very throne. Professor, do you recognize this throne?

speaker: Byleth
text: I do.

speaker: Rhea
text: So long... I have waited so very long for this day. Sit upon the throne. I have no doubt you will be gifted a revelation from the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: I do not.

speaker: Rhea
text: There is no need to hide anything from me. You have seen it, haven’t you? In a dream...

speaker: Rhea
text: Well?  It was supposed to be but a step away. What could possibly be missing?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Halt! Reveal yourself!

speaker: Metodey
text: Don't move, any of you. If you move, your lives will be forfeit. Thank you ever so much for guiding us this far. The Imperial army will now take possession of everything in the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Dedue
text: Why is the Imperial Army here?

speaker: Ingrid
text: This can't be. How did they get into Garreg Mach?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Even the Flame Emperor is here. That can only mean--

speaker: Felix
text: The Flame Emperor is connected to the Empire. What do you know.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I never imagined you'd have the nerve to return here. What are you after, Flame Emperor?

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: Is it not obvious? The Holy Tomb contains great power; the power to rule all of Fódlan.

speaker: Dimitri
text: And to attain that power, you'll trample anything that stands in your way, just like you did in Duscur!

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: I had nothing to do with that.  Quickly, retrieve the Crest Stones! Kill for them if you must.

speaker: Rhea
text: Insolence! You will atone for the sin of tramping on this holy resting place.  Professor, destroy these villainous traitors who dare dishonor our creator!

speaker: Rhea
text: Are you surprised, Professor? This is the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Claude
text: That mechanism for descending underground back there... What powers it? When I tried to come by myself, it wouldn't even budge.

speaker: Rhea
text: This is where the goddess who created this world was laid to rest, along with her children.

speaker: Rhea
text: It is said that our creator, the goddess Sothis, sat upon this very throne. Professor, do you recognize this throne?

speaker: Byleth
text: I do.

speaker: Rhea
text: So long... I have waited so very long for this day. Sit upon the throne. I have no doubt you will be gifted a revelation from the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: I do not.

speaker: Rhea
text: There is no need to hide anything from me. You have seen it, haven’t you? In a dream...

speaker: Rhea
text: Well?  It was supposed to be but a step away. What could possibly be missing?

speaker: Claude
text: Sorry to disturb you when you're distressed, Archbishop, but it seems some uninvited guests have arrived.

speaker: Metodey
text: Don't move, any of you. If you move, your lives will be forfeit. Thank you ever so much for guiding us this far. The Imperial army will now take possession of everything in the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Ignatz
text: The Imperial Army? What are they doing here?

speaker: Lysithea
text: So, they knew we were heading to the Holy Tomb and followed us here.

speaker: Hilda
text: Hey, who is that standing next to the angry guy? Could that be--

speaker: Claude
text: The Flame Emperor. I see. So you've been allied with the Empire from the beginning.

speaker: Leonie
text: What are they doing here? What do they hope to gain?

speaker: Claude
text: There's only one goal for grave robbers like these, right, Flame Emperor? You're here to steal the treasure that rests within the Holy Tomb.

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: For a fool, you catch on quickly. Those Crest Stones will be ours. That infernal power, which is masquerading as a medicine but is truly a poison, will plague this world no longer.

speaker: Rhea
text: Insolence! You will atone for the sin of tramping on this holy resting place.  Professor, destroy these villainous traitors who dare dishonor our creator!

speaker: Rhea
text: I will not allow such violence from the Empire! Strike down the rebels and protect the Holy Tomb!

speaker: Metodey
text: The Crest Stones are in the caskets! Open every last one of them!

speaker: Rhea
text: The Holy Tomb must not be desecrated! Protect as many of the Crest Stones as you can!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Heretics! What could be gained from desecrating these tombs and disgracing the dead?!

speaker: Claude
text: I guess we're fighting over who gets those Crest Stones… What in the world do they intend to use them for, anyway?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Take away every last one of those Crest Stones.

speaker: Rhea
text: That is enough! Do you even know what those stones are?!

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: Take away the Crest Stones. All of them!

speaker: Rhea
text: That is enough! Do you even know what those stones are?!

speaker: Metodey
text: I'm told it's fine to kill those who resist. Now then, how shall I cook you?

speaker: Metodey
text: Wait... No! I was just following orders! I just... Graaargh!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Despite what I said, I have no intention of killing you. So why not stand down and get out of my way?

speaker: Edelgard
text: So the end has come...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, I will make no excuses. Thank you for all that you did for me. In truth-- No. Let's leave it at that.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You could have had a peaceful life... Why did you have to come to Garreg Mach?

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: You wish to interfere? Then your life is forfeit.

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: You are the one person I did not wish to make an enemy of...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Do not try to say you have forgotten... Do you know just how many people died in Duscur?

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: Why bother with this? Stay silent and fight.

speaker: Dimitri
text: So you want to turn your eyes away from the lives you have trampled? Dastard! You are a monster. The lowliest beast I have ever known.

speaker: Claude
text: So, you're the fabled Flame Emperor? Go ahead and enlighten me. What are you planning to do with the Crest Stones? What did you use Flayn's blood for? Who's Kronya? Who's Solon?

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: Silence. There is no need for you to know.

speaker: Claude
text: Is it that mask that's to blame for your curtness? If so, maybe I should rip it off and ask again.

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: Ugh...

speaker: Edelgard
text: So the end has come...

speaker: Claude
text: Is this some sick joke? The Flame Emperor is actually Edelgard?!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Is this some kind of twisted joke?!

speaker: Dimitri
text: I've been looking for you... I will take that head from your shoulders, and hang it from the gates of Enbarr!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Stop right there!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Before I break your neck, there is one thing I must ask you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Stay out of my way.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I don't recall giving you permission to speak. Answer my question. That is all you have left to do. Flame Emperor...no. Edelgard. Tell me now. Why did you cause such a tragedy?

speaker: Dimitri
text: You killed your own mother, and yet you haven't even had the decency to stop and consider the reasons behind your actions. Have you?!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I already told you, I had nothing to do with that.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ha! It was foolish to think I could reason with a lowly beast.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Your Majesty, now!

speaker: Dimitri
text: You are a monster...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Come, Hubert!

speaker: Rhea
text: To flee is futile, wicked girl. The Church of Seiros will raise its entire army against you, until you have been captured and punished! You have defiled the Holy Tomb, dishonored the goddess, and humiliated your brethren. That crime will never be erased, even if you burn in the eternal flames, and spill all of your blood into the goddess's soil!

speaker: Rhea
text: Come, Professor. Let us return and decide upon our next course of action.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ngah...

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you OK?

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't believe it. Edelgard...

speaker: Dimitri
text: We weren't able to defeat her.

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I will kill Edelgard. With my own hands. I swear it!  Let's return to the monastery, Professor. It is clear what must be done.

speaker: Rhea
text: You have disappointed me, Edelgard. To think that a descendant of House Hresvelg would dare betray the holy church...  Professor, kill Edelgard at once. She is a danger to all of Fódlan. Such a rebellious heart cannot be allowed to keep beating.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I have achieved my objective. I will retreat. Farewell, Professor. If we meet again, it will be on the battlefield.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Come, Hubert!

speaker: Rhea
text: To flee is futile, wicked girl. The Church of Seiros will raise its entire army against you, until you have been captured and punished! You have defiled the Holy Tomb, dishonored the goddess, and humiliated your brethren. That crime will never be erased, even if you burn in the eternal flames, and spill all of your blood into the goddess's soil!

speaker: Rhea
text: Come, Professor. Let us return and decide upon our next course of action.

speaker: Claude
text: I'm not exactly on friendly terms with the princess, but I do have a few questions for her. Edelgard said that the Crest Stones represent power. That means she knows how to use them. She almost certainly knows other secrets of Fódlan as well... Once things calm down a bit, there's a lot more that Rhea needs to tell us.

speaker: Claude
text: I just hope there's still time. I have this strange feeling... that history is being written. That an age of anarchy is upon us. Let's hope I'm mistaken.

speaker: Rhea
text: You have disappointed me, Edelgard. To think that a descendant of House Hresvelg would dare betray the holy church...

speaker: Edelgard
text: So, it is my teacher who stands in my way. I always knew it would come to this...

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor, kill Edelgard at once. She is a danger to all of Fódlan. Such a rebellious heart cannot be allowed to keep beating.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I will withdraw... for now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Come, Hubert!

speaker: Rhea
text: To flee is futile, wicked girl. The Church of Seiros will raise its entire army against you, until you have been captured and punished! You have defiled the Holy Tomb, dishonored the goddess, and humiliated your brethren. That crime will never be erased, even if you burn in the eternal flames, and spill all of your blood into the goddess's soil!

speaker: Rhea
text: Come, Professor. Let us return and decide upon our next course of action.

speaker: Rhea
text: You... How dare you!

speaker: Edelgard
text: My teacher, I-- Thank you! But are you certain that-- No, now isn't the time for discussion.

speaker: Hubert
text: Words cannot properly express my gratitude, Professor.

speaker: Rhea
text: So, this is the choice you have made. You are just another failure. Your presence soils this Holy Tomb, and disgraces my brethren. I will not allow one who would lend our enemies strength... to wield the power of the goddess Sothis. I have passed judgement. And now, I shall rip your chest open... and TAKE BACK YOUR HEART MYSELF!

speaker: Hubert
text: That must be the Immaculate One...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. The monsters that have controlled Fódlan in secret for far too long. Rhea is their leader.

speaker: Hubert
