text: You have lost your father... Now more than ever do I understand how very lucky I am that you were able to save me. Professor, I deeply appreciate what you have done. Thank you. If there is anything at all I can do in return, please tell me, OK?

speaker: Hanneman
text: You've lost someone very dear to you... I'm so... You have my sympathy. Manuela and I can take on some of your workload this month. We can't do all the teaching, but at least we can lighten the load for you. I've always seen strength in your eyes. I know you'll recover. You're a very strong person.

speaker: Manuela
text: I have something rather uncomfortable to discuss. It's about the weapon that killed Jeralt. Will you listen?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll listen.

speaker: Manuela
text: It was a dagger, but I know enough to know it wasn't an ordinary dagger. It wasn't made of iron or steel because... Well, because whatever it was, the wound it left wasn't normal. Who could make a blade like that, do you figure?

speaker: Byleth
text: I won't listen.

speaker: Manuela
text: I see... That's probably for the best.

speaker: Manuela
text: I wonder who they were...

speaker: Cyril
text: Oh Goddess, hear my prayer. Please receive this beloved person. When the cold rain washes the body, when the bird and wolf announce the dawn... Receive them into your blue blood. Receive them into a twinkling star. That's a mourning scripture from the Church of Seiros. Lady Rhea taught it to me. I pray that Jeralt is happy in the next world.

speaker: Anna
text: I heard Jeralt passed away... My deepest condolences. I knew him long before I ever even met you... He was always so much fun to be around... It's such a loss...

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Professor... Thank you for all you have done for us. Nothing to report today. *sobs*

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor! I know where the enemy is... Where Solon is. They're in a place called the Sealed Forest, close to the monastery. The archbishop is gathering the knights to begin a search. She's doing so in secret, behind our backs.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why in secret?

speaker: Edelgard
text: She must be afraid that a thirst for revenge will compel you to seek them out. Now that you know, will you give us the order?

speaker: Rhea
text: No. I will not allow it.

speaker: Seteth
text: This discovery comes just when the knights are at their busiest. It is all too likely that our foes revealed themselves to lure you out there. They are the ones who took Jeralt from you… I know how you must despise them, but I must ask you to rein in your personal feelings for now.

speaker: Byleth
text: You can't stop me.

speaker: Rhea
text: Please, Professor. Do not act carelessly. I ask that you leave this to us. Losing you so soon after losing Jeralt would be unbearable.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Lady Rhea, our professor is not acting out of revenge. Sending us out there is the most strategic move we can make. You can't deny it. Most of the knights are still far away. Not only does our professor wield a Hero's Relic, but there is no one here who is more powerful. Seteth and the few remaining knights can't leave the monastery unattended. We have fought under our teacher's command countless times. We are the most effective army here, and we are already prepared for battle. We have no idea what the enemy is plotting. We must act now!

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor… Do you agree with this strategy?

speaker: Rhea
text: Understood. I will give you the order. Destroy the enemy that is hiding in the Sealed Forest… You have the protection of the goddess on your side. Whatever happens, you shall overcome.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Let's go, my teacher. Whatever happens, do not lose your conviction out there.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor, have you heard? They say we've finally located the enemy. It seems they're hiding in the sealed forest, right near the monastery. Lady Rhea has summoned all of the knights to return and take them down. And all of this is being done in secret. Why? To keep us...no, to keep you in the dark.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why the secrecy?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Lady Rhea likely assumed you wouldn't be able to stop yourself from confronting the enemy if you knew their location. But that is not how this story ends, is it? Professor... We're at the ready. Order us to depart, and we'll fight at your side.

speaker: Rhea
text: No. I will not allow it.

speaker: Seteth
text: This discovery comes just when the knights are at their busiest. It is all too likely that our foes revealed themselves to lure you out there. They are the ones who took Jeralt from you… I know how you must despise them, but I must ask you to rein in your personal feelings for now.

speaker: Byleth
text: You can't stop me.

speaker: Rhea
text: Please, Professor. Do not act carelessly. I ask that you leave this to us. Losing you so soon after losing Jeralt would be unbearable.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Lady Rhea, Seteth. Please, try to understand our reasoning before you refuse. With most of the knights still far away, we cannot afford for you two to leave the monastery undefended. The enemy's strength is yet unknown. The only warriors who likely stand a chance are those who wield Relics. With all that in mind, it's obvious who should be dispatched, is it not? If the professor leaves, we will go as well. We've already made preparations and are ready to depart at a moment's notice. Surely you must see that we cannot wait any longer for the knights to gather. Please... Do what must be done and give us the order.

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor… Do you agree with this strategy?

speaker: Rhea
text: Understood. I will give you the order. Destroy the enemy that is hiding in the Sealed Forest… You have the protection of the goddess on your side. Whatever happens, you shall overcome.

speaker: Dimitri
text: No matter what enemy we face, we will not fail. I promise you that.

speaker: Claude
text: Teach! Tomas… I mean…Solon and his lackeys. Their whereabouts have been discovered. Apparently they're lurking in the Sealed Forest, not too far from the monastery. Rhea has called back all of the knights who were out searching to round them up. Seems like it could take some time for them to make it back here…but she didn't ask for our help.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why keep it a secret?

speaker: Claude
text: Perhaps to prevent you from running headfirst toward revenge? It's only natural that you would leap at the chance for it. Anyone would.

speaker: Rhea
text: No. I will not allow it.

speaker: Seteth
text: This discovery comes just when the knights are at their busiest. It is all too likely that our foes revealed themselves to lure you out there. They are the ones who took Jeralt from you… I know how you must despise them, but I must ask you to rein in your personal feelings for now.

speaker: Byleth
text: You can't stop me.

speaker: Rhea
text: Please, Professor. Do not act carelessly. I ask that you leave this to us. Losing you so soon after losing Jeralt would be unbearable.

speaker: Claude
text: Listen, Rhea. Erm, Lady Rhea. This move is the most strategic. The military strategy I'm devising will soon echo across Fódlan's history. I'm sure of it. Just think about it. Most of the knights are still far away, and we can't afford to have Seteth and friends abandon the monastery. So the only person who can take action now also happens to be our best commander. It's Teach, and wherever Teach leads, we'll follow. And since you've taught us that this sort of thing is always a possibility, we're already prepared for battle. We can buy the knights more time. Not for revenge, but for a defensive attack on behalf of the monastery.

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor… Do you agree with this strategy?

speaker: Rhea
text: Understood. I will give you the order. Destroy the enemy that is hiding in the Sealed Forest… You have the protection of the goddess on your side. Whatever happens, you shall overcome.

speaker: Claude
text: We have our orders, Teach. Now all that's left is to pull out a miracle.

speaker: Hubert
text: We are now within the Sealed Forest. We must not let our guard down.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Professor... We'll avenge Jeralt for you, no matter what!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Remember--it is a bad idea to get distracted by revenge.

speaker: Petra
text: I have readiness. Our enemies will be taking...we will take our enemies down!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Well, it's not like we have any other missions this month. I suppose this is as good a way as any to spend our energy.

speaker: Caspar
text: Linhardt spending energy? We had better finish this fast before the pigs start flying everywhere.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Lower your voice. The enemy could be close!

speaker: Flayn
text: It is time to repay the kindness of the professor who saved my life!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, I know I'm the one who insisted we come here, but don't doubt for a moment that the enemy is waiting for you.

speaker: Hubert
text: Lady Edelgard! What are you saying?

speaker: Edelgard
text: What other objective could they possibly have? We have no clue what kind of trap is waiting for us. Please be careful, my teacher. We can't afford to lose you...

speaker: Hubert
text: The enemy is strong, but you will prevail. You must.

speaker: Dedue
text: The Sealed Forest is up ahead. Stay alert.

speaker: Ingrid
text: This is for Captain Jeralt. I will not falter.

speaker: Flayn
text: It is time to repay the kindness of the professor who saved my life!

speaker: Ashe
text: Leave it to us, Professor. I'll give it my all.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Fighting Tomas... It will be difficult, that's for certain.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I don't really love the idea of fighting people I know...

speaker: Annette
text: We don't have a choice. Even if it's difficult, an enemy is an enemy. We've just got to get it over with!

speaker: Felix
text: Just kill them from behind. As long as you don't see their faces, you won't know if you know them.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We won't know unless we see their face... Yes, I suppose that is true. Professor... I hope you know I meant what I told you before. Your enemy is my enemy. And I will follow you until the end, whatever that end may be.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's reassuring.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's do our best.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes...right. We'll fulfill our duty together. We've come this far. We can't stop now. I hope you know that you can rely on us. No matter who the enemy is, we are prepared to cut them down.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes... No matter who they may be...

speaker: Claude
text: The Sealed Forest is up ahead. Visibility is awful there, so everyone needs to be extra cautious.

speaker: Hilda
text: You seem to know a lot about it. It is just a forest, isn't it?

speaker: Claude
text: Have you been there too? Oh… Never mind. Listen, just like I told the archbishop, this is not a war of vengeance. It's a riddle, so to speak. Those guys are undoubtedly planning something terrible. We need some kind of clue as to what. The attack on the Holy Mausoleum. That foul business in Remire. The Demonic Beasts at the chapel… It can't go on. We need to figure out their objective and stop them from achieving it. That's our mission.

speaker: Lorenz
text: So, we have our mission now. We had better not fail.

speaker: Lysithea
text: It is a difficult task, but we will succeed.

speaker: Flayn
text: It is time to repay the kindness of the professor who saved my life!

speaker: Ignatz
text: An enemy whose objective you don't understand is a frightening prospect.

speaker: Raphael
text: We're gonna destroy 'em! It's our mission!

speaker: Leonie
text: I will have my revenge, whatever it takes. On that, I will never budge.

speaker: Marianne
text: Leonie… You will have what you seek.

speaker: Claude
text: I'll admit, vengeance sounds pretty nice. But don't forget that we're here for information. Luckily, we can easily find what we're looking for while getting revenge for Jeralt. Right, Teach?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Look there! Demonic Beasts! I suppose they aren't holding back.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Demonic Beasts! The enemy was always intending to lure us here...

speaker: Claude
text: How kind of them to welcome us with Demonic Beasts. They're not playing around.

speaker: Monica
text: Hello! You're here! Welcome to the forest of death! My name is Kronya. This weakling girl was just a borrowed look for me.

speaker: Kronya
text: This is what I really look like! Now, you vermin... I'll take down every last one of you!

speaker: Kronya
text: If this takes too long, I might be forced to escape. Oh, or do you simply intend to let me go? How accommodating of you! As for me, I intend to kill you all.

speaker: Kronya
text: How cute, you're trying so hard! But now it's time to die!

speaker: Kronya
text: You're a fool to be so brazen. You'll never avenge your father at this rate. I'll have to kill you too! With my own hands!

speaker: Kronya
text: Huh? What are you-- Are you here to kill me?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I am. Prepare yourself for death while you still can.

speaker: Leonie
text: Monica. You'll pay for what you've done.

speaker: Kronya
text: I told you! I am not Monica, I am Kronya! Do not call me by that fake name!

speaker: Leonie
text: I don't care what you're called. I don't care if it takes my last breath. I'll kill you.

speaker: Kronya
text: Please! My powers are beyond your comprehension. You're just a filthy worm!

speaker: Kronya
text: But how? How could I really lose...to a lowly creature like you?

speaker: Solon
text: Well.

speaker: Kronya
text: Solon! Don't just stand there and stare! I need your help!

speaker: Solon
text: Yes. You most certainly do.

speaker: Kronya
text: Huh?

speaker: Solon
text: Have no fear, Kronya. Your sacrifice will help to rid of this world of the filthy vermin that have long infested it.

speaker: Kronya
text: Solon... Stop this!

speaker: Solon
text: The time has finally come...to unleash the Forbidden Spell of Zahras upon our enemies!

speaker: Kronya
text: Please...help me...

speaker: Solon
text: Begone with you...Fell Star.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That could only have been magic! What happened to our professor?

speaker: Solon
text: They were swallowed by the mystical darkness of the forbidden spell. An eternity wandering in a void of darkness, never to return to this world... To think we almost had the Sword of the Creator...

speaker: Caspar
text: You're lying! Our professor is alive, I know it!

speaker: Flayn
text: That's right! Our professor is no ordinary human!

speaker: Hubert
text: It is hard to fathom that our professor would die in a place like this.

speaker: Solon
text: It is possible that death has yet to find your friend. But there are worse things than death. Drifting through the darkness with no chance to escape... Overwhelmed with hopelessness... It must be torturous.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You're already boasting a victory, but know this--if you did use such devious tricks to stop our professor... I swear that you will regret it.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I cannot help but agree with her this once. Even if our professor is trapped in darkness, that is not the end of their story.

speaker: Solon
text: I will not forgive such arrogance. If you prefer it so, you shall also be added to the ranks of the dead!

speaker: Dimitri
text: What was that sorcery? What happened to our professor?!

speaker: Solon
text: They were swallowed by the mystical darkness of the forbidden spell. An eternity wandering in a void of darkness, never to return to this world… To think we almost had the Sword of the Creator…

speaker: Annette
text: That's a lie! There's no way the professor is really dead!

speaker: Flayn
text: That's right! Our professor is no ordinary human!

speaker: Dedue
text: I do not believe our professor has fallen.

speaker: Solon
text: It is possible that death has yet to find your friend. But there are worse things than death. Drifting through the darkness with no chance to escape…Overwhelmed with hopelessness… It must be torturous.

speaker: Dedue
text: We cannot abandon hope, Your Highness. Our professor lives. I know it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You're right. We will save the professor. But first, let's destroy this fiend! I'll slice you into a thousand pieces as we watch with horror... You will know true pain before I finally allow you to die!

speaker: Solon
text: How trite. But if you wish for pain, I shall oblige. If you prefer it so, you shall also be added to the ranks of the dead!

speaker: Hilda
text: Wh-what was that? Where did you go, Professor?!

speaker: Solon
text: They were swallowed by the mystical darkness of the forbidden spell. An eternity wandering in a void of darkness, never to return to this world… To think we almost had the Sword of the Creator…

speaker: Lysithea
text: I don't believe anything you say! Our professor is still alive!

speaker: Flayn
text: That's right! Our professor is no ordinary human!

speaker: Claude
text: I refuse to believe that Teach would die in a place like this!

speaker: Solon
text: It is possible that death has yet to find your friend. But there are worse things than death. Drifting through the darkness with no chance to escape…Overwhelmed with hopelessness… It must be torturous.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, all I hear is good news. Teach is still alive. And if that's true, then there's only one thing to do. Defeat you while we wait for Teach's triumphant return!

speaker: Leonie
text: Prepare yourself. We will avenge our leader here and now!

speaker: Solon
text: How trite. But if you wish for pain, I shall oblige. If you prefer it so, you shall also be added to the ranks of the dead!

speaker: Sothis
text: You fool!

speaker: Sothis
text: What were you thinking, charging right into an enemy's trap? Are you just a boulder that rolls down whatever hill it's on? No, even a boulder has more sense!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Sothis
text: Apologizing won't make things right! This darkness is terrifying!

speaker: Byleth
text: I can explain...

speaker: Sothis
text: Excuses won't help us! This darkness is terrifying!

speaker: Sothis
text: As you and I are one... I, too, am trapped within this void. But please consider this... This realm of darkness we are in is seperate from the world from which you came. I mean that it would take a god to leave this place. In time, our hearts and minds will cease to be. Are you prepared to die?

speaker: Byleth
text: I am.

speaker: Sothis
text: How very brave of you, to joke at times like these...

speaker: Byleth
text: I am not.

speaker: Sothis
text: I thought as much. I also do not wish to die. And yet...

speaker: Sothis
text: There is no other choice...

speaker: Byleth
text: What choice?

speaker: Sothis
text: Do you recall your father's diary? He said you were a child who never cried nor laughed. I think I am the one to blame. I must have been asleep, but even then, I feel I was a part of you. I do not know how Rhea managed it, but she allowed me to exist inside of you. The truth is I have always been with you. It is within you that I found my power yet again. The power of a goddess. The power of the progenitor god.

speaker: Sothis
text: My name is Sothis. By now you must be well aware of what that means. I am the one who watches over Fódlan and the creatures dwelling there. I am Sothis, she who died then returned.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't believe it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Somehow, I know it to be true.

speaker: Sothis
text: There is only one thing left to do to save us from this darkness of eternity. I must now use the power of a god. However, I lack a body of my own. And so, I must relinquish all the power that I have...to you. The time has come for you and I to join as one. And when that comes to pass...then I shall disappear.

speaker: Byleth
text: Disappear?!

speaker: Byleth
text: I won't allow it.

speaker: Sothis
text: When I say disappear, I do not mean that all I am will be no more. My soul will join with yours, and you and I will never be apart. But...I will no longer have a chance to speak with you. I shall miss it. So long have I been on this path with you. Through you, I got to see and hear this world. I even got to chastise you from time to time. I may not have acted like a goddess, but...it was certainly fun. For all that you have done... Thank you. I'm glad that it was you to whom my fate was bound.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you...for everything.

speaker: Sothis
text: Now... We must pray. For if we share this wish, our spirits two will join as one... Your wish...is to return to the forest, stop the enemy, and rescue the little ones. No need for words. I know your heart as though it were my own...

speaker: Sothis
text: Your will and mine are now as one. Both sides of time are revealed to you, and you alone.

speaker: Sothis
text: You know I am the beginning. What shall you do?

speaker: Solon
text: So the Fell Star consumes even the darkness itself...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor... It is you, right? I knew that you would always come back to us. I'd like to ask about your appearance, but for now, let's dispose of our enemies.

speaker: Solon
text: What did you see in the darkness of Zahras? This should be impossible. The only being that can withstand that darkness is... Unless I dispose of you myself, I may never have the chance to send you back there!

speaker: Solon
text: But this is not the end... Thales will carry out our mission, somehow...

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's over. Now, Professor. About your appearance...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor... That is you, isn't it? I am glad you are safe. I was sure that you would return. Please tell me all that happened to you later. For now, it's imperative that we kill the demon!

speaker: Solon
text: What did you see in the darkness of Zahras? This should be impossible. The only being that can withstand that darkness is... Unless I dispose of you myself, I may never have the chance to send you back there!

speaker: Solon
text: But this is not the end... Thales will carry out our mission, somehow...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Thales... Does he also serve the Flame Emperor? It can't be...

speaker: Claude
text: Teach... You are Teach, right? I always believed in you... I knew you could cut your way out of anything.

speaker: Solon
text: What did you see in the darkness of Zahras? This should be impossible. The only being that can withstand that darkness is... Unless I dispose of you myself, I may never have the chance to send you back there!

speaker: Solon
text: But this is not the end... Thales will carry out our mission, somehow...

speaker: Claude
text: I guess this is still far from over...

speaker: Solon
text: I have no time to waste on the likes of you...

speaker: Solon
text: To think...that I would lose to mere beasts.

speaker: Solon
text: I am terrified by you... Even though an emotion like fear has no place inside me. That means you must be eliminated.

speaker: Solon
text: So this is how it is... I cannot let you live!

speaker: Edelgard
text: You stole the words from my mouth. You lost the moment you failed to kill the professor.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That hair...and those eyes... You remind me of someone. What happened to you?

speaker: Byleth
text: The goddess gifted me her power.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The goddess? I see... Well, I'm happy for you. Your weapon is called the Sword of the Creator, after all. It's no wonder she looks favorably upon you. Just as it was with saint Seiros, no doubt... And just how will you use this new power, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: For the people of the world.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Heh, that is so like you to say that.

speaker: Byleth
text: For my students.

speaker: Edelgard
text: For us? I see...

speaker: Byleth
text: For myself.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That is no answer. You must use your power for something greater than yourself.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Tell me... If the world, and your students included, were to divide and go to war with each other, what would you do? In that scenario, each side would represent both the world and your students. Who would you--

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor? Have you...fallen asleep?! This must be a side effect of your recent...changes. I can't just leave you here...

speaker: Edelgard
text: I shouldn't ask Hubert to carry you, so I suppose it falls to me...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor... I'm glad you're OK. And you seem relatively unscathed. I'm...I'm so relieved. What's more, Jeralt's foe is dead. Though we took little satisfaction from it. Professor... I must ask. What happened after we were separated? You look...different.

speaker: Byleth
text: The goddess gifted me her power.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The goddess appeared...and gave you her power? It's as though...the legend of old has been made flesh. It's hard to grasp, in all honestly. But having seen you pierce the sky with my own eyes, I find myself unable to doubt it.

speaker: Byleth
text: A legend of old?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. The legend of Saint Seiros. It is said that she received a divine revelation from the goddess and was gifted with her power. Long ago, the goddess dispatched Seiros to defeat an evil king who went mad with power. Perhaps the goddess saw the goodness of Seiros within you too, and wished to help you in your quest to defeat evil. Hm. If you're Seiros, granted power by the goddess, then I suppose that makes me... Ah, never mind. I'm getting carried away.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor! What's wrong?! Are you...uh... Are you asleep? What is happening these days? Well, it matters not. We must get you help, and fast.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Sorry, Professor, but I have no choice but to carry you back.

speaker: Claude
text: Teach! We won! I'll be honest—when I lost sight of you, I broke into a cold sweat. But Jeralt's killer is dead. All's well that ends well.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's true.

speaker: Byleth
text: True…

speaker: Claude
text: You're kidding, right? I understood putting it off while we were in battle, but now that it's over, just go ahead and spit it out. That hair. Those eyes. That unfathomable power. What happened out there?

speaker: Byleth
text: I will tell you…

speaker: Claude
text: You mean to tell me…that an entity who claims to be the goddess was living inside your mind? And it's been that way since you were a baby? And this goddess entrusted all of her goddess-like power to you and then vanished…

speaker: Claude
text: It's a difficult story to swallow, Teach. But the way you look now… I guess I've got no choice but to believe it. How could something like that happen? There must be a clue in Jeralt's diary. If you believe the diary, there's a high possibility that Rhea did something to you when you were born. That's likely when all this began. What in the world happened to you as a baby? And what was Rhea after?

speaker: Claude
text: Teach! What's the matter?! Did you trip or… Wait. Are you sleeping? This must be an effect of the goddess's power. I wonder if Teach's body can handle the strain…

speaker: Claude
text: Think, Claude. What now? Should I carry him on my back? Easier said than done…

speaker: Rhea
text: In time's flow...see the glow of flames ever burning bright... On the swift river's drift, broken memories alight...

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor. You must remain still.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where am I?

speaker: Byleth
text: What happened?

speaker: Rhea
text: Everything is all right. There is no need to worry. Those who are trying to harm you are far away.

speaker: Rhea
text: ... How lovely...it would be for this moment to last forever... I wish I could hold on to this time we have stolen... that you and I could create a world without end... I have heard whispers of what happened to you. Your appearance... You have received power from the goddess. From the moment you took hold of the Sword of the Creator... I prayed that one day the radiant power of Sothis, which bathes Fódlan in its celestial light, might reside within you. But you are so much more than the light. You are my... Close your eyes, dear one. Sleep, just a while longer.

speaker: Rhea
text: I will be watching over you, always. Always and forever...

speaker: Seteth
text: As you have already been notified, your mission is to subdue some bandits. Our students have been learning about combat through study, but this is a precious opportunity to provide them with practical experience. The knights will support your mission and are prepared to offer their assistance if necessary. In short, this is no mock battle. You must be prepared for anything. You will receive a message from the knights when it is time to depart. Until then, use your time wisely.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The last time we fought bandits, you saved me. Maybe I can return the favor this time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's do our best.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't get careless.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The knights are well aware of our enemy's strength. We can count of them to keep the battlefield under control for us. It seems unlikely that we would lose. Still, let's do all we can to prepare.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This will be our first true battle. I'm looking forward to fighting alongside you, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: As am I.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm a bit concerned.

speaker: Dimitri
text: During the mock battle, your commands were thoughtful and thorough, as was your strategy. With you on our side, I'm confident we will prevail. It seems we have some time to spare before our departure. Let's use this opportunity to prepare as best we can.

speaker: Claude
text: More bandits? Not very original, Teach.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not interested?

speaker: Byleth
text: You need to focus.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, as long as you're with us, at least things won't be boring. In fact... It may take a turn for the interesting. And with that, I take my leave to make my final preparations.

speaker: Jeralt
text: You seem well. Are you adjusting to life at the monastery?

speaker: Byleth
text: I think so.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Oh? I didn't expect that answer. When we were mercenaries, I handled everything. Outside of battle, you didn't have much contact with people, did you? I thought being thrown into a swarm of noble brats to teach would be a bit much for you. But I guess I was wrong to worry.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not quite.

speaker: Jeralt
text: Well, I didn't expect it would be easy on you. When we were mercenaries, I handled everything. Outside of battle, you didn't have much contact with people, did you? I thought being thrown into a swarm of noble brats to teach would be a bit much for you. It seems I was right to worry.

speaker: Jeralt
text: By the way, I heard about those bandits. Your first assignment is to take them out, right? That's fairly routine for you by now, but don't forget it's the first real taste of battle for those brats. It'll be tougher to sleep at night if you let one of your little pupils die, so stay vigilant and lead them well. I wish I could offer you my support, but Lady Rhea won't allow it. For now, I'll try to figure out what she wants from you. I don't mind you settling into your life here, but don't let your guard down. Ever.

speaker: Byleth
text: ... (A girl's voice... What could it mean?)

speaker: Edelgard
text: For some students, this will be their first time stepping onto a real battlefield. It's important that they're mentally prepared. As for me? Ha! Do I look green to you? Is there anything you wish to ask me about, regarding spending your time at the monastery or battles?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Just as students have much to learn from other students, professors can also share their knowledge with each other. You should consider seeking instruction from Professor Hanneman or Professor Manuela. I think you'll find their insight quite interesting.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Which house a student is assigned to depends on where they're from. That said, each professor has their own area of expertise. So if a student is adamant about it, it is possible to switch someone from one house to another. Pending your approval, of course. If you become closer with the students by partaking in the various activities around the monastery, you'll be able to talk to them about such things.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You're quite powerful to have beaten us in the mock battle. Such a shame you aren't leading our class...

speaker: Dimitri
text: We have only just arrived at the academy, and we're already being sent out to take care of bandits. It is a noble mission, but one that will likely require battle. In practice, there is little difference between a battle and a war. Even with the support of the Knights of Seiros, we must still brace ourselves for the challenge. Do you have any other questions about life at the monastery or about battle?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Just as students receive guidance from professors, professors may also guide each other. If you're interested, you should seek out Professor Hanneman or Professor Manuela.

speaker: Dimitri
text: A student's house is determined by their place of origin, but naturally, each individual has their own aptitudes and interests. That said, if a student so desires and their current professor consents, they may transfer from one house to another. If you get to know the students better through the activities at the monastery, they may approach you about this.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Your performance in the mock battle was exceptional, Professor. You have inspired me to follow your example and study even more diligently. Perhaps we could train together sometime. I would love to test myself against your sword skills again.

speaker: Claude
text: Those bandits really didn't think things through, did they? They had to have known the knights would be after them the moment they entered the monastery's turf. Fine by me, though. I'm raring for some real combat experience. Any chance to grow is a good thing. Is there anything else you want to ask me, Teach? About living at the monastery or combat, anything like that?

speaker: Claude
text: Students aren't the only ones who have something to learn from their professors. Professors can also learn from each other. If you want to, you should try trading knowledge with Professor Hanneman or Professor Manuela.

speaker: Claude
text: The house a student belongs to is determined by where they're from, but it is possible for someone to switch to a different one. Of course, that's only if the student very strongly wants to make the change and their professor is on board with it. If you do a lot of different activities around the monastery, you'll get closer to students and they may ask you about it.

speaker: Claude
text: I hear you've been tasked with hunting down bandits, right? Meanwhile, my class is stuck with a downright peaceful mission. Sounds like you'll be fighting alongside the knights too. Don't let the monastery down, Teach.

speaker: Hubert
text: I fully accept the necessity of real battle from time to time, but it is still a surprise to be tasked with punishing bandits without warning. It is a rather different sort of mission. It makes me wonder what the archbishop is planning...

speaker: Hubert
text: I've heard your class is hunting thieves. That mission is very different from the one we were given.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Do you know of the Aegir family? We have long held the position of prime minister in the Empire. The Empire's power lies with six noble families, my family foremost among them. The full explanation may be time-consuming. I can give you a moment to get ready, if you would like to take notes.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not taking notes.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm ready.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: All right. I will list the six great noble families. There's Caspar's father, Count Bergliez, the Minister of Military Affairs. Then there's Linhardt's father, Count Hevring, the Minister of Domestic Affairs. Beradetta's father, Count Varley, is the Minister of Religious Affairs. Hubert's father, Marquis Vestra, is the Minister of the Imperial Household. Finally we have Duke Gerth, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, and my own father, Duke Aegir, the Prime Minister. One day, I will take his place as the prime minister of the Empire. I am more talented than anyone in my class — even Edelgard. I will lead the Empire to a bright, enlightened future.

speaker: Byleth
text: I look forward to that.

speaker: Byleth
text: That sounds like wishful thinking.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: There is nothing I cannot achieve.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Swimming through a sea of countless books, tracking down that single sought-after volume... It's absolute bliss. How do the poor fools who spend their days sharpening swords and polishing armor find any joy in life?

speaker: Caspar
text: Hey there, Professor! You here to check in on my training? Oh, that reminds me. I found this small cloth. It's kinda weird. Not really sure what it is, but it works great for wiping up sweat!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Wh-what is it? I'm not doing anything!

speaker: Byleth
text: It's not good to just do nothing.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I'm not bothering anybody...am I?

speaker: Byleth
text: Hey, what's this cake doing out here?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Cake?! Oh, come on... That's just cruel.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Oh, Professor... Hello. I was just looking for my— Well, it's...it's like a pale blue cloth. Have you seen it?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's search for it.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Eh? Um... OK...

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll tell Manuela.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Thank you so much.

speaker: Petra
text: Brigid has much more warmth than Fódlan. Even spring here has coolness! And you, Professor? Which do you find is worst? Too hot or too cold weather?

speaker: Byleth
text: The cold.

speaker: Petra
text: I have agreeance! In Brigid, I am able to be wearing much lighter clothes.

speaker: Byleth
text: The heat.

speaker: Petra
text: But you are wearing many things, Professor. If you are not liking the heat, you should be wearing lighter clothes.

speaker: Dedue
text: It is better if you do not approach me. If you spend too much time around a man of Duscur, there will be rumors.

speaker: Felix
text: For years, the boar prince and I were inseparable. I know him better than almost anyone else. So let me give you some advice. Beneath all that princely polish, he's an animal, nothing more. He's strong and skilled, sure. But don't place your trust in him as a human being. Take care he doesn't chew you up and spit you out.

speaker: Ashe
text: It's thanks to my adoptive father, Lonato, that a commoner like me is here at the academy. He is the very model of chivalry. Someday I'm going to be just like him.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor, you're the one taking out the bandits? Heh, that's one way to start your career at the academy. I didn't realize they'd order us to risk our lives here. Seems a bit extreme, doesn't it?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Our first assignment is to take out some bandits? Did anyone tell Lady Rhea that people's lives are at stake? I lost my own brother to bandits... ...Is something someone has said at some point, I'm sure. OK. Not my finest attempt at humor.

speaker: Mercedes
text: The cathedral is nice and quiet. It's so relaxing... Oh, Professor. Did you come to pray to the goddess?

speaker: Byleth
text: That's right.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Me too! Shall we pray together?

speaker: Byleth
text: I did not.

speaker: Mercedes
text: No? But shall we pray together while you're here?

speaker: Annette
text: I've got to find out everyone's likes and dislikes so I know what to cook. Who knows when it will be my turn at kitchen duty! How about you, Professor? Do you like sweet or spicy food?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sweet.

speaker: Annette
text: Ooh, same! I'll definitely remember that!

speaker: Byleth
text: Spicy.

speaker: Annette
text: Spicy? Ooh, your tastes are so mature! I'll definitely remember that.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Felix, Sylvain and I have known each other since we were children. His Highness, as well. Though I should warn you that both Felix and Sylvain are a bit...challenging at times. The moment I take my eyes off them, they're off causing all kinds of trouble. It's always been that way.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Now that you're all the way over here, Professor, care to join me in some training? After training, I love tending to the horses or burying myself in a good pile of books. Ahh, there's truly nothing better!

speaker: Lorenz
text: It is the duty of every Fódlan noble to demonstrate piety toward Seiros. Have you also come to offer your prayers to the goddess, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sure.

speaker: Lorenz
text: You don't sound terribly sure. Perhaps you are not of noble birth? After all, devotion is not as essential for a commoner.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not exactly.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I see. The truth is, I am not a particularly devoted believer either. But it would be unbecoming for a noble like me to neglect his prayers, wouldn't it?

speaker: Raphael
text: The next assignment is to track down bandits? Sounds like some training is in order! Tell me something, Professor. When it comes to a one-on-one battle, which is better? Strength or skill?

speaker: Byleth
text: Strength.

speaker: Raphael
text: I knew it! When it's all said and done, muscle always comes out on top.

speaker: Byleth
text: Skill.

speaker: Raphael
text: You might be right. But when it's all said and done, I still think muscle comes out on top!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I'm so glad to be a student here, if only because I get to use this library. Reading books from all the regions of Fódlan... I feel almost like I'm visiting those places myself.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should visit them in person.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I'd like to. I don't have many chances to travel...

speaker: Byleth
text: You can learn so much from books.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I agree! They're brimming with the knowledge and experience of our ancestors.

speaker: Lysithea
text: There were way too many vegetables in today's meal. The ratio of vegetables to sweets was completely skewed... Oh! Hi, Professor! Were you just eavesdropping on me? Well...everyone knows a plateful of sweets is far preferred to a plateful of vegetables, regardless of age.

speaker: Marianne
text: Um, Professor? Our next mission is to go after a group of bandits. I'm...not very confident. I'm afraid I'll just hold everyone else back. I should probably stay behind for this one. Or help plan the attack instead.

speaker: Marianne
text: Uh. Hello. Um, if you'll excuse me...

speaker: Hilda
text: I'm bored! Maybe I should go into town... But that would be such a hassle. Oh! Hi, Professor. I'm rather busy right now, so do make it quick.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't look busy to me.

speaker: Hilda
text: Ah, you can tell? I suppose being a professor has taught you how to ferret out time wasters.

speaker: Byleth
text: If you're busy, never mind.

speaker: Hilda
text: Are you sure? I thought you'd found me out for a moment there...

speaker: Leonie
text: Professor! Hey, do you know how old Captain Jeralt is?

speaker: Jeralt
text: That's enough, Leonie. If I don't know, how could my child know?

speaker: Leonie
text: It's not normal to forget your own age, you know. It's kind of worrisome, actually.

speaker: Jeralt
text: By the time you're forgetting your own age, you're past the point of caring.

speaker: Leonie
text: I guess if you put it that way, you've got a point...

speaker: Rhea
text: Thank you for paying me a visit. Is there anything troubling you? Or is there, perhaps, something I can help you with.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder if the students are taking to me...

speaker: Rhea
text: You seem to be getting along well with the students. I would advise you to be confident in your abilities. The rest will fall into place in time.

speaker: Byleth
text: About the teachings of Seiros...

speaker: Rhea
text: Believers live their lives by her sacred wisdom. Please use the library's vast resources to learn more.

speaker: Rhea
text: I can often be found here, so if there is ever anything you need, please do not hesitate to pay me a visit.

speaker: Seteth
text: Inside the cathedral, there is a chapel dedicated to the Four Saints. Do you know of them? Saint Indech, Saint Macuil, Saint Cichol, and...

speaker: Flayn
text: Saint Cethleann! Who is your favorite, Professor?

speaker: Seteth
text: Now that you are a member of the church, be sure to familiarize yourself with our teachings and traditions.

speaker: Alois
text: Oh, Professor! How are you today? I'm just heading out for a mission. I'll be seeing you!

speaker: Byleth
text: Good luck.

speaker: Alois
text: I don't need luck! This will be a piece of cake. I'll be back before you know it!

speaker: Byleth
text: Be careful.

speaker: Alois
text: What make you say that? Do you know something I don't? Are there supernatural elements at play? Ghosts?! Ah...oh, forget it. I'll be going now.

speaker: Shamir
text: Have we met?

speaker: Shamir
text: No. Sorry. Must be my imagination.

speaker: Jeritza
text: You look bored. Care to duel?

speaker: Byleth
text: A duel?

speaker: Byleth
text: To the death?

speaker: Jeritza
text: What? I just wanted to spar...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Excellent work guiding the students in the mock battle. Taking command like that? Simply splendid. And bearing the unknown Crest's power? Yes! I'm talking about you. Your talents are incredible, and Lady Rhea's insight as to your potential is doubly so.

speaker: Manuela
text: You know, Professor, there are some things I'll just never understand. Like the other night, I went on a date with a dashing, handsome, strong, young knight. Oh, I'm a bit weak just remembering him. Anyway... Do you know what that no-good jerk said when we got back to my room? He said, "What a mess. I'm afraid to go in there!" Can you believe it?! You know who cares about keeping everything neat and tidy? Not me, that's who. "Afraid to go in there." Some knight he is!

speaker: Tomas
text: Do you know about the cardinals? They are the ones who run the church. Their identities are a closely guarded secret...

speaker: Cyril
text: That person sure does remind me of somebody, but I can't figure out who. Oh, do ya need me for something? Sorry, but I'm really busy right now.

speaker: Anna
text: Hello there! Are you that new professor everyone's talking about? Name's Anna. I'm a merchant who slings wares all around Fódlan... and beyond! I come in here all the time, so I'm sure our paths will cross more. Hopefully much more!

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Are you settled in here at the monastery yet? Make sure to have a good look around! There's much to see! Like fish! You do know about the pond behind the dining hall, right? You can fish there! Give it a try!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: We will accompany you on your assignment. We don't want anything to happen to our precious students. If any of you run into trouble, we'll step in and help out!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: The Knights of Seiros are also known as the shining knights. We are the sword and shield of the divine Seiros. There are many orders of knights in the world, but we are the only one that has the honor of bearing the name Seiros. As a member of the church, you should probably study up on the history of Seiros and the knights.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: I hear the Officers Academy of the monastery was founded about two centuries ago. The eastern region of Fódlan was being invaded by Almyra, and so the archbishop of the time took measures to prevent the border from being taken. In order to ensure Fódlan would be safe from potential threats, she deemed it necessary to raise a generation of excellence. That is how the establishment was founded, though its purpose has changed over the years.

speaker: Monk
text: Zanado, the Red Canyon, is a place of great significance to the Church of Seiros. Even members of the church are forbidden from entering without permission. To go trampling around in there, causing trouble... Those bandits truly are morally reprehensible.

speaker: Student
text: Brigid, Almyra, Duscur... Even people from far-off lands gather here at the academy. Word of advice, Professor. There are those who don't think kindly of such people.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Perfect timing, Professor. I just received word from the knights. They've located the bandits.

speaker: Hubert
text: It seems they have them cornered. They are in Zanado, the Red Canyon.

speaker: Caspar
text: I can't wait to get started! I'll strike down those heinous thieves before they know what hit them!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Charge ahead if you must, Caspar. Just do not put the rest of us in danger.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I'm going back. I won't be of any help anyway, and I don't want to get hurt.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Don't worry, Bern. It's just some bandits. We'll have no trouble at all.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Eh, don't get ahead of yourselves. Unfounded optimism isn't a great strategy. Let's just get this over with.

speaker: Petra
text: There is nothing to get over. We will work with each other to achieve our mission.

speaker: Byleth
text: You seem excited to get out there.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure about this...

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's time, Professor. Give us our orders, and let's move out.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor. I just got word from the knights that the last of the thieves have been cornered.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Just as planned. They're in Zanado, the Red Canyon.

speaker: Ashe
text: We certainly can't allow those underhanded thieves to get away. Let's work together and do our best to take them down!

speaker: Dedue
text: It matters not who we're up against. They will not harm His Highness.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. We're just fighting common thieves, right? I don't expect much of a challenge.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Aren't you a spoilsport. I'm actually quite excited myself. Who knows... There may even be some cute lady thieves.

speaker: Annette
text: Hmm. Well, at any rate, a real battle is a great opportunity for us to see how far we've come.

speaker: Mercedes
text: True. The mock battle was a success. We'll be fine so long as we stay the course.

speaker: Byleth
text: So much excitement...

speaker: Byleth
text: I hope everything turns out all right.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Perhaps we are a bit overly excited, but remember that we have the knights on our side. All should be well. Ah! And speaking of the knights, I heard that Jeralt is once again one of the Knights of Seiros. Perhaps we'll have the good fortune of seeing you two fight side by side.

speaker: Byleth
text: This isn't a game.

speaker: Byleth
text: We've fought together many times.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Oh, of course. I apologize for letting my childish whims get the better of me. In all honesty, I'm a bit jealous. My parents are no longer around.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Byleth
text: No longer around?

speaker: Dimitri
text: They...they died. Both of them. I'm all that remains of them now... Anyhow, I'm sorry to bore you with such things. I'd say it's nearly time for us to depart. Eh, Professor?

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, Teach. Glad you could make it. We've been waiting on you.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It seems the knights have our foes cornered. They are in Zanado–the Red Canyon.

speaker: Raphael
text: It's bandit time? That sounds like real knight work. Let's get to it!

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm itching to put my skills to the test as well. We have to win so Captain Jeralt can see how much I've learned!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I thought Jeralt wasn't coming with us. Either way, I'll give it everything I've got.

speaker: Marianne
text: Um... Even if I go, it's not like I'd be of any use...

speaker: Lysithea
text: That's enough of that. If we don't work together and give it our all, we are doomed to fail.

speaker: Hilda
text: You can be pretty intense sometimes, Lysithea. But I agree! Let's do our best!

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone is so eager.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder how we will do...

speaker: Claude
text: If we fight half as well as we chatter, we'll be fine. C'mon, Teach. Lead the way.

speaker: Sothis
text: So, we are taking children into battle, are we? I am not certain I will be able to sleep soundly after beholding something like that... I shall allow you to turn back the hands of time, but know this power is not infinite!

speaker: Edelgard
text: So this is the Red Canyon... A ruin of sorts by the look of it. Let's end this quickly. The thieves must have been driven back. Be careful, or the cornered mice might bite us.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Red Canyon... This is the first time I have ever been here. It's like walking through a ruin. Let's get this battle out of the way, Professor. The thieves must have already been driven back.

speaker: Claude
text: So this is the Red Canyon? Doesn't look red to me... Anyway, let's get things started, Teach. Looks like the thieves have been driven back. That's what we last heard, so no surprise there.

speaker: Kostas
text: The knights chased us all the way here?!

speaker: Thief
text: Chief, let's get out of here! There's no way we can win against them!

speaker: Kostas
text: Shut your dumb mouth! Where would we go at this point? You can't be a thief if you fear death!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor...I hear there's a back road to the west. Why don't we split up and attack from both the west and the front? If we advance tactfully, we can attack our enemy from both sides. I leave the rest to you. Regardless, we must cross the bridge first.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Regrettable...but there was no other way.

speaker: Hubert
text: Allow me to clean this up for you, Lady Edelgard.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: These ruffians are no match for a noble like me!

speaker: Linhardt
text: I...I killed them. What have I done? The blood...

speaker: Caspar
text: Are all real battles this exciting? Come on, let's get on to the next one!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I don't care if they're stealing! Can I go home?!

speaker: Dorothea
text: So, is making us experience a real battle part of the church's teachings?

speaker: Petra
text: People and beasts are as one. Calm your heart, and do not be worried about this killing.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you for leading us, Professor. Though I suppose there was no way we could lose to a familiar foe. In any case, something about this canyon feels...inexplicably strange.

speaker: Dimitri
text: According to our information, there is a back road to the west. Let's split up and approach from the west and the front. If we advance cleverly, we attack from both sides and gain the advantage. I'll leave the rest to you, Professor. But before all else, we'll need to cross the bridge.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I know they are just thieves, but this never gets easier for me…

speaker: Felix
text: Finished already? I was hoping for more of a challenge.

speaker: Ashe
text: If I’d hesitated… that would’ve been me.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I had to do it. Don’t hate me, please.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I can’t relax here. We need to prepare for our next battle!

speaker: Annette
text: I did it! See? I’m a great fighter!

speaker: Mercedes
text: I hope the goddess blesses them to rest in peace…

speaker: Dedue
text: Still whole and sound, I hope…

speaker: Dimitri
text: We have defeated the thieves. We'll follow the knights' instructions for what to do next. You led us well, Professor.

speaker: Claude
text: I hear there's a back road to the west. How about we split up and attack from there and from the front? We may be able to corner the enemy by approaching from both sides. In any case, we need to cross the bridge first. I'll leave the details to you, Teach.

speaker: Claude
text: We were taken by surprise last time, but... I guess this is what we can expect when battling thieves.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It is a noble's duty to guard the welfare of the people. Nothing personal

speaker: Hilda
text: I was planning to just sit back and watch. But hey, I got one!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I'm sorry... I didn't have a choice.

speaker: Raphael
text: This is my first real fight. I guess I'm pretty strong!

speaker: Lysithea
text: A precious opportunity to test my own strength. I won't make waste of your deaths.

speaker: Marianne
text: Please forgive me, Goddess...and save their souls...

speaker: Leonie
text: This is what I've trained for!

speaker: Claude
text: Those thieves ran out of luck when they entered this canyon. They never had a chance. Your leadership was amazing, Teach. Let's leave the rest of the work to the knights.

speaker: Thief
text: We stole this treasure! It's all ours! There's not way we're gonna give it up to some knights!

speaker: Kostas
text: Damn, they're coming from the west too! I can't stand these brats!

speaker: Kostas
text: Sending these brats instead of the knights means they've underestimated me! Big mistake!

speaker: Kostas
text: I should have never listened to that idiot... What a mistake...

speaker: Kostas
text: Y-you're... It can't be! The mercenary from before? So what, now you're pals with the knights? I'll kill you and your pesky brats!

speaker: Kostas
text: Spoiled little noble! Just die like a good little rich kid!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Do you really think being born a commoner gives you the right to kill? Despicable.

speaker: Kostas
text: Spoiled little noble! Just die like a good little rich kid!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Unfortunately for you, I will not oblige. You will regret all that you have done.

speaker: Kostas
text: Spoiled little noble! Just die like a good little rich kid!

speaker: Claude
text: Being noble has nothing to do with who you are as a person or how hard your life is. Your logic is illogical!

speaker: Byleth
text: I remember this being a peaceful place...

speaker: Byleth
text: Since when has it been called the Red Canyon...

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmm... I wonder why it is that you recall this place.  You must be weak of heart. Each time I speak, it scares you so.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Sothis
text: Although the battle is at an end, do not feel too at ease.

speaker: Byleth
text: You surprised me.

speaker: Sothis
text: Although the battle's at an end, do not feel too at ease.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not scared.

speaker: Sothis
text: Do you think you can lie to me? It saddens me to know you wish to hide such things from me.

speaker: Sothis
text: Well, anyhow... I am quite fascinated by this place. As far as I can tell, this is your first time here...

speaker: Byleth
text: Still, it feels familiar.

speaker: Sothis
text: How very odd. I wonder if somehow, my memories have... Hmm.

speaker: Byleth
text: Have you been here before, Sothis?

speaker: Sothis
text: Here? I daresay it would be impossible to have forgotten such as place as this.

speaker: Sothis
text: I must admit I am unsure. Beyond the name and this strange feeling of familiarity, I can't seem to remember anything about this place. And yet...a great depth of emotion is tied to that sense of familiarity. Like joy and sorrow. Pain and love. And all things in between... If I was somehow here before, I wonder what took place...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor? I was wondering where you were... It's about time we headed back to the monastery.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor? We should return to the monastery soon. We're all ready for the journey.

speaker: Claude
text: Teach? What are you doing here? We should get back to the academy.

speaker: Sothis
text: It is time to depart. But know that time reveals all things. One day, I will remember that which I have lost... Oh, by the way. It seems you've earned my gratitude. The thieves who came here are no more.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why are you grateful?

speaker: Byleth
text: Why are you...

speaker: Sothis
text: I am not sure myself, yet I am grateful all the same. In any case... You must become accustomed to my voice! If you fall down with shock each time I speak, that just won't do.

speaker: Sothis
text: Oh... You think you're standing strong? Of course you are! It was a jest.

speaker: Edelgard
text: On our way out, I had the chance to observe the Red Canyon... Did you notice anything, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Oh, I suppose it was only me, then.

speaker: Byleth
text: I did.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Of course. I expected as much.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The area was covered in ruins, each more curious than the last. They did not match the architectural style of any era or culture within the Empire. Or across all of Fódlan, for that matter. That can only mean one thing... The valley's civilization must have flourished and fallen in the distant past, long before the Empire was established. Who do you think lived there?

speaker: Byleth
text: Our ancestors.

speaker: Byleth
text: A culture long since perished.

speaker: Byleth
text: Subterranean beings.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Heh, it's possible they weren't even human.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hmm, perhaps their remnants still influence this world...

speaker: Dimitri
text: We're finally back. I'll leave the report to Lady Rhea in your hands, Professor.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Huh... Edelgard.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Does the Black Eagle House have a mission to see to? Remember–on a real battlefield, one can never tell what's to come. You can never dismiss the possibility of a worst case scenario. Take care, Edelgard.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's no need to state the obvious, Dimitri. But tell me... Why the concern? Perhaps you doubt my abilities? If so, your lack of insight is disappointing.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That's...not what I meant. If I've offended you, I hope you'll accept my apology.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Don't worry about it. Professor, we must hurry. Everyone's waiting on you.

speaker: Manuela
text: I suppose I should be off too. Try not to let her get to you, Dimitri. I promise you, there's no need for concern.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hmm...

speaker: Byleth
text: Why are you so worried?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I'll tell you all about it...some other time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Puppy love?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hahaha! Now, that's a lark. I had no idea you had a sense of humor, Professor. I'll tell you all about it...some other time.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, Teach. On the way back, you seemed transfixed by the canyon. Did something happen there?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's nothing

speaker: Claude
text: Nice try, but you can't get anything past me. You saw something...or felt something. I'm sure of it. But hey, if you don't want to share, that's fine by me. Everyone has their secrets.

speaker: Byleth
text: Actually...

speaker: Claude
text: It seemed familiar to you? Huh. Can't say the same. Maybe it's a memory from when you were a child. Or from a past life. Anyway, if you can't remember, I guess there isn't really much more to be said.

speaker: Claude
text: Although, I'll admit, there is something about that canyon that has me captivated as well. How did Zanado come to be called the Red Canyon? Nothing there...was actually red...

speaker: Rhea
text: So, you have safely disposed of those bandits. I pray that their souls find salvation. But why did they target the students to begin with? We must further investigate the true cause of all that took place. Until we know more, I ask that you support the students and relieve them of any unnecessary worry.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Byleth
text: I will do all that I can.

speaker: Rhea
text: Good. I have high expectations for you. By the way, how was your time in Zanado? Legend has it, in ancient times, a goddess alighted upon this world in that very canyon. For a goddess from heavens, Zanado could only have been a temporary haven.

speaker: Byleth
text: A goddess?

speaker: Byleth
text: A temporary haven?

speaker: Rhea
text: Long ago, the divine Seiros received a revelation from the goddess. A gift, to help the lost. The goddess is always watching over Fódlan from her kingdom above. However, in ancient times, the goddess graced this world with her presence and offered salvation to the people here. She is the mother of all life, the arbiter of every soul.

speaker: Byleth
text: I didn't know.

speaker: Byleth
text: My father never told me.

speaker: Rhea
text: I see. During your time here, I pray that you come to devote yourself to the teachings of Seiros.

speaker: Seteth
text: Uh...Lady Rhea, I am sorry to interrupt. There is something I must ask about in regard to those bandits...

speaker: Rhea
text: As you wish. We shall continue our discussion when next we meet.

speaker: Sothis
text: A goddess... I have no memory of her. But then... I have no memory at all! Oh, how bothersome! It is as though I know...and yet I don't. Perhaps Zanado was my home back when the goddess walked the land. If so... What does that make me now? A ghost?

speaker: Byleth
text: That must be it.

speaker: Sothis
text: Are you simple?! That's impossible! I am most certainly alive.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Sothis
text: Hmm... No. That cannot be. I am most certainly alive.

speaker: Sothis
text: Of course, we also have the mystery of why I'm here with you. Is it somehow connected? Perhaps some past regret is stopping me from moving on, and now I'm forced to stay with you instead... No, that's not it! I can't believe in such a meaningless existence! I... I...

speaker: Rhea
text: I have a new mission for you, Professor. I would like for you to take your students into Kingdom territory to eliminate some thieves.

speaker: Seteth
text: They stole a Hero's Relic from House Gautier of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus–the Lance of Ruin. Their leader's name is Miklan. He is apparently a disowned son of House Gautier.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why was he disowned?

speaker: Seteth
text: I believe it had something to do with his lack of a Crest. Such happenings are fairly common within the Kingdom.

speaker: Rhea
text: The Crestless cannot harness the goddess's power, even if they possess a Relic. Nonetheless, they are still capable of simply wielding those weapons.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why must the church eliminate him?

speaker: Seteth
text: This skirmish involves a holy Relic, and is therefore more than a single noble is capable of resolving.

speaker: Seteth
text: The Heroes' Relics are immensely powerful weapons. We must meet this threat with adequate force. Unfortunately, most of the Knights of Seiros are away from the monastery purging the apostates of the Western Church. So we are entrusting you with this mission. After all, you wield the Sword of the Creator, which is more than capable of opposing any Relic.

speaker: Rhea
text: The Sword of the Creator is a powerful weapon, well beyond the other Relics. You have nothing to fear. However, to ensure that no harm comes to the students, we will also send the monastery's most skilled individuals to aid you.

speaker: Seteth
text: I must remind you that you are expected to conduct yourself in a manner befitting the wielder of that holy sword. Also, you should know that Professor Hanneman has been looking for you. That is all.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, I heard about our mission for this month. A thief with a Hero's Relic is worrisome, but with you at our side, I'm certain we can handle him. After all, you have the Sword of the Creator. It was allegedly wielded by Nemesis, the King of Liberation. If the legends are true, you hold the power to stand against entire armies. A band of thieves should be nothing. Even the most elite Imperial forces or the Knights of Seiros could not hope to defeat you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why does it matter?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm just marveling at the potential. Besides, your power does not lie solely in the Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Byleth
text: It would never come to that.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Is that so? Even if those forces were to hurt someone precious to you? Can you say with full confidence that you would not turn your sword on them if that were to happen? You know, your power does not lie solely in the Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You are stronger and more terrifying than you realize. Professor... When we leave the monastery, will you still think of yourself as my teacher?

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Byleth
text: If we left the monastery?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Never mind. I'm being thoughtless with my words. For now, let's just focus on the problem at hand.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I heard about our mission for this month. So... We are to eradicate thieves in Kingdom territory. I'm sorry for dragging into the Kingdom's petty squabbles. This should not be your burden to bear, but my own...

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm happy to help.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's just a job.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Thank you, Professor. Hearing you say that puts my mind at ease.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hm?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Your Highness? Ah, it's been ages!

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's been a long time! Two years, if I'm not mistaken.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Indeed, Your Highness. You've grown so much in those years. I hardly recognize you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Who's this?

speaker: Byleth
text: A friend of yours?

speaker: Dimitri
text: This is Rodrigue, an old friend of my father's. I believe I've mentioned him, if you recall. When my father died four years ago, he looked after me as though I were his own son.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: You flatter me, Your Highness. It was my honor to care for such a fine, young man. It's nice to finally meet you, Professor. My son, Felix, has mentioned you on occasion.

speaker: Dimitri
text: What brings you to the monastery, Rodrigue? Is it the thieves plaguing the Kingdom?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I'm afraid so. This is not merely a problem for House Gautier, but for everyone. The thieves have set up their headquarters in Fraldarius territory, and are mercilessly pillaging the villages of that area. You have our full support in stopping those dastards. I thank you for your help, both of you.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, Teach. I gotta say, I never would've guessed you were a descendant of the King of Liberation. You didn't forget, did you? That story I told you about a Relic that could cut a mountain in half? That Relic was the Sword of the Creator! The very same used by Nemesis, the King of Liberation.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not his descendant.

speaker: Claude
text: Don't be coy, Teach. The Sword of the Creator could only be wielded by Nemesis. If you can use it too, that can only mean you have that bloodline's Crest.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't understand.

speaker: Claude
text: Fine, keep your secrets. But just so you know, "I don't understand" isn't gonna cut it here at the monastery. Speaking of, Professor Hanneman has been looking for you. He probably wants to examine your Crest with those crazy instruments of his. Actually...sounds amusing. Maybe I'll tag along.

speaker: Judith
text: If it isn't my little Claude! What has you so worked up?

speaker: Claude
text: Judith?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Judith
text: That's Lady Judith to you, boy. I told you, until you're in charge, I expect you to address me with all due respect. Anyway, I'm here to retrieve you. Duke Riegan's condition has taken a turn for the worse.

speaker: Claude
text: Are you saying the old man's on his death bed?

speaker: Judith
text: No, it's not that bad. But in the state he's in, he won't be able to participate in the next roundtable conference. He wants you to go in his stead. I volunteered to play the messenger.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, thanks for that. Oh, and Teach, this is Judith. Also known as the Hero of House Daphnel.

speaker: Judith
text: So you're little Claude's teacher, are you? How much trouble has he been giving you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Plenty.

speaker: Byleth
text: Not too much.

speaker: Claude
text: If her nickname didn't give it away, you should know that Judith...er, Lady Judith is the leader of the famous House Daphnel of the Leicester Alliance. She used to be a big deal at the roundtable conferences, but it seems of late she's been reduced to a mere–

speaker: Judith
text: You had better shut that mouth before I put my boot in it, you tactless nuisance! Now come on. Let's get going. Sorry, Professor, but I need to borrow the boy for a bit.

speaker: Claude
text: I suppose we'll have to finish our chat later. Sorry, Teach. But don't you worry. I'll be back in time for our next mission. All right, Judith. Let's get going.

speaker: Judith
text: It's Lady... Ah, I suppose you are the active leader for the time being. Fair enough, boy. Fair enough.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Good of you to come, Professor. I've heard much about you lately. Specifically, that you were able to awaken the Sword of the Creator's power. Thusly, it seems the true nature of your Crest has been uncovered. I had, of course, seen your Crest before. However, at first, I failed to recognize its true nature. Eventually, it dawned on me that what is visible is perhaps merely a small part of a greater whole. In other words, your Crest is too significant to be detected when using normal instruments. After this discovery, I began researching Crests that might fit that description, which allowed for a temporary hypothesis. However, I could not be certain. The Crest my conclusions led me to was far too unusual. A Crest thought to have disappeared in this world in the millennium since the fall of Nemesis, the King of Liberation. The Crest of Flames. That is what you possess.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Crest of Flames...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Your ability to wield the Sword of the Creator has unequivocally proven my hypothesis. A legendary power, dormant since time immemorial, and now resurrected... There can be no doubt that this ancient power resides within you.

speaker: Sothis
text: A stone? A stone... I do not understand. Yet as I think of it, the pounding in my chest grows faster still. But is that me...or is it you? Hmm...

speaker: Edelgard
text: For a Hero's Relic to be stolen... It's unheard of.

speaker: Hubert
text: And just last month, the Sword of the Creator was almost stolen too.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Also quite unheard of. What imprudence.

speaker: Hubert
text: For House Gautier to invite us on to their land, they must be desperate. But at least we'll have the stalwart knights ready to stand around and watch us do all the work.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Say, I hear that a Knight of Seiros named Gilbert will be joining us for our mission this moon. He is skilled, which is surely a boon for us. Still... That was not very thoughtful of Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you know him?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ahh, well... No, I do not. Not really. All I will say is that we have trained together a few times in the past.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you have history with him?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No... It's nothing. In any case, you should at least introduce yourself to him before we depart.

speaker: Dimitri
text: House Gautier is Sylvain's home. It would be nice if you could check on him as well.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I am sorry that the Kingdom's unrest did not stop with Lord Lonato... Professor... The Heroes' Relics are incredibly powerful. Please be on your guard.

speaker: Claude
text: Oof. This wasn't the first time I've taken part in an Alliance roundtable conference, but it was still exhausting. There's not enough cooperation in that group, especially from Lorenz's father. But at least my grandfather was surprisingly alert. Judging by that, I'd say he's got at least five more years in him.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, Teach. I hear you were able to use the Sword of the Creator. That means... What does that mean? Could it mean that you're a descendant of Nemesis, the King of Liberation?!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The coffin of Seiros in the Holy Mausoleum should have held her remains. Instead, they say, it held the Sword of the Creator. What could it mean?

speaker: Linhardt
text: Swinging a sword about in the Holy Mausoleum? The potential for damage is too great to imagine. I sincerely hope the saints' coffins were not damaged.

speaker: Byleth
text: They didn't.

speaker: Byleth
text: One might've been scratched.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Were you using magic? I've heard you weren't, but– Ugh! It's torture not being able to go inside the Holy Mausoleum for an entire year.

speaker: Linhardt
text: You and your class were at that fight in the Holy Mausoleum, right? I sincerely hope the holy artifacts are unscathed. I admit I wish I could've been there to see it all, even if it does make me queasy. But I was there too early. I'd gone first thing in the morning. At noon, one of the monks chased me out saying I'd been there too long. Who were they to decide when I've been somewhere too long?

speaker: Caspar
text: I heard a relic was stolen. If this had something to do with a family conflict, I don't think I could choose a side.

speaker: Byleth
text: Even if there's a clear guilty party?

speaker: Caspar
text: I think I'd be a pretty good judge of that!

speaker: Byleth
text: We can't allow a Hero's Relic to be stolen.

speaker: Caspar
text: What if it's some kind of powerful weapon? I want one too!

speaker: Caspar
text: I know Relics aren't easy to come by, but I'd still like to get my hands on one...

speaker: Caspar
text: I'm gonna keep training until I can beat you!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I'm not secretly eating cake!

speaker: Byleth
text: I can sense it.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Hmm... OK, what's Bernie doing right now? Oh, fine. You got me. But keep it a secret, all right?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll take your word for it.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: You're getting pretty good at talking through the door, Professor!

speaker: Dorothea
text: So, you have a Crest too, eh, Professor? Does that mean you're descended from nobility? You've certainly got the look for it... I sure do wish there were more nobles like you, Professor. A teacher, a mercenary, and so very mysterious... How could a girl ever get enough?

speaker: Petra
text: I have never had goings to the Kingdom's north. I hear the people of north are cold and have much loneliness. Professor, I hear you have had work...have worked as a mercenary in the Kingdom. Did you find joy in this? You cannot remember? Is that having possibility? I have amazement...

speaker: Dedue
text: I know Lord Rodrigue. He paid repeated visits to His Highness after the previous king was killed.

speaker: Dedue
text: The Western Church. The Central Church. They believe in the same goddess, but oppose one another. Fódlan is a complicated place.

speaker: Felix
text: Have you seen a man who looks like me? He's middle-aged and relatively tall.

speaker: Byleth
text: I have.

speaker: Byleth
text: I have not.

speaker: Felix
text: If you get the chance, tell him I've gone out. OK?

speaker: Felix
