text: Think of it! The Sword of the Creator, belonging to the ancient King Nemesis. You have to master it as soon as you can. I can't wait to face off against such a legendary weapon!

speaker: Ashe
text: So the whole plan to attack the monastery was some plot devised by the Western Church? That means they used Lonato. What right do they have to drag a good man like that into their schemes?!

speaker: Ashe
text: There's going to be a big investigation into the Western Church soon. I wish I could be a part of it. I want to hear for myself why Lonato had to die.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I'm so sorry my older brother is causing you all this hassle, Professor. Don't misunderstand, I always thought he was a piece of garbage, but I never thought he'd steal the Relic. I can't wait to see his face when he realizes I'm in the group that was sent to take him down.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I can't believe my own brother is the leader of the bandits. House Gautier is my true home…and his. Please, Professor. He really is one of the worst people I've ever known, but we still… We share the same blood. We're still family.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Isn't it strange? Saint Seiros's body was missing from her coffin, but they found a sword in its place... Do you think she moved from her coffin and left the sword behind?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Professor! You looked like a natural wielding the Sword of the Creator! It's strange though, isn't it? The last owner of the sword was Nemesis, but I thought he didn't have any descendants…

speaker: Annette
text: Hey, Professor? Did you happen to see that man I was looking for earlier? I just spotted him by the dining hall, but then he ran away!

speaker: Byleth
text: Who is he to you?

speaker: Annette
text: He... To be honest, he's my father. He's using a different name now, but there's no mistaking it. It's him. I know it is!

speaker: Byleth
text: I might have seen him.

speaker: Annette
text: Oh? You saw him by the entrance to the monastery? Thank you, Professor!

speaker: Annette
text: Father... I've found you at last!

speaker: Annette
text: Professor! If you're heading to the Kingdom, I would recommend taking a coat. It's chilly, even at this time of year. It also rains a fair bit. Don't get caught out there without protection, or you're sure to catch a cold!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Wow, Lord Rodrigue in the flesh... What is Felix doing? This is such a rare opportunity for him to see his family...

speaker: Ingrid
text: Professor, please leave Sylvain alone for the time being. The thing is, the bandits' leader who stole the Relic...is Sylvain's disinherited older brother.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I have heard that someone from House Gautier, one of the Kingdom of Faerghus's noble families, is causing some sort of commotion. What a complete disgrace to the nobility.

speaker: Raphael
text: Hey, Professor. Don't you think everyone's making too big a fuss over these Crests or Heroes' Relics or whatever they're called? How important can that stuff really be?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's very important.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure.

speaker: Raphael
text: Personally, I don't even care that I don't have a Crest. I'll take muscles over Crests any day. Heck, I'll take muscles over a hot meal! Actually...

speaker: Ignatz
text: Don't you think Professor Hanneman's been acting a bit...strange? Maybe he's made some kind of big discovery.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Is it true that Lady Rhea entrusted the Sword of the Creator to you? I can hardly even fathom you being capable of wielding something of such power. Just who are you, anyway?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Aristocrats are fools–-allowing their lives to be dictated by their Crests. Though...I suppose I am much the same in that regard...

speaker: Marianne
text: Some people are unhappy because they don't have the Crest they want... And some are unhappy because they have a Crest they never asked for.

speaker: Hilda
text: I thought school life would be peaceful and quiet, with a sprinkle of drama to keep things interesting. But since you arrived, it's been one thing after another. Is that just a coincidence, I wonder?

speaker: Byleth
text: I believe so.

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, I was just kidding! Anyway, as I said before, I do like having a little drama in my life.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe. Maybe not.

speaker: Hilda
text: What do you mean? I don't like the way you said that. Stop trying to spook me!

speaker: Leonie
text: Captain Jeralt was all furrowed brow earlier. Do you know what's got him so concerned? If there's a problem, I want to help any way I can.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Leonie
text: OK. I doubt there's anything I can do for him, but I figured I'd ask anyway.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why don't you ask him yourself?

speaker: Leonie
text: I did, but he just dodged the question. Still, it's worrying to see him like that.

speaker: Rhea
text: You must be rather bewildered by the power that was hidden within. However, know that I believe in you. I have no doubt that you will use that power justly. You will most certainly fulfill the grand destiny that the goddess has seen fit to grant you.

speaker: Seteth
text: Ah, Professor. Jeralt was looking for you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Where is he?

speaker: Seteth
text: It seems he has gone off somewhere. If he is not in his room, then surely someone has seen him. Ask around.

speaker: Seteth
text: How are you managing the Sword of the Creator? No problems? I hope you have not left it lying somewhere unattended or anything foolish like that.

speaker: Byleth
text: No problems.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not quite used to it yet.

speaker: Seteth
text: You will need the sword's power on your next mission. I trust you will handle it without much issue.

speaker: Flayn
text: Why is that fish so...still? Wait-–is it swimming sideways?! Perhaps... Perhaps it is resigned to its woeful fate of being plucked from the water and eaten... Ah, Professor. You are so outgoing with all of the students. I would like to have more opportunities to connect with you, though I am certain my brother would disapprove.

speaker: Catherine
text: You acquitted yourself honorably last month. To think they'd go into the Holy Mausoleum and assault the Goddess Tower... I cannot imagine the Western Church is acting on its own. Someone must have been helping them. As for the masked knight who escaped, his days are numbered. I hope we find him soon, so I can kill him myself.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Hail, Professor. If I may introduce myself, I am Gilbert. My life has been spent as a dedicated knight. I am to accompany you on your assignment. I may have slowed a step in recent years, but I pledge to you the full extent of my abilities.

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't you too formal?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I beg your pardon, but such is my nature.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Gilbert
text: No, Professor. The pleasure is all mine, I assure you.

speaker: Jeritza
text: Mercedes... Her face looks...familiar...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Oh my...the Crest of Flames? Could it really... Yes, the actual Crest of Flames! No, that is quite enough. I should compose myself. I must remain objective in my research. Objective. Professional.

speaker: Byleth
text: Excitement is understandable.

speaker: Byleth
text: I respect your self control.

speaker: Hanneman
text: The scandal with the Western Church troubles me. We cannot afford to let ourselves be swept along, and yet...

speaker: Manuela
text: It's awful, just awful what happened with the Rite of Rebirth. The infirmary... Well, it was a mess. Things are finally calm again, and so I've come here to unwind. Let me tell you, I put all of my knowledge to use keeping those kids alive. Still, the truth of it is that when someone faces death for the first time...well, they figure out who they are. They learn if they can do it again. We can't lose them, Professor. Not to battle, or to cowardice. If you can keep them going, then I will too.

speaker: Byleth
text: I will protect them.

speaker: Byleth
text: I will try my best.

speaker: Tomas
text: The head of the Western Church holds the title of bishop. That's not as distinguished as an archbishop such as Lady Rhea, but it still comes with a fair amount of authority. If someone in that position plotted an assassin, I cannot help but think it must have been instigated by some outside force. There are bishops in the Eastern Church as well, but to speak frankly, they do not have much impact. They are under the influence of both the archbishop and the Leicester Alliance, so their ability to voice grievances is quite limited.

speaker: Cyril
text: I hear about the things you did. I'm so glad Lady Rhea's safe. I figure you're a great person after all, Professor.

speaker: Anna
text: I've been hearing a lot about you lately. Word on the street is you wield some amazing sword. If you ever want to sell it to me, I'd pay top G! Just kidding. Sorta. It's, uh, not for sale, is it?

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Professor. Have you seen my son, perchance? I have need of him.

speaker: Byleth
text: He went out.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Is that so? That is too bad.

speaker: Byleth
text: I believe he's in his quarters.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Is that so? Thank you, Professor.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I must ask him not to distract you, Professor, nor His Highness from the matter at hand.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I am Rodrigue Achille Fraldarius. I bear the great honor of serving as a lord in the Kingdom of Faerghus. I have come in Margrave Gautier's stead to retrieve their stolen Relic. However... As I hear it, a group of students is to attend to this matter. I sincerely hope no harm comes to any of them.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Oh! Come to think of it, last month there was something to report, wasn't there? Thanks to you, I hear that everything was resolved. I never realized that bandits had entered... I'm not a great guard after all, am I? I hope you will forgive me one day.

speaker: Edelgard
text: This weather is unfortunate. Those villagers were right when they said a storm was brewing. But they were more afraid of an attack than they were of the storm. Let's end this quickly.

speaker: Hubert
text: The thieves have taken Conand Tower as their base... There it is in the distance.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Miklan must be more skilled than your average thief to have overtaken a place like that.

speaker: Gilbert
text: This area was the site of a massive battle several hundred years ago. That's when invasions from the north were at their peak. Back then, this tower was built for both surveillance and defense. It will be difficult to seize it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You know your history, Gilbert. If I recall correctly, you're from the Kingdom aren't you?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I left my home long ago. If you have any questions about the mission, I'd be happy to answer them.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you know about House Gautier?

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you know about the leader of the thieves?

speaker: Gilbert
text: House Gautier has always placed great importance on whether or not someone bears a Crest. Margrave Gautier has two sons. A Crest never manifested for his eldest. It's not hard to imagine why he left and wound up in this sort of life.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's no reason that Crests should have the power to dictate someone's destiny. Don't you agree, Gilbert? He was just another victim of cruel fate. Forsaken by the goddess, who now demands his execution.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It should be in our sights soon, Professor. The abandoned tower those thieves are using as a base... Conand Tower.

speaker: Gilbert
text: This area was the site of a massive battle several hundred years ago. That's when invasions from the north were at their peak. Back then, this tower was built for both surveillance and defense. It will be difficult to seize it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You're very well informed, Gilbert. Please, tell us more.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Well, I... Ah. You're joking.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Professor. Did you see the local villages? They were in rough shape, no doubt because of the thief attacks. They're not going to make it through the winter in that condition. If the thieves had taken up pillaging in order to survive, that would be deplorable...but understandable. But this... This is something else entirely. It looks as though they destroyed those villages purely for pleasure. No matter what their reasons may be, that sort of behavior cannot be allowed. Ever.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Don't bother losing your head over those lowlifes, Your Highness. It's wasted effort.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Sylvain... The thieves' leader...the one who stole the Relic. Word has it he's your older brother. I know he's been disowned, but...

speaker: Sylvain
text: He is no longer a member of House Gautier...or my brother. He's nothing more than a common thief.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Are you sure about that? It would be understandable to find this situation...well, regrettable, to say the least.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Regrets? Heh, you must be joking. You know we're far past the point of regret. And it always falls on the younger brother to clean up the mistakes of their elders, doesn't it?

speaker: Dimitri
text: This rain threatens a coming storm. We must hurry and begin our war council before the heavens let loose.

speaker: Claude
text: Say, Teach. This must be the tower, don't you think? Even for a tower, it's pretty.. er, towering.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's more like a fortress.

speaker: Byleth
text: It would prove difficult to attack.

speaker: Claude
text: It's a remnant of ancient wars... These thieves certainly found themselves a great place to nest. I hear their leader, Miklan, is a former noble. It makes sense he would already know about this place.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Several hundred years ago, this was an important stronghold for diffusing invasions from the north. Back then, this tower was built for both surveillance and defense. It will be difficult to seize it.

speaker: Claude
text: Gilbert, isn't it? You hail from the Kingdom, right? No wonder you're so knowledgeable. While we're chatting so amicably... Do you mind if I ask some questions?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I don't mind. If I can answer them, I will.

speaker: Claude
text: Have you ever seen the Lance of Ruin?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I have. A long time ago. It was an impressive, if not eerily ominous, weapon to behold. According to Margrave Gautier, Miklan has used the lance to turn the tables on his pursuers.

speaker: Claude
text: Is that right? Then those without a Crest can use it as well... Interesting. As far as I knew, that wasn't possible. And then we have the mythical Sword of the Creator, which can't be used by anyone except Teach, Crest or no Crest. Maybe you're just that special, Teach. Or maybe there's something you're not telling us. Either way, I expect big things from you in this battle.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Claude
text: Ha! I love a good show of confidence. I'll do my best too. You can count on it.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm relying on you, Claude.

speaker: Claude
text: Are you now? Then why don't you hand over the Sword of the Creator for a bit? Then again, it would just be a heavy blade in my hands. There's no justice in this world, Teach.

speaker: Claude
text: Ugh, the rain is really coming down now. Let's finish this quickly.

speaker: Gilbert
text: The enemy is close by. We're almost to the top floor.

speaker: Edelgard
text: They have nowhere left to flee, so the situation is in our favor. All we have to do is chase then down.

speaker: Dimitri
text: They are merely thieves, but they have a Hero's Relic. Do not drop your guard.

speaker: Claude
text: Phew, why did we have to climb so high before a battle? At least it's better than fighting in heavy rain.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Don't hold back for my sake. My brother is going to pay for everything he's done.

speaker: Rogue
text: The captain's in trouble! Hurry up, you fools!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Enemies approach from the lower floor! Watch the rear flank!

speaker: Rogue
text: Here we go! Attack them from both sides!

speaker: Gilbert
text: It's an ambush!

speaker: Miklan
text: So, you think you can take the lance from me, huh? I'll kill you... I'll kill every last one of you!

speaker: Miklan
text: Why have you come, you Crest-bearing fool?

speaker: Sylvain
text: I'm here for the Lance of Ruin, Miklan. Hand it over. I don't want to humiliate you, but I will.

speaker: Miklan
text: Hmph! Hurry up and die already. If not for you... If it hadn't been for you...

speaker: Sylvain
text: Shut up! I'm so tired of hearing that. You've always blamed me for something that isn't my fault.

speaker: Miklan
text: Not bad for your kind... A bunch of spoiled rotten children.

speaker: Miklan
text: What the hell?!

speaker: Bandit
text: Damn! Look at that... I'm outta here!

speaker: Bandit
text: Hold on!

speaker: Bandit
text: No!

speaker: Black Beast
text: Graaaargh!

speaker: Sylvain
text: What the–Miklan?! Is that you?!

speaker: Sothis
text: That form... Oh my. Is this your first time fighting such a thing? Then listen well to what I say.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Such is the fate of one whose life is corrupted by a Crest Stone... How pitiable. The least we can do is put an end to his suffering.

speaker: Dimitri
text: So, this is the power of a Hero's Relic. To create such a sinister beast... It has gone too far. I fear all we can do now is put an end to it.

speaker: Claude
text: How awful...So the Heroes' Relics are hiding such a terrible power within. I can't even tell friend from foe anymore. I feel for him, but...the best we can do now is finish this quickly.

speaker: Sothis
text: An evil power has caused them to grow quite large. Their life force is beyond a mortal like yourself. You cannot win unless you fell them twice or even thrice!

speaker: Sothis
text: Even if you've cornered one, you cannot let your guard down! Those things are even worse when threatened.

speaker: Sothis
text: Can you see that barrier? It is surrounded by great power. You must break through to fight that thing. A strong attack or gambit might help to break through more quickly. If you can break the barrier, that power will have nowhere else to go, and that will likely cause confusions for that thing. It cannot counter while confused, which means that is the best time to attack!

speaker: Sothis
text: If you break down all of their barriers, not only will they be confused, they will not be able to move for a short while. Without the power flowing around them, they will not be able to restore their barriers. You might even be able to get something from them.

speaker: Sothis
text: They have such might that they will not fear you alone. But a battalion could prove useful on that front... Attack them with a gambit to draw their attention and force them to target you.

speaker: Sothis
text: Be on your guard when they have realized their full power! The damaged caused at times like that is not contained to just one spot. Once they have charged some power ups, their barriers will be restored. You really must pay close attention to those things! Distract them with a gambit, or just take them down before they can attack. In any case, think carefully before you act!

speaker: Sothis
text: But you should be conquering that thing instead of talking to me! If you're out of questions, get over there and fight!

speaker: Sylvain
text: What is that? It's like watching a bad dream come to life.

speaker: Black Beast
text: Graaaargh!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Goddess... The beast is gone, yet Miklan and the Lance remain.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It is done. Let's retrieve the lance and depart at once.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It's over... Let's retrieve the lance and leave this place.

speaker: Claude
text: We defeated him, somehow... Let's grab the lance and return to the monastery.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Miklan...my brother...

speaker: Sothis
text: That man... His form was changed. It was as though that lance was swallowing him whole. Upon that sight, it makes sense that your students were upset. I wonder if those Relics truly hide such power? Yet even still, that power seems familiar. That form as well... As one who wields the Sword of the Creator... Does that mean you possess that power too?

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor, you have returned. The goddess is indeed generous with her divine protection. I have already heard Gilbert's report about what happened. See to it that you keep what transpired at the tower to yourself. People would lose faith in the nobles should rumors spread of one using a Relic and transforming into a monster. All regions of Fódlan would fall into chaos. We must avoid that at all costs. Please ensure the students who accompanied you understand that as well. Have I made myself clear?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Byleth
text: Hm...

speaker: Rhea
text: His transformation into a Black Beast was nothing short of divine punishment from the goddess. Punishment for someone arrogant and foolish enough to use a Hero's Relic even though they were unworthy and unqualified.

speaker: Byleth
text: You knew?

speaker: Rhea
text: Of course. That is why we rushed to recover it. Sadly, we did not arrive in time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Will I share the same fate...

speaker: Rhea
text: If someone without a Crest were to wield the Relic you possess, they would likely meet the same fate as Miklan. You, however, have been chosen. You are worthy of wielding the Sword of the Creator, so there is no need to worry.

speaker: Rhea
text: The church will formally return the lance to House Gautier. If you would...

speaker: Byleth
text: As you wish.

speaker: Rhea
text: You have my gratitude. I can see that I was right to trust you with this. Please report back. I will tell you of your new mission for the coming moon at that time.

speaker: Byleth
text: I will not.

speaker: Rhea
text: What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ahem, excuse me.  Lady Rhea, I am overjoyed and beyond grateful to you for recovering the Relic of my family, House Gautier. Now, may I please have that lance? I have received direct approval from my father to take possession of it.

speaker: Rhea
text: As the next head of House Gautier, do you swear that you will never cause such a deplorable incident to transpire?

speaker: Sylvain
text: On my family's name...and on my brother's life, I swear it.

speaker: Rhea
text: Very well. However, I have one condition. You must never allow another to wield this lance. Your brother clearly demonstrated what fate awaits those who break that restriction.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yes. I...I will not soon forget.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I assume the archbishop was pleased with your performance. Did you return the Lance of Ruin?

speaker: Byleth
text: I returned it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: No need to lie, Professor. I saw Sylvain earlier. It was written all over his face.

speaker: Byleth
text: I did not return it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm glad. Sylvain must be overjoyed as well.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's no need to lie, Professor. No one could have expected you to disobey the archbishop.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I keep thinking about what Gilbert told us...

speaker: Byleth
text: About Miklan?

speaker: Byleth
text: About House Gautier?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes, Miklan was discarded by his family because he was born without a Crest. Eventually he became a masterful thief and gathered enough ruffians to capture a fortress. Right or wrong, he was a gifted leader. He could have been a great asset to Fódlan. What a waste. It's true that a Crest can increase your magical abilities and allow you to wield the full might of a Hero's Relic. But one cannot measure a leader's worth based solely on whether or not they bear a Crest. There are plenty of talented people in this world without one.

speaker: Byleth
text: I completely agree.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why is everyone obsessed with Crests?

speaker: Edelgard
text: People believe Crests are blessings from the goddess, that they're necessary to maintain order in Fódlan. But the people are wrong. Crests are to blame for this brutal, irrational world we live in. Their power is granted only to a select few, whom we elevate and allow to rule the world. Have you ever wondered if the only way to create a truly free world is to dispense with the goddess and the Crests? Do that, and people will have no choice but to rise and fall by their own merits.

speaker: Hubert
text: Lady Edelgard. I question whether you revealed too much to the professor.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Perhaps I did.

speaker: Hubert
text: It is true that our teacher possesses a rare talent. Even I cannot deny it. The ability to wield the Sword of the Creator is concerning...

speaker: Edelgard
text: I've already explained this to you. My power alone is insufficient. That's why I'm borrowing power from those people. If our teacher can wield it in my stead... I believe that would be for the best.

speaker: Hubert
text: It's a risk. A dangerous one. You leave me no choice but to take matters into my own hands. Please excuse me.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I can't hide from the truth. I can't do all that I must on my own. If all I can rely on is my own ambition, my path won't be easy. Is it so risky...to reach out my hand? Father... I swear I will not stop until I succeed. My regret. My grief. My whole life. I've thrown it all away...into the darkness...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Is your meeting over, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: You look troubled.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you weary?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I was just thinking about something. Professor... The possession of Relics and Crests has been highly valued in Faerghus since ancient times. It's far from uncommon for someone to lose their ability to lead their house because they don't bear a Crest. Just like Miklan. It happened to my uncle as well. The eldest child of the king, and yet he never ascended to the throne. All families whose bloodlines carry Crests of the 10 Elites are much the same. But House Gautier takes it a step further, and absolutely requires an heir who possesses a Crest.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why are they so obsessed with it?

speaker: Byleth
text: Why House Gautier in particular?

speaker: Dimitri
text: To that house, the power of Crests is a necessity, not a luxury. House Gautier holds the most northern territory in the Kingdom, and they have fought with the people to the north for many years. The head of that house is responsible for protecting that territory from fearsome invaders, whom they keep at bay with the power of Crests and Relics. In exchange for that responsibility, they are granted special privileges within the Kingdom.

speaker: Byleth
text: Their Crests grant them special privileges?

speaker: Dimitri
text: In a way. That said, ability cannot be measured by the possession of a Crest alone...

speaker: Byleth
text: Strength is strength, with or without a Crest.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I believe the same. Ability cannot be measured by the possession of a Crest alone.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I believe that Margrave Gautier was wrong to disinherit Miklan because he did not bear a Crest. Still, there is always a reason for why such customs stand the test of time. Imagine what this world would be like if no one placed any stock in Crests... Bloodlines that carry Crests would dwindle. The metaphorical blade used to oppose threats would eventually rest. This same argument has been made time and time again across the years. Both sides are at once right and wrong.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you believe, Dimitri?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I believe those with Crests and those without should acknowledge the others' strengths and learn to respect each other based on personal merits. And that doesn't apply only to Crests. The same holds true for lineage, race, faith, ideologies... If we could just accept each other and make mutual concessions, one step at a time... Perhaps... Who knows if that's even possible. Everyone has something that is unacceptable within them. I certainly do, and I'd wager you do as well. I wonder which is best, Professor... To cut away that which is unacceptable, or to find a way to accept it anyway...

speaker: Claude
text: Nice work, Teach. It's thanks to you that we successfully completed our mission. As for Miklan... I wonder if he really believed he could wield a Relic.

speaker: Byleth
text: Hard to say.

speaker: Claude
text: I bet he just wanted to get his hands on it, even though he knew he couldn't use it.

speaker: Byleth
text: I doubt it.

speaker: Claude
text: Agreed. He probably just wanted to get his hands on it, even though he knew it was futile.

speaker: Claude
text: Though I'm sure he wasn't counting on turning into a monster like that... I wonder if that monster represents another aspect of the Heroes' Relics. What a strange and terrifying power.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Byleth
text: It seems so.

speaker: Tomas
text: Stories of misfortune have followed the Heroes' Relics since ancient times.

speaker: Claude
text: Tomas! You've caught me by surprise. That's not easy to do. Though I suppose I should've expected to see our librarian in his library.

speaker: Tomas
text: I am sorry to intrude. I simply heard you speaking of the Heroes' Relics. I can tell you more about them, if you'd like. The story goes that Nemesis was corrupted by evil because of the Sword of the Creator. Other Heroes also lost themselves by continuing to use the Relics...transforming into Black Beasts with twisted souls. There used to be a great many records regarding the dark history of the Relics.

speaker: Claude
text: Used to be?

speaker: Tomas
text: They have been destroyed, across all of Fódlan. Stripped from their shelves, including those that resided at this very library.

speaker: Claude
text: You make it sound like the church is covering up the truth. But now that you mention it, Rhea was very specific about not wanting anyone to find out what happened at Conand Tower. Hey Tomas... why are you telling us all this?

speaker: Tomas
text: It seemed like you were searching for answers about the Relics. What is a librarian if not a guide in the search for knowledge. And not only have you been searching, but you have been doing so through the night. I would suggest you stop before the knights notice. And that is enough meddling for today. Please excuse me.

speaker: Claude
text: So I've been found out, have I? I suppose I do spend more time at the library than most students. But I won't stop. I can't afford to.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you after?

speaker: Claude
text: Teach... You don't really expect me to tell you something so personal like that, do you? Though, I wouldn't mind sharing if you were to tell me some of your secrets in exchange...

speaker: Edelgard
text: I can't let this exchange pass without comment... If you're sharing secrets, perhaps I can share one as well?

speaker: Claude
text: Are you sure you could survive that? I'd say you're the least likely to share secrets out of everyone at the academy.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Heh heh, coming from you, I'll take that as a compliment. After all, you're easily the student with the most secrets.

speaker: Claude
text: I'm afraid you overestimate me. My secrets don't amount to much. But back to Teach...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Don't try to change the subject, Claude. We're talking about secrets. Yours. Who is your father? And why did you appear so suddenly, as if from nowhere? Duke Riegan's eldest son died in an accident. Having tragically lost other family members as well, he was without an heir. The Alliance would undoubtedly have been shaken if House Riegan had lost its position of leadership. But then you showed up. Why did you return to House Riegan? What brought you to the monastery?

speaker: Byleth
text: I would like to hear this as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: He doesn't have have to answer to you.

speaker: Claude
text: Alas...to be surrounded by women as lovely as flowers, only to be pricked by their thorns.

speaker: Claude
text: My dream, in truth, is a selfless dream. But I require power to make it a reality. When I learned about the power of my Crest, I knew I had a chance. So I'm chasing that dream. To the bitter end, if need be. I came to this monastery because I thought I might find someone useful. Someone to help me on my path. So, what do you think? If you promise to help me achieve my dream no matter what, I'll promise to tell you anything.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I have my own dream to tend to. I pray that yours does not interfere with mine.

speaker: Claude
text: What about you, Teach?

speaker: Byleth
text: If it's a noble dream...

speaker: Byleth
text: That may be difficult.

speaker: Claude
text: I see. Well, now isn't the time to discuss this. You are still my Teach, after all.

speaker: Rhea
text: Professor, you have done well to complete such a difficult task. You have shown exceptional skill in leading your students. I am forever grateful for the safe return of the Hero's Relic. Just as I expected, you have mastered the Sword of the Creator. Now then, I shall tell you about your mission for the coming month...

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhe– Archbishop!

speaker: Rhea
text: Seteth, what troubles you?

speaker: Seteth
text: Flayn is missing! I cannot find her anywhere!  Professor, have you seen Flayn recently?

speaker: Byleth
text: I have not.

speaker: Seteth
text: I have searched everywhere! Where could she be?!

speaker: Byleth
text: Have you looked everywhere?

speaker: Seteth
text: I have searched every corner I can think of! I could not find her anywhere.

speaker: Seteth
text: She may be in danger! Oh no... No, no! What am I to do?!

speaker: Rhea
text: Calm yourself, Seteth. Professor, we shall continue our discussion another time.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Our mission this month is to patrol and set up defenses to stop the assassination plot.

speaker: Hubert
text: I wonder if an assassination attempt is truly the goal of our enemy...

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Edelgard
text: You must sense that something's off about all of this.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a distraction.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes, I think so too.

speaker: Edelgard
text: A barely concealed secret message, trying to distract us from whatever's really going on. Sloppy, to say the least. And while everyone is out searching for a phantom assassin, they'll be free to accomplish their true goal with ease.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The monastery houses many valuable weapons. Perhaps that is their aim?

speaker: Dorothea
text: I hear the monastery has a treasure vault too. Seems like the sort of place a foe would like some alone time in.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Garreg Mach is immense, and not just above ground but below as well. Perhaps their aim lies beneath the monastery...

speaker: Hubert
text: It seems to me that we should search the monastery for a clue as to what the enemy might be after. Of course, we must never underestimate the need for preparedness, in case a battle should ensue.

speaker: Shamir
text: A secret meeting, Professor? Oh, we haven't been introduced. I am Shamir.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Shamir is one of the Knights of Seiros. And this young man is-

speaker: Dimitri
text: So, our task for this moon is to patrol and guard the monastery, to help put a stop to that assassination plot. The knights will certainly have their hands full protecting Lady Rhea. Perhaps our enemy is counting on that...

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Highness, I am curious as to what you mean by that.

speaker: Byleth
text: I agree.

speaker: Dedue
text: Please, elaborate.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Why would Lord Lonato be carrying around a secret note with an assassination plot written on it? Isn't it possible he hoped to monopolize everyone's attention with this alleged plot...in order to distract from his true aim?

speaker: Annette
text: Maybe they're after the treasure vault. There's also lots of valuable stuff in the library and Professor Hanneman's quarters!

speaker: Felix
text: True. The monastery undoubtedly houses many weapons that rival even the Heroes' Relics.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Whatever their aim, we can't allow any harm to come to the ladies of the monastery. I mean, what would I do with my spare time?

speaker: Dedue
text: You mean to say we should search the monastery. Try to find what the enemy is truly after.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes. And we should be prepared to fight them as well, should it come to that. I wouldn't mind getting in some training, just in case.

speaker: Shamir
text: A secret meeting, Professor? Oh, we haven't been introduced. I am Shamir.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Shamir is one of the Knights of Seiros. And this young man here is–

speaker: Claude
text: OK... So our task this moon is to patrol and guard the monastery in support of the knights, who are busy trying to stop an assassination plot. Here's the thing. I don't think the bad guys are really trying to assassinate the archbishop.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Claude
text: Come on, Teach. Don't you think that "secret" note Lord Lonato was carrying around was just a little too obvious?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a distraction.

speaker: Claude
text: Precisely. That "secret note" with the assassination plot on it... There's just no way that was real.

speaker: Claude
text: People don't just carry around secret notes. Someone wanted us to find it.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Do you really think the assassination plot is just a distraction?

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, yeah. That makes complete sense. But then...what are they really after?

speaker: Claude
text: If I knew that, I wouldn't be so worried. Let's see... It probably involves somewhere that will be empty during the Rite of Rebirth, yeah?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Since the ceremony is at the Goddess Tower, it follows that everywhere else at the academy will be severely understaffed.

speaker: Leonie
text: Do you think they're after the church's donation money? I hear noble families tend to donate quite generously.

speaker: Raphael
text: My bet's on the dining hall. It's a treasure trove of delicious food. Makes me angry just thinking about them getting their grubby hands on it!

speaker: Hilda
text: Let's split up and look around! I'll keep an eye on the reception hall.

speaker: Claude
text: You should get in some training if you have the time, Hilda. There's a good chance we'll have to fight.

speaker: Hilda
text: Uh! Well, I'm not the only one who needs to train here! It's not right to single me out like that.

speaker: Shamir
text: A secret meeting, Professor? Oh, we haven't been introduced. I am Shamir.

speaker: Claude
text: Shamir is one of the Knights of Seiros. And that little go-getter there is–

speaker: Cyril
text: I work for Lady Rhea! And I'm Shamir's apprentice! Oh, the name's Cyril.

speaker: Byleth
text: You work for Rhea?

speaker: Cyril
text: Yep. I help Lady Rhea with all kinds of stuff.

speaker: Byleth
text: Shamir's apprentice?

speaker: Cyril
text: Yep. She's teaching me about the bow and the sword and all kinds of stuff.

speaker: Cyril
text: I've gotta protect Lady Rhea, so that's why I've gotta learn all I can from Shamir.

speaker: Shamir
text: Cyril adores Rhea. That aside, if you need anything, ask.

speaker: Sothis
text: A Hero's Relic...

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you know something?

speaker: Sothis
text: However could I know something? Still, it is heavy on my mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: It represents great power.

speaker: Sothis
text: Quite so.

speaker: Sothis
text: The stone within the sword... A glow of red... Hm? Oh, it is nothing.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Our enemy's true target... What could it be? The monastery has been around for nearly a millennium. It's only logical that there are secrets here. We'd better investigate. Would you mind asking around and seeing what you can dig up? Once you've uncovered some leads, we'll regroup.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We need more information. Is there anyone else you could talk to?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hmm... There's a place that the church values above all others. On the day of the rite, it will be open to the public. That will make it much easier than usual to access.

speaker: Byleth
text: The greenhouse?

speaker: Edelgard
text: You must be joking.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Holy Mausoleum?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Precisely.

speaker: Byleth
text: The dining hall?

speaker: Edelgard
text: You must be joking.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We can't know for certain, but it's a distinct possibility that the Holy Mausoleum is our enemy's target.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Oh, have you been tasked with guarding the monastery as well? Such a stir over a single letter...but I suppose the archbishop's safety is too important to risk.

speaker: Dimitri
text: If the enemy's aim lies elsewhere, we had better discern their true intent quickly. As I see it, our best option is to explore every inch of the monastery. We should also speak to everyone here. Let's plan to compare notes once you've got a lead.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Hmm. I'm afraid we'll need more information than that. Is there anyone else you could try speaking to?

speaker: Dimitri
text: So... There is something that the church values above all else. On the day of the rite, it will be open to the public. That will make gaining entry far easier than usual. You know the place of which I speak...

speaker: Byleth
text: The greenhouse?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Whatever would make you think that? This is no time for games, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Holy Mausoleum?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes, that is the most likely possibility.

speaker: Byleth
text: The dining hall?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Whatever would make you think that? This is no time for games, Professor.

speaker: Dimitri
text: We do not know their objective, but there is a good chance that our enemy is planning to target the Holy Mausoleum.

speaker: Dimitri
text: All this talk of assassination plots... It brings back dark memories I prefer to keep buried. I doubt there is any correlation, and yet... Ah, it is nothing. I am sorry for allowing my mind to wander. My focus should be solely on guarding the monastery right now.

speaker: Claude
text: To figure out our foe's intentions, we need information. Lot's of it. Or any, at the least. For now, try going around the monastery and looking for suspicious locations. You should also try chatting folks up to see if they know anything. Once we've got things narrowed down, let's meet up and compare notes.

speaker: Claude
text: Hmm... We still don't have enough to go on, Teach. Let's try looking around a little more.

speaker: Claude
text: Hmm. Something the church values above all else... And on the day of the rite, it'll be open to the public, making it easier than ever to get inside. That's gotta be it, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: The greenhouse?

speaker: Claude
text: That would be a resounding no.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Holy Mausoleum?

speaker: Claude
text: Bullseye.

speaker: Byleth
text: The dining hall?

speaker: Claude
text: That would be a resounding no.

speaker: Claude
text: We don't know the enemy's intentions, not yet. But our best bet is that their target will be the Holy Mausoleum.

speaker: Claude
text: There's been talk of an attempt on Rhea's life. We've been order to help the knights patrol. Could that possibly mean that Rhea isn't beloved by everyone the world over?

speaker: Hubert
text: Can you imagine the archbishop being murdered? I prefer not to consider such a gruesome scenario.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course not.

speaker: Hubert
text: Awfully calm, aren't you? I wonder what it takes to rile you up.

speaker: Byleth
text: Frightening thought.

speaker: Hubert
text: That easy to get under your skin, is it?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Hmm... Setting fire to the stables to distract everyone, to cause a commotion. It is the oldest trick in the book, but I cannot shake the thought that our enemies may attempt it... I will stand guard and watch over the stable...and the knights' horses. They are truly magnificent.

speaker: Linhardt
text: So sleepy... Too sleepy... I found an interesting book in the library. Got so caught up reading it I forgot to sleep... Interesting discovery though–the coffins of the Four Saints in the sanctum each have their Crests carved into them. I'll need to find a way down there to get a look.

speaker: Caspar
text: Oh. Hey, Professor. I was just reading this letter from my father. Do you know him? He's a pretty big deal in the Empire. He only writes to ask how my training's going, or how many monsters I've killed. Stuff like that.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Um... Hi. Right now is, um... Well, right now's OK I guess. If you, um, want to chat...a little.

speaker: Byleth
text: Didn't I see you in the dining hall last night?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Hey, I get hungry sometimes. Like anyone else! What? Eating at night is bad for you? There's no way that's true. Wait, really?

speaker: Dorothea
text: People die in every battle. And it can be by sword or spear or magic, but... But depending on who it is that died... Depending on who died, it's different.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's different if it's someone you know who was lost...

speaker: Dorothea
text: I hope nothing bad happens this month.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Is it true you got caught in the fighting? I'm so thankful you made it out alive. I don't know what we would do if we lost you...

speaker: Petra
text: In Brigid... assassinations are many. I have also been the targeted back in the past.

speaker: Byleth
text: How frightening.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm happy you survived.

speaker: Petra
text: The Goddess Tower has an entrance of narrowness. That is most good. The windows are not the most good though. A target of ease for snipers.

speaker: Petra
text: Fighting to stop a murdering is my specialness...no, my specialty. I will show my best work!

speaker: Dedue
text: The monks declined my offer of assistance. They said that no one from Duscur is to be trusted, especially now. Given the circumstances, I cannot fault them.

speaker: Felix
text: Sending an assassin to the monastery, hm? Hopefully it's someone worth crossing blades with.

speaker: Byleth
text: I hope so too.

speaker: Felix
text: It seems we're cut from the same cloth.

speaker: Byleth
text: I hope we can avoid bloodshed.

speaker: Felix
text: You're entitled to your opinion.

speaker: Felix
text: Lord Lonato's rebellion may have been quelled, but the unrest in Faerghus isn't dying down anytime soon. The boar prince should hurry up and claim the throne, rather than letting old customs hold him back.

speaker: Ashe
text: I can't stop thinking about Lonato... I'm sorry, Professor. I know this isn't the time, but... I just can't get past it.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's nothing to be done.

speaker: Byleth
text: Pull yourself together.

speaker: Ashe
text: Thank you. No matter what happens, I promise you I'll do my part. I checked on my brother and sister who were living in Castle Gaspard. Thankfully they're all right. I was worried because they're both so young, but the church in the castle town offered to take them in. That much, at least, is a big relief.

speaker: Sylvain
text: No classes on a festival day! I thought I'd get to spend all day relaxing in the company of some lovely ladies, but now this has happened. Hey, Professor, I know there's talk of an assassination attempt, but do you really think they'll do it on the day of the Rite of Rebirth? I feel like security would be looser some other time. Is there some reason why it has to happen on that day?

speaker: Mercedes
text: The monastery holds many treasures. Maybe the enemy is after one of those? Even so, the idea of stealing from the church is just horrible...

speaker: Annette
text: I bought the ingredients for making some sweet treats I can't wait to eats! Huh? Oh! I know it looks like I'm fooling around, but I'm not. I'm preparing for potential battle during my patrol by making sure I have plenty of food I can eat while walking. Smart, huh?

speaker: Byleth
text: Good thinking.

speaker: Annette
text: I know! Once they're ready, I promise to share some with you.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're making patrol sweets?

speaker: Annette
text: I just thought I'd be more alert if I had something sweet in my tummy. Oh, wait! Was it spicy food that you liked, Professor?

speaker: Annette
text: Have you heard? Rumor has it that death himself has been appearing in Garreg Mach. They say he appears every night and kidnaps folks. I wonder what happens to them…

speaker: Ingrid
text: Professor, while the investigation is important, don't forget to make time for your training. If we have to battle and cannot win, all will be lost. We don't know who our enemy is, so we must be prepared for anything.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Lady Rhea lifts the spirits of all the people of Fódlan. We cannot allow her to come to any harm.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Are we really just taking Claude's word for it? If so, I doubt anything will come of this. It is all probably just some sort of distasteful joke. I find it highly unlikely that anyone would be foolish enough to barge in here and cause a disturbance.

speaker: Lorenz
text: The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is the most significant ritual for the Church of Seiros. Could it be that someone has spread these rumors of an assassination plot merely with the intention to hinder the celebration?

speaker: Raphael
text: I bet the enemy's using this assassination nonsense just to sneak in and raid the pantry. What do you think, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: You may be right.

speaker: Raphael
text: Oh, I'm right all right. My animal instinct is telling me that the enemy is after our best meats.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Raphael
text: You don't think so? Then dinner's on you if it turns out I was right!

speaker: Ignatz
text: The monastery's so big. How can we narrow down the list of possible targets? The only places I can think of are the vault and the library, and… I guess that's it.

speaker: Ignatz
text: With the whole monastery preparing for the Goddess's Rite of Rebirth this month, it feels like everyone's a little on edge…

speaker: Lysithea
text: I don't know who to blame for all this commotion, but it's frankly a huge inconvenience. With everyone stuck on guard duty, our study and training time has been drastically reduced.

speaker: Byleth
text: Some things are more important than that.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Yes, yes, I understand that. But it doesn't change the fact that it's a royal pain.

speaker: Byleth
text: I agree--it's very inconvenient.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Indeed. For now, let's do all we can to find and dispose of our enemy.

speaker: Marianne
text: It seems there were forces opposing the church, beyond Lord Lonato... I never thought such forces could exist in this world.

speaker: Byleth
text: It makes sense that the church has enemies.

speaker: Marianne
text: I don't understand. What would they have against the church?

speaker: Byleth
text: We only know a small part of this world.

speaker: Marianne
text: I suppose that may be true...

speaker: Hilda
text: Hello! I'm in charge of managing all records for the Golden Deer House. Oh, but I don't have any information of note right now. Go ahead and continue your investigation. And put a little extra effort into it, please!

speaker: Hilda
text: Did you know that, on the last day of the rite, the monastery's open to the general public? It's kinda fun. It makes the place feel like a festival.

speaker: Leonie
text: Seems like donations to the monastery aren't actually kept here. That means the enemy isn't likely to be interested in money. We should turn our attention elsewhere. Then again, I guess some of the plants in the greenhouse could sell for a lot. But that can't really be it, can it?

speaker: Leonie
text: Hey, did you hear? A knight wielding a scythe is roaming around town at night. If he's a villain, I'd like to get the measure of him.

speaker: Rhea
text: Hmm... Might you have come looking for me because you were worried about my safety?

speaker: Byleth
text: I was worried.

speaker: Rhea
text: I am quite all right. But your concern means a great deal.

speaker: Byleth
text: The enemy could have other objectives.

speaker: Rhea
text: I am aware of the possibility. On the day of the ceremony, I am trusting that you will not allow your attention to wander or wane.

speaker: Seteth
text: I've been in town, procuring some supplies for Flayn.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did you encounter any danger?

speaker: Seteth
text: No, but do not concern yourself for my safety. I am very much stronger than I appear.

speaker: Byleth
text: What supplies?

speaker: Seteth
text: Nothing out of the ordinary. Do not trouble yourself over it.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor... I am afraid I have acted a bit childishly toward my brother recently... Given the circumstances, I requested that he provide me with some candies... Silly of me, really. The timing was improper, and I regret it very much now. Oh, but more importantly, this place is off limits, Professor. It is only open to the public on the day of the Goddess's Rite of Rebirth.

speaker: Alois
text: Have you visited the Goddess Tower? It's a sacred place, used for rituals and the like. In general, students aren't allowed entry. But as you'd expect, that rule just excites their curiosity. Some have even tried sneaking in. Well, at least for this month, that kind of behavior is totally unthinkable. We have a lot more security, what with the Goddess's Rite of Rebirth coming up.

speaker: Catherine
text: You'd best keep your distance. In this nervous state, I might just cut you down.

speaker: Byleth
text: Please don't.

speaker: Byleth
text: I dare you to try.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, come on. I'm only kidding!

speaker: Catherine
text: Hey, Professor. You're good-looking, you know that? At the same time, you look like someone who was born to fight. I bet we'd get along. I'm also good-looking and born to fight, heh? Need any help with your class?

speaker: Catherine
text: Feel free to call on me when a fight's brewing. Thunderbrand and I will be there when you need us.

speaker: Shamir
text: You spend too much time roaming the monastery. If you're looking for something, try less aimless wandering.

speaker: Byleth
text: I was thinking about the enemy's objective.

speaker: Shamir
text: Do you even know who the enemy is? You can't know why without knowing who.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not looking for anything.

speaker: Shamir
text: Sure.

speaker: Shamir
text: It's none of my business anyway. I'm just here to take care of enemies who get too close.

speaker: Jeritza
text: You're skilled. Why won't you battle me? Hmph.

speaker: Jeralt
text: What's the matter? You're running all over creation. Ah... You don't believe Lady Rhea is the real target, do you? Even so, the knights have their orders. We can't abandon our duty to guard Lady Rhea. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is an important event for the Church of Seiros. They say it's the day when the goddess will return to walk among us. Not too likely, if you ask me. Uh... Best if you keep that to yourself.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Unbelievable. What a terrifying story. However, an assassination attempt on Lady Rhea is doomed to fail. Pardon? You think the goal may be different than simple assassination? Intriguing. I suppose the priceless objects in this room could perhaps draw thieves. However, there's no one but me who could make use of them...

speaker: Manuela
text: Professor. I hope you're well. As for me, I had a date with a splendid specimen of a knight. But now he's suddenly not in the mood to see me again. I blame all these rumors of a deathly figure showing up in town. Such an uproar must have, beyond reason, drawn his attention away from me.

speaker: Tomas
text: I hear you have fought alongside Catherine. I would wager that her power exceeded your expectations. Had you the chance to witness her Relic? Thunderbrand, glowing red... That glow is a sure sign that her blood contains a Crest that harmonizes with that Hero's Relic.

speaker: Cyril
text: Excuse me, Professor? I just wanted to let you know that Lady Rhea is always real concerned with you. She expects great things, I think. Please don't let her down, OK?

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course not.

speaker: Cyril
text: I hope you're not just saying that.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll see...

speaker: Cyril
text: Ya know what? I'm watching you.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is this month, right? The monastery gates will be thrown wide open on that day! I'll be working as a guide. I hope I get to guide some lovely ladies around... Heh heh...

speaker: Squire
text: The goddess's home is in the sky! She lives on a bright and shining star! But in the spring, you can't see that star. That means she can't protect Fódlan. That's why we all celebrate the day when her star returns to the sky! That's the day of the Rite of Rebirth! See, see? I've been studying! I know just about everything!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: People seem to think that all the Knights of Seiros are equal, but that isn't quite so. There are many distinguishing ranks within the order. For example, there are squires, who are training to become knights, as well as full knights, like myself. Oh, and then we have the holy knights, such as Catherine. Those are the knights that can wield a Hero's Relic.

speaker: Priest
text: About 20 or so years ago there was a big fire in Garreg Mach. On that day, Captain Jeralt went missing. Everyone thought he was dead... It never occurred to me that he might actually have survived. The truly strange part is that, in all those years, he hasn't changed a bit...

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: On the day of the rite, the monastery will be open to the public, including the Holy Mausoleum. The Holy Mausoleum is where the tomb of the divine Seiros lies. There she slumbers, eternally. That's...pretty much all that in there. Just an ancient coffin. It's sealed with a powerful magic, to protect against would-be grave robbers.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Have you heard of the War of the Eagle and Lion? It was the battle that won the Kingdom its independence from the Empire. Even the Church of Seiros had no choice but to recognize the courage of Loog, the King of Lions, who emerged victorious. The church awarded him a crown and the right to govern the Faerghus region, backing him in his bid to found the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus. In return, Loog agreed to make the Church of Seiros the religion of his territory, and permitted them to publicly proselytize across the Kingdom. In the 400 years since, the church and the Kingdom have continued to maintain very close relations.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Something in the monastery that someone might go after? There's so much here I couldn't possibly name just one. Even this here kitchen contains previous wares. Wine bottles from centuries past and the like. I hear that stuff is fancy, but not very drinkable. I doubt anyone would go to the trouble of stealing it.

speaker: Monk
text: It would be terrible if the greenhouse was targeted. The plants in here are incredibly valuable. This place contains the heart of Garreg Mach's 995-year history! So many beautiful flowers... Plants that can save or end lives... They are all my precious children.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: I have heard talk of students wandering the monastery late at night. They wouldn't happen to be from your class, would they? Please keep your students in line, Professor. Kids these days...

speaker: Priest
text: Do you know what this room is? It is the church's treasure vault. I say treasure, but I do not mean silver and gold and jewels. It mostly contains weapons, artifacts, and the like. Anything that would cause too great a stir should it be stolen? No. The church knows better than to store anything too valuable in such an accessible location.

speaker: Monk
text: There are numerous books in this library that you cannot find anywhere else. But once you are here, you can read them easily enough. I doubt someone would go to the trouble of stealing one. Sometimes Seteth will dispose of books that are deemed inappropriate for the monastery, but that's about it. In a way, I suppose that makes those particular volumes more valuable... Right?

speaker: Monk
text: That boy who assists the archbishop... Cyril, I believe? I hear he's originally from a foreign land to the east called Almyra. I know he's still only a child, but I do wonder about his true intentions...

speaker: Hubert
text: The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. Are we going to move forward with our plan?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I believe so. How confident are you in our theory, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: We're not wrong.

speaker: Linhardt
text: No one's intuition is perfect. It's ridiculous not to have doubts.

speaker: Byleth
text: It could go either way.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh, I don't like those odds at all...

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm a little doubtful...

speaker: Petra
text: You have little doubts? That is good. We have no room for big doubts on this day.

speaker: Hubert
text: All that matters is how our enemy makes their move, not how our teacher feels about our plan.

speaker: Seteth
text: You seem a mite too relaxed for my liking. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. While we are in the Goddess Tower, we are relying on you to secure the locations that are lacking in defense.

speaker: Flayn
text: May I let you in on something, Professor? My brother can be a bit...callous. He told me that he was concerned about you, and hinted that perhaps you would be better off patrolling a coffin!

speaker: Seteth
text: That was said in jest, Flayn. And in confidence. Please just remain by my side and do not cause any more trouble. As a professor, you would do well to remember that it is your duty to guide your students down the path of righteousness.

speaker: Flayn
text: Please excuse us, everyone. We shall see you again after the ceremony has concluded!

speaker: Hubert
text: A coffin. How fascinating.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hurry, Professor. We must find a place to hide where we can guard the stairs to the Holy Mausoleum. If the enemy moves as predicted, we should be able to cut off their escape path and capture every last one of them.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is finally here. Let's move ahead with our plan.

speaker: Dedue
text: Leave it to me. Professor, Are you in as well?

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Ingrid
text: We've narrowed down our objective...kind of. So, let's show everyone that we can carry out our duties better than anyone!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure about this.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh dear. Our professor seems to lack confidence in our plan. That is not very reassuring.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm hungry.

speaker: Annette
text: Umm... Oh! Well, I'll be sure to whip you up some tasty treats when this is all over!

speaker: Dimitri
text: We're counting on you, Professor.

speaker: Seteth
text: You seem a mite too relaxed for my liking. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. While we are in the Goddess Tower, we are relying on you to secure the locations that are lacking in defense.

speaker: Flayn
text: May I let you in on something, Professor? My brother can be a bit...callous. He told me that he was concerned about you, and hinted that perhaps you would be better off patrolling a coffin!

speaker: Seteth
text: That was said in jest, Flayn. And in confidence. Please just remain by my side and do not cause any more trouble. As a professor, you would do well to remember that it is your duty to guide your students down the path of righteousness.

speaker: Flayn
text: Please excuse us, everyone. We shall see you again after the ceremony has concluded!

speaker: Dedue
text: It's time.

speaker: Dimitri
text: All right. Let's stick to the plan, and go hide where we can watch over the entrance to the Holy Mausoleum. If anyone suspicious enters, we'll follow them in and take them down. Got it?

speaker: Claude
text: The Rite of Rebirth is finally underway. Time to see if our hunch was right.

speaker: Hilda
text: Ugh, I hope it's not. Then we wouldn't have to fight anyone.

speaker: Byleth
text: Our hunch is right.

speaker: Ignatz
text: We've all come to this conclusion together. I'm sure we got it right.

speaker: Byleth
text: We are mistaken.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Do you really believe that, Professor? Claude certainly looks confident.

speaker: Byleth
text: Only the goddess knows.

speaker: Marianne
text: Dear Goddess... Please protect us...

speaker: Claude
text: Right or wrong, the clock is ticking. All we can do now is stick to the plan.

speaker: Seteth
text: You seem a mite too relaxed for my liking. The Goddess's Rite of Rebirth is about to begin. While we are in the Goddess Tower, we are relying on you to secure the locations that are lacking in defense.

speaker: Flayn
text: May I let you in on something, Professor? My brother can be a bit...callous. He told me that he was concerned about you, and hinted that perhaps you would be better off patrolling a coffin!

speaker: Seteth
text: That was said in jest, Flayn. And in confidence. Please just remain by my side and do not cause any more trouble. As a professor, you would do well to remember that it is your duty to guide your students down the path of righteousness.

speaker: Flayn
text: Please excuse us, everyone. We shall see you again after the ceremony has concluded!

speaker: Hilda
text: Seteth is way too overprotective. He reminds me of my brother.

speaker: Claude
text: Come on, Teach. I know a hidden spot where we can monitor the stairs that lead to the Holy Mausoleum. If there's anyone down there, they'll be trapped like the rats they are. We'll just have to take them down without getting bitten.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We were right. Unwanted gusts have come to visit.

speaker: Mysterious Mage
text: Those Central Church dastards have spotted us... Buy me some time while I open the seal on the casket!

speaker: Western Church Soldier
text: I'm on it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It is as we suspected. The enemy is within.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Our enemy appears to be after the tomb of Saint Seiros in the back. Are they attempting to steal her bones? It would be best to defeat them before the achieve their aim.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Look closely... There are contraptions of some sort on the floor. We must pay attention to our enemies' weapons and advance while attacking them from advantageous positions.

speaker: Mysterious Mage
text: Death Knight! Prove your strength and scatter these fools!

speaker: Death Knight
text: I don't take commands. Or waste my time on weaklings.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That knight is a powerful enemy... Let's do all we can to avoid him.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The enemy is after the casket of Saint Seiros. Do they intend to steal her bones? We must defeat those enemies before they open the casket.

speaker: Dimitri
text: But look closely at the ground... There are contraptions of some sort in place. We'll have to look closely at the enemies' weapons and advance while attacking them from the best positions possible.

speaker: Dimitri
text: That knight looks like he has experience. It would be foolish to challenge him recklessly.

speaker: Claude
text: Our guess was spot on. Looks like we have company.

speaker: Claude
text: Looks like the enemy is going after the casket in the back. Maybe they're going after the saint's bones? Weird. I'd like to defeat them before they can finish the job.

speaker: Claude
text: But did you notice? Look closely at the ground. There's some kind of contraption on certain parts of the floor. The smart move is to advance while finding the best fighting positions we can based on the enemy's weaponry.

speaker: Claude
text: I'm getting a really disturbing vibe from that guy... No one go near the evil-looking knight, OK?

speaker: Mysterious Mage
text: The reinforcements haven't arrived?! If they approach from behind, we can attack them from both sides...

speaker: Mysterious Mage
text: It's no use! The seal is broken. You can't— Huh? A sword?

speaker: Death Knight
text: Like moths to a flame...

speaker: Death Knight
text: I told you that if you fled, I would not chase you. But it seems you wish to die...

speaker: Death Knight
text: I didn't expect to encounter someone like you... How fortunate.

speaker: Mysterious Mage
text: You're too late! The seal will be broken any minute now...

speaker: Mysterious Mage
text: It's no use! The seal is broken. You can't– Huh? A sword?

speaker: Edelgard
text: There's no way around it... I accept your challenge!

speaker: Death Knight
text: Oh? This will be fun...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh my, how frightening! Won't you please go easy on me?

speaker: Death Knight
text: You... Was this meeting...preordained?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm? What do you mean?

speaker: Death Knight
text: That sword is...I see. What a pleasant surprise.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ugh, he got away! That sword... Why is it –

speaker: Hubert
text: That's the sword that was in the casket. Seems to be shimmering, almost as though...

speaker: Dimitri
text: He got away... We have no choice but to let them go for now. Professor... The way that sword is glowing. I wonder...

speaker: Claude
text: The jerk got away. Was that magic? We can't even chase after him. Hey, Professor. The way that sword is shining... Do you think it could be...

speaker: Catherine
text: Is the intruder here?! Oh... Looks like you have this under control. You! Round up any stragglers.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Will do!

speaker: Seteth
text: As all of you have committed a breach of faith, the archbishop will now pass judgement.

speaker: Shamir
text: Inciting a Kingdom noble to rebel. Unlawful entry. The attempted assassination of the archbishop. An attack on the Holy Mausoleum. It is unnecessary to go on, followers of the Western Church.

speaker: Priest
text: What?! We have nothing to do with the Western Church!

speaker: Seteth
text: You have already been identified. Please spare us your second-rate theater.

speaker: Rhea
text: Dishonoring a holy ceremony is worthy of death for a member of the church. You are well past the hope of redemption. If you have any grace remaining, you will willingly offer your life as atonement for this crime.

speaker: Priest
text: No! This isn't what we were told would happen! We've been deceived!

speaker: Shamir
text: It's no use arguing. Whatever your excuse, the punishment stands.

speaker: Rhea
text: May your souls find peace as they return to the goddess...

speaker: Priest
text: Wait! Please! The goddess would never forgive you for our execution!

speaker: Priest
text: Monster! We know you've already slaughtered many of our fellow brethren like this!

speaker: Rhea
text: This concludes the investigation. Please remove these poor, lost souls from my sight.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That's that, I suppose. The assassination attempt, the attack on the Holy Mausoleum... It was all the Western Church's doing. That masked knight who led the attack somehow managed to disappear without a trace.

speaker: Hubert
text: The Church of Seiros clearly isn't as unified as it would hope to appear. It seems the bishop of the Western Church was always opposed to the church being ruled centrally from Garreg Mach. Perhaps they hope to remove the archbishop in order to completely strip the Central Church of its authority.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Western Church...

speaker: Byleth
text: The Central Church?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ugh, that's right. Jeralt mentioned that you were raised without any exposure to the church. In order to function more efficiently, the Church of Seiros is split into several smaller entities. The Central Church is the largest and leads the organization from Garreg Mach.

speaker: Hubert
text: The Western Church extends from Castle Gaspard, where Lord Lonato rebelled into the far west. They can be found just beyond the most renowned stronghold of the Kingdom, the Fortress City of Arianrhod.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It seems the knights have been tasked with subduing the leaders of the Western Church. We may be give an opportunity to help them with their mission.

speaker: Hubert
text: To think...our own professor was born in Fódlan and yet knew nothing of the church. I never imagined explaining something so basic to an instructor of mine. You're something of a special case, are you not?

speaker: Edelgard
text: How strange that the archbishop would ask someone like that to lead her students. There's clearly more to that decision than we know.

speaker: Caspar
text: Lady Rhea is pretty scary sometimes...but to execute that whole group just like that? It seems harsh, even for her.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: If one of us does something bad, I wonder what she would do to us!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Professor... Do you agree with the archbishop's actions?

speaker: Dimitri
text: There you have it... It seems that the assassination attempt and the attack on the Holy Mausoleum were all the work of the Western Church. As for the masked knight who led the attack... I'm afraid his whereabouts are yet unknown.

speaker: Dedue
text: It makes no sense that the Western Church would try such a thing.

speaker: Dimitri
text: It just goes to show that the Church of Seiros is not completely united. The church is led by those here in Garreg Mach, and the Western Church doesn't have a strong voice on its governing council. I imagine the Western Church has harbored some resentment towards the Central Church for a while now.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Western Church...

speaker: Byleth
text: The Central Church?

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ah, that's right. Jeralt did say that you grew up outside the influence of the church. The Church of Seiros is split into a few branches across Fódlan. The largest being the Central Church, which is headquartered right here at Garreg Mach.

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Western Church lies far to the west of Castle Gaspard, where Lord Lonato held his rebellion. It's situated on the far side of the Kingdom's most impressive fortress, Arianrhod. I imagine the Western Church's intention was to eliminate Lady Rhea, and the Central Church's authority along with her. Naturally, the knights will be riding out to question the Western Church's top officials. Or rather...to punish them.

speaker: Dedue
text: When they do, Your Highness, we will likely be asked to carry out said punishment.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Indeed. Now, I don't mean to be rude, Professor, but I must say that your situation is rather unusual. For someone to grow up in Fódlan and yet never have any contact with the Church of Seiros is...it's hard to believe.

speaker: Dedue
text: I wonder why the archbishop would hire someone like that as a professor...

speaker: Ashe
text: So...those people from the Western Church were... Um, Lady Rhea had them killed, didn't she?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Well, of course she did. Going against the teachings of Seiros like that. Quite unforgivable!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Those who stray must be punished, I suppose. That said... Professor, I–

speaker: Claude
text: I suppose that's that. The assassination attempt, the attack on the Holy Mausoleum... Looks like it was all a plot by the Western Church. It's just too bad that that masked knight who was leading the attack got away. Vanished without a trace.

speaker: Hilda
text: But why would the Western Church want to attack Lady Rhea?

speaker: Claude
text: Why? Take your pick of reasons. Relations with the Western Church aren't exactly friendly.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Western Church...

speaker: Byleth
text: What reasons?

speaker: Claude
text: Oh, that's right. Jeralt mentioned that you grew up completely isolated from the church. The Church of Seiros is split into a few different branches across Fódlan. The Central Church is headquartered right here at Garreg Mach.

speaker: Claude
text: Then there's the Western Church. Far west from Castle Gaspard, where Lord Lonato had his little rebellion, is the Fortress City of Arianrhod. It's the strongest fortress in the Kingdom. On the other side of it is the headquarters of the Western Church.

speaker: Hilda
text: Not too smart to bicker with people who worship the same goddess as you.

speaker: Claude
text: The bishop of the Western Church must be pretty ambitious. Probably hopes to split off completely. In which case, he'd need to weaken the Central Church's influence. Killing Rhea is certainly one way to do that. To the shock of no one, I hear the knights have been sent to subdue the leaders of the Western Church. We'll probably get a chance to assist.

speaker: Hilda
text: You're an odd one, aren't you, Professor? How'd you make it this far in life without ever interacting with the church? I can't believe someone like you exists in Fódlan. It's too strange!

speaker: Claude
text: If you think that's weird, consider the fact that Rhea hired Teach despite all that.

speaker: Raphael
text: So, those guys they caught... They all got the axe, right? That's brutal.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Lady Rhea can be rather intimidating at times. In fact...she can be downright terrifying.

speaker: Marianne
text: Professor. Those who cannot be saved must be delivered to the goddess for judgement. Is that not so?

speaker: Seteth
text: There you are, Professor. It seems Lady Rhea would like a word with you. Come with me.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: The archbishop lives. Not that I had ever placed much faith in those swine from the Western Church.

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: I have news, both good and bad. The remains of Seiros were not in the tomb. However, something else was. The Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Ah, the weapon wielded by that thief, the King of Liberation.

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: Thief? Hm. At any rate, it is now in the hands of the academy's new professor. I doubt you will be surprised to hear that the Crest Stone had already been removed from the sword when it was found.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Hmph. As expected. It would be foolish to keep both in the same location.

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: There's more. The professor was able to awaken the sword's true power. Even without the Crest Stone, the sword glowed red. The professor's Crest is compatible. There is no mistaking it.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Absurd. Using a Relic without its Crest Stone should be impossible... The King of Liberation's bloodline should not even... Hmm.

speaker: Flame Emperor
text: They must be allowed to keep it, for now. I do not have enough information about the professor to act. As for your request, I assent. The Death Knight is at your command. Use him well.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Good. I believe I will enjoy this a great deal...

speaker: Rhea
text: I cannot thank you enough for defeating those invaders in the Holy Mausoleum, and especially for protecting the Sword of the Creator. That sword is one of the Heroes' Relics, and the most precious artifact in the church's possession. It is also a weapon of terrifying power. For now...I will entrust the sword to you. Please, use it wisely.

speaker: Seteth
text: Lady Rhea, wait! Do you truly mean to give the Sword of the Creator to this stranger?! Surely it is not the sort of thing that one hands over so readily, even to someone who has the ability to wield it! If someone like Nemesis were to appear again, all of Fódlan would be consumed by war!

speaker: Byleth
text: Nemesis?

speaker: Seteth
text: Nemesis, the King of Liberation. He is an ancient king of mankind who was defeated by Seiros over a thousand years ago. When Fódlan was attacked by wicked gods, it is said that the goddess gifted Nemesis with the Sword of the Creator. Nemesis used that sword to defeat the wicked gods, saving all of Fódlan. Henceforth he was dubbed the King of Liberation. However, his power began to corrupt him until he, himself, turned to the darkness. Saint Seiros was forced to destroy him. Lady Rhea, I beg you to reconsider. Given a little more time, we could more accurately assess this stranger's abilities.

speaker: Rhea
text: No. I have faith, Seteth. Faith that our friend here will not be corrupted by wickedness. Since the death of Nemesis, none have been able to wield the Sword of the Creator. Now, after all those long years of being sealed away, it has returned and found a new master.

speaker: Seteth
text: I...understand. As you wish, Lady Rhea. There you have it, Professor. See that you do not betray the trust the archbishop has seen fit to bestow upon you.

speaker: Sothis
text: The Sword of the Creator. The King of Liberation. Each tale is more confusing than the last! And I really can't read that Rhea at all... That sword is clearly precious... So why is she so keen to gift the thing to you?

speaker: Byleth
text: It certainly is strange.

speaker: Byleth
text: The sword chose me.

speaker: Sothis
text: Is that a fact?

speaker: Sothis
text: I feel as though we have become entangled in a mystery... And there is one more thing that has been plaguing me. The Sword of the Creator... It somehow feels distinct from other Relics we have seen. Such as the one that... Oh goodness, what was her name? Ca... Cat...

speaker: Byleth
text: Catherine?

speaker: Sothis
text: Yes! Her!

speaker: Byleth
text: Cat?

speaker: Sothis
text: What is wrong with that head of yours? Of course it's not a cat! Her name is Catherine.

speaker: Sothis
text: The Sword of the Creator differs from her Thunderbrand in one key way. It bears a hole...where something should have been, but is no more. I despise not knowing what is going on! It...it frightens me. And yet... I place my trust in you. I must. Whatever comes to pass...please swear to cut a path that is your own.

speaker: Claude
text: The Sword of the Creator… Pulled right from the legends. I finally found it, and yet it ended up in Teach's hands. Could I even use it anyway? Damn it. There's no telling what's to come…
